5PQfIyToV1QavXoz6VunlA.text: King's Fish House has become one of my favourite places for seafood.  Seattle is one of my homes away from home, so I am picky when it comes to my seafood preferences.  I want things to be fresh from the ocean and deliciously prepared.  The first time I went to King's, was after an afternoon of running errands.  I had seen it and been uncertain of what to think.  I was seated quickly and given sour dough bread quickly.  The lemondrop martini was perfect.  Many bars get this simple drink wrong, but not King's--it had the sugar rim and perfect balance of lemon juice, vodka, and other ingredents that I wanted. The raw oysters were delicious and presented appetizingly.  My trout almondine was flaky and fresh, served with a wonderful side of rosemary new potatoes.  I felt completely spoilt and decadent when I left.   My other visits have been equally stellar.  One time, the server offered to get me an item not on the regular menu: salmon served on a cedar plank.  The salmon was covered with a delicious assortment of spices and carmelized brown sugar.  It makes me want to get my own cedar plank for cooking.  I can't wait to go back!  The selection and freshness of the raw oysters alone are reasons to check it out, along with the retro decor.  KUDOS!

apxaT11mWMaLhUKOgy8KXw.text: Tried this for the first time Saturday night.  We got there around 9pm and it was still really busy - we waited in the bar and enjoyed bloody marys and popcorn shrimp. Both were excellent.  Once we got seated (about :30min later) we ordered the breaded halibut and the crab legs. I was impressed by the excellent service and overall food quality. I will definitely return and recommend Kings Fish House.

vwPf9bgHX4u61w3MvXINxQ.text: We had a great dinner at King's Fish House tonight.  The meal was delicious and our server Nick was fabulous!  We had a party of 10 and he was on top of everything we needed!

XVqGNhpx2mquiuL9K0vImQ.text: I went here a few days ago and I have to say it was pretty good. The angel hair with shrimp was good. The only complaint is that there wasn't enough of it. They used really shrimp, not the frozen stuff you get at most restaurants. The clam chowder was also very good. The ciopinno was good also. The amount and variety of seafood was good and the sauce it was cooked in was really good. I have had some good, and not so good ciopinno. I have to say this was pretty good.   My waiter was really nice and the atmosphere was great. The only reason I am giving them a four star is because the portion for the angel hair and shrimp was small for the price. They could have also give a couple more pieces of garlic bread with the ciopinno.

A6GjfTOylgiQdU2CkDVAgA.text: After being released from the hospital from digestion problems my diet was very limited. My server was so helpful and made it such a great experience for my mom and I! Saghun was knowledgable, helped with suggestions and made us laugh the entire time. I will definitely be back for the food and I know which server I will be asking for!

ezPK51xkUK9WwssRND_LiQ.text: Relaxed service with excellent waiters and waitress. Andrew was exceptionally attentive, knowledgeable and friendly. Fresh ingredients with thoughtful recipes preparation. Worth the time and money!!!

gXqM4R2Xqsh0QkvbbhNhGQ.text: Bottom line:  Food great--server must have been new or over stressed.  Place was noisy.  We were one of three large groups all seated in the same area, which increased the noise level.   We were a group of 8 -- arriving 10 minutes apart. 2nd  group arrived just as 1st group were getting water which was then given to second group arriving.  One member of first group waited a good 15 minutes to get water and had to ask a couple of times with a dismayed response on part of server that guest would want water.   Drinks took forever .  Server apologized that bar was busy though  we could see no one in the bar.   Food came quickly, was hot and as requested.  4 beet salads were fantastic but they are large.  All servings are large.  Most in the group opted for a only one or two appetizers which were more than adequate as an entree.   A couple of full meals in the group which were beautifully done and excellent quality.  Shared desert of creme brulee was excellent.   We will go back but hope the service has improved a whole lot.

a2HhExz4YWEAbAISwtBfIQ.text: Went here the other night with my bf, it was both our first time there, we wanted to try some oysters and had no idea which ones to get so our waitress Denise recommended getting the sampler.  The sampler was very good and I would definitely recommend anyone who wants to try oysters to order the sampler. Denise made our first time there a great one!

y6qmcjE3JlDCt2O2je1yzQ.text: It was ok seafood. Real unimpressed by chewy calamari overly fried with dipping sauce that is ketchup with a bit of cayenne pepper- gross. Calamari best cooked is lightly fried, with a butter garlic sauce, porchini pepper rings, and a zesty marinara sauce. It also shouldn't be tough or chewy it should melt in your mouth. I had a shrimp in marinara and it didn't have much flavor. This isn't one of the better chains at Tempe Markerplace. I won't be coming back here. I'm from New England so maybe I'm picky....

E3-g_Lnfjio2V_BAUoh0Ow.text: Over cooked lobster and very fishy mussels and clams. This is the not the first time we've been let down here. We will not be coming back.

AEOIvZf6vu0vL09lmNGcnw.text: Hi worst New Years Meal ever, slow service , remake drink3 times, rude manager, incorrect check.

5NhXew8mSyYGqvx7csc5zA.text: Great place for fresh seafood or at least many of the choices are fresh daily. We had a very attentive server. The swordfish was excellent as was my sea bass.  Easy to get to from the Casa Grande area, just about a 40 minute drive fro here.

tp56jPcZi9XLv4-maz8U8Q.text: Can a restaurant get worse and worse every year and still remain open?  I guess so....kings is terrible and huge and gorgeous......I only went there to meet a client halfway.  In the failed Tempe marketplace, where even the Levi store cannot make it sits Kings....an overpriced horrible restaurant that was empty for lunch last Saturday. I would have had better food at jack in the box.  My tacos, which I did complain about, were disgusting....they even messed up the cilantro...which takes effort. You are supposed to use the leaves only...not the stems, the stems are inedible.  I was pulling them out from each bite. Very gracefulI , I was told they were purposely placed there to make a rustic taco....so I guess I can serve a pile of crap and call it rustic? No salsa and stale chips were the perfect accompaniment.... My husband ordered a shrimp salad. The lettuce was old and brown. No one could be bothered to toss it, it had the look of a thrown in handful of each stale ingredient with a tiny amount of shrimp. You could almost see the plastic gloves and the bored underpaid kitchen staff...( wanna bet? ) stay away unless you like bread for dinner. By some miracle the bread is still edible. Please do not believe any good reviews you see here...it is simply impossible that this restaurant transforms into anything but what I saw...a lowly corporate effort........very overpriced.....I would be shocked if they make it year.

MIQh_7fTLdjdbSkiWFxFlg.text: I came here today with my mom for our mother-daughter shopping day. I saw the prices and kind of freaked. Not gonna lie, I was a little worried. I ordered the lemon nut sea bass with the Mac n cheese and garlic mashed potatoes. My mom got the clam linguine. We both fell in love. The Mac and cheese... I can't even describe it. It was amazing. Even my mom was blown away. We left there with full tummies, and a little buzzed. Would definitely come back. Maybe I'll bring the boyfriend here soon. Either way, I'm getting the sea bass.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. My mom having a martini.

KQ2MGMU-arN6EJjMeZoGOQ.text: This is one of the best seafood places in the valley.  The staff are always welcoming and the food never disappoints.  I am a fan of their charbroiled menu and sushi platters. I always take my family of 5 here.  The staff is always accommodating to my big family, especially today.  Our waiter, Michael, made us feel welcomed with his pleasant personality.  He was very attentive to my family's needs.  I always recommend my family and friends to King's Fish House.

yHDuKu9YL-O5N0B86x2tzw.text: Great Chowder! Nice wine by the glass! Their sushi however is the reason for the 4 stars, I've had way better in this area! Definitely will go again & try something different! Great service!

S3BL9xv8yW1Rthg-_LKC_Q.text: Had flown into Mesa for the weekend for business and headed to our favorite restaurant. Had the crab cakes and they were great as usual. Love the staff they are always friendly, we live down here during the winter and try to eat her as much as possible.

pXUev3Qt6NCAEkPhlqnlnw.text: Love dis place. Ashley P in the bar is fabulous. She a redhead after my own heart. Come wine and dine. You will be happy you did.

5F31CLEJl-v5lBKBOkgK_Q.text: Visiting PHX so we wanted to try something we did not have back home. Walked in and was greeted by a friendly hostess who quickly sat us at our table. She did great and earned one of the two stars above. Asked if it was our first visit which it was and continued to welcome us as we walked to our table. Then the waitress came and took our drink orders and also asked if it was out first visit. She then explained the menu in detail and answered our questions. I ordered the fish and chips and my wife ordered the fried shrimp. Up until this point our visit was fine and the helpfulness of the waitress earned the second star. The water tasted funny but we chalked it up to being in a different city. Once the food came I grabbed a fry which they were delicious. The waitress came by and asked how are "first bites" were. Well I had not taken one yet but my wife answered "so far so good". Then I thought to myself that's different, but thought it was cool that she came to check on us right away. Well that first bite of fish was disgusting. The fish was extremely oily and slimy. The batter was raw on the underside or so soggy from the oil that it tasted raw. I really wanted to like it cause I was starving so I tried the other piece, NOPE same nastiness. So I let my plate sit there till the waitress came by again. A few minutes later she came by and instead of asking if everything was ok she asked if I was finished and took my plate. Now, who sees a full plate of food with one small bite missing from the main part of the dish and assumes I'm done and that everything was ok!?!?!  I'm not a child, I'm a full grown 225 pound man. How many grown men that you know eat two bites of a $20 plate and then are full? Not once did she ask again how our meal was. Just brought the check and that was it. So since I wasn't asked I paid for my meal, left a note about the fish and told them to look for my review on Yelp. Then I walked out hungry and ate some McDonald's on the way home. If I can eat McDonald's you know my expectations are not that high but the fish at Kings was so subpar I would have rather paid $20 for a filet - O - fish sandwich. Lol. Needless to say we will not be returning, must've been why the restaurant was so empty at prime dinner time on a Friday night. Should've been a red flag when we walked in. Waitress if your reading this it's nothing against you. I know you didn't cook that crap. But learn from it. You got potential but pay attention.

vskxk8ec4Ar9F9VyTgKSoA.text: Way too expensive for what they give you, and they will get your order wrong.  I had a craving for clam chowder and called around, found out they had it, and placed an order for pick-up. I asked for crackers with my chowder, just to be sure, and they assured me that they'd put that with my order. My husband asked for fish and chips.  When I get there to pick it up and got a look at the receipt I almost fainted. They charged $18 for the fish and chips; the cup of clam chowder was $7 and when I got the bag home and opened it up, it was on the small side for a cup. There were also NO crackers for my clam chowder. The pieces of fish were rather big, but not big enough to warrant spending $18.

N9_34A2IK9iIdIyFLUSFWg.text: So glad we came in. I'm from Ft. Lauderdale, FL. and needed my seafood fix. Best I've had in Arizona, BY FAR! Oysters (4 varieties on my plate alone) crab, shrimp, scallops. I had to try them all. Superb! Thanks, Timber. GREAT Service. Thanks, Patrick. Well run. Amazing meal. (And nice drink list.) We'll be back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cold Seafood Platter! To die for.

wW9mKOWhIs42m8a8BftDiQ.text: I went here a few days ago when I was in town and our waitress Sarah was absolutely amazing!! Anything we asked for she did it with a smile. I am not a huge fish person but she recommended the Salmon and I will definitely be getting it again! Thank you Sarah for the great service and King's Fish House for the amazing food and drinks will be coming back soon!

9fyIYEywNVmtSdDaHPtLGQ.text: Wanted to try someplace new for our girls bi-weekly happy hour so we opted for this place because they had sushi.  The place was dead empty which should have been a red flag.  The waitress seated us and gave us both the happy hour menu and the regular menu.  When we were ready to order some apps & cocktails, the waitress rudely told us that she can't honor the happy hour prices in her area and we would need to move....so why did she even give us the happy hour menu?!   We moved over to the bar where we were greeted by a cold preoccupied snobbish bar tender. We were so uncomfortable ordering because we obviously were not welcome.  When I was ready to order I had to get up and walk over to the bar because our server never returned.   We ordered a few drinks and apps just to try this place out.  Food was mediocre and drinks ok but this def isn't a happy hour place and due to the horrible service we will not be returning.

VKtuQBUe_JdBFAmu2Qwzag.text: Sometime I wonder what happened to Bennigans...and now I know: it's come back as King's Fish House.  And in case you aren't getting the profuse, dripping sarcasm, that's no compliment.   More expensive, far more pretentious, so average yet aims so high.  My food was very, very average. Best thing was the grilled asparagus but balsamic and Parmesan is something I can do myself. Fish was blah. Really. While I certainly didn't ask anyone to taste my fish, I'm telling you, no one you or I know would have sampled my fish and exclaimed, "God, this is good!" because it wasn't. It was BLAND. No smoke flavor, no benefit from plank-cooking. Really, the problem was:                       NO FLAVOR.   And they're not giving anything away. Let me put it to you this way: as I was walking out I passed a 12-top, 12 folks chomping away at a variety of seafood, and all I could think of was the guy who signs that check for $900 is not going home happy. It's a friggin' Bennigans and now it's a $1000 bucks.  Oh, and one more thing: maybe could you let the staff at King's Fish House know:  per State Law: you are not once allowed to touch face/hair/each other while serving food?  Good Lord!  How do you get a foodhandlers card in Maricopa County and not know this?  Hmmm.  Somehow King's Fish House employees missed these memos. Sheesh. Or worse. Its disgusting and I saw at least half a dozen crewmembers ignore this strict food policy.   HAND CONTAMINATION  IS THE MOST COMMON CAUSE OF  FOOD-BORNE ILLNESS. Fact.   IF YOU TOUCH YOUR FACE OR HAIR YOU MUST WASH     Slow Service.  There wasn't one thing, not one instance I encountered in my visit that could've been defined as "prompt". Doesn't the word "tip", stand for "to insure promptness"? Kinda does.   And one more thing, (again): fix your website. I hit "contact us" and got the recipe page. I hit the recipe page link and got recipes. The prices on the menu were not at all current.  IN OTHER WORDS, WHY ISN'T ANYONE AT BENNIGANS, errrrr, KING'S FISH HOUSE -- paying attention to your website?  And one more thing: do ya just take any image, of anyone, anything, put a frame around it, and hang it in the wall?  Is that interior decorating nowadays?  Because they've got stuff on the wall that is so random, so arbitrary, so busy, so nothing-to-do-with-fish, it's not so much "odd"as it is just so ordinary. No one, not even King's Fish House, aspires to ordinary.   So average. Slow service. Buy somebody else's Groupon...or just go around the corner to Portillos. This place blows.

J5sKDHY-6auea1xw2_FM9A.text: Love this place! I eat here all the time and continue to be impressed. Food is always spot on and service is extremely attentive and friendly. Butter cake is amazing if you need a dessert to top off the excellent meal.

Rf-UaizgNEl7KIjCblNuFg.text: Last night my husband and I came in and we had a waitress named Teresa, she was the best server we have ever had. From the moment she came to our table she lit up the room with her smile and made our experience there personal. From the fish and chips to her warm welcoming personality, our experience was 110% excellent.  Even if the food wasn't good, I would go back just to have Teresa serve me again. She was absolutely amazing

AEX9MjC_0e78ESQEl2BR3g.text: My FAVORITE!!! Truth be told, I was raised to believe I was allergic to shellfish. Now I am addicted and love anything that's sea, to be more specific: Lobster and Crab. I have been coming to Kings Fish House for years. During the last few visits we got Cassandra (Cassie) as a waitress. I have to say that I have travel extensively, and living in the desert can be quite scary when it comes to fresh fish. Cassie has been awesome and patient to bring our 5+ lobsters per sitting and a few dozen oysters per sitting  (for only two people) and always great quality that totally taste fresh n. We can not recommend this place enough. This last occasion we got Kaylin as our server. We remembered her from our last time that we visited, since she was the covering manager. I have to say that she is another amazing waitress with superb customer service skills. Very professional to say the least. Now we have two awesome servers to come visit and more breaking records to look forward with amazing lobster to come. Maybe we will do 6 lobsters and 3 dozen oysters next

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States

sdcGghNZGFldF7tte89OWA.text: I was extremely excited to try this place since I love sea food. I went with my boyfriend and his mom. All 3 of us felt that our food was just not good. It tasted funky and service was mediocre. After eating my tilapia, I headed home and felt immediately sick. Long story short, I had the worst food poisoning ever! Will not be returning..

sB-e5-eRUcypwG7BZqhviw.text: Just had a late lunch at King's... the food was amazing, but not as amazing as Kaylin (our server)!! Go here, request her. You won't regret it. Trust me.

_eCODUIqvm0aZ_ZQ7HhF-w.text: We've been here multiple times and have been impressed each visit. So good! Tonight we got a bowl each of the clam chowder and seafood chowder and split them. Toward the end we combined them which was actually better than either separate. We split an order of fish and chips that was more than we could finish after the soup and fresh bread. The service is always excellent and the price is lower than expected.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States

6NVShZJONMU9G7Qnxhqzkw.text: Absolutely delicious. I'm a big Fisher man so I know fresh fish and these guys got it. Well cooked brussel sprouts I'm not a fan of French fries but these French fries are pretty good. I had the logs platter the. Scallops were perfect. Will definitely come here again .

81BAdzhGeHBsC6q6scCIRA.text: Wife and I stopped off at this restaurant for our date night.  The Last time we were there, I asked Michelle, the general manager, when they would have dungeness crab. She said to drop her an email and she would let us know. In mid April I received an email describing the two crab dishes.  Tonight we both both ordered the steam dungeness crab which comes with 2 sides. Started off by splitting a Cesar Salad. The romaine lettuce was cold and crisp with some type of anchovie  dressing. Yummy, that started off our fabulous meal. The crab comes with crab butter which is very flavorful. You have to crack the legs and separate the meat from the body, but HEY, that's what eating dungeness crab is all about. I would get as much meat in the crab butter before tasting it. Working too slow causes the sides and crab to cool down. My side of asparagus was cooked on the grill and was OK, thought it was slughtly overcooked and the baked potato was the way I liked it.  The meal was very filling, so come with an appetite. Restaurant is always clean and our server was knowledgeable  and attentive. Michelle also advised us that they we be serving Soft Shell crab by the end of the month. We'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Steamed dungeness crab.

pNj2yLLt8CyNigEtq7WLUQ.text: The food here was excellent.  I had the Wahoo and the spousal unit had the Mahi Mahi.  Both pieces of fish were beautifully cooked and we enjoyed the asparagus, carrots, Brussels sprouts and zucchini.  So why not a five?  Frankly I didn't feel welcome.  At one point, after a twenty minute wait, I approached the front desk and asked if they would try to find our server.  After a minute, our server ambled over and asked if we wanted something other than just water.  It was just odd and created kind of an awkward feeling in the place.  Maybe other couples  do go out to a restaurant on a Friday evening and just drink water but we kinda wanted some wine and some food.  At the end of the meal, a lovely lady who told us she was the manager asked us who our server was.  We gave her the name and she stated that server is one of her favorites.  Hard to be critical at that point.  I think this restaurant could get a 5 - the food was great.  Just some training on how to interact with other humans would probably help.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Wahoo!!

ko5yLKMx2YpRpgZUk-34Og.text: I think seafood restaurants are one the toughest eateries to do well. I had the sushi plate, and my husband had the Ono grilled. Both were okay, but nothing to brag about.

MriX7a-xwYCDdpq7v-2inQ.text: This place was good! I had the king's albacore roll and the king's spicy seafood chowder. The sushi roll was delicious! The chowder was ok. It's my own lack of knowledge about soup but I was disappointed the chowder wasn't creamy. Now I know chowder means creamy OR chunky.  Plenty of room in the restaurant so you don't feel like you're sitting with the party next to you. Family friendly environment. The service was slow but I will still go back when I'm in the area and craving some seafood.

PgAAKjLw4jWC8pmonucuvQ.text: This place has the tastiest clam chowder I've had anywhere. My boyfriend would agree. We were served by Gilbert and he was absolutely wonderful. When he noticed we hadn't been brought any complimentary bread before the beginning of our meal, he gave us a freshly baked loaf. It was so delicious we didn't mind that we got to enjoy it after our meal! He even offered to bag some up for us to take home since they were closing and planning on throwing the rest out. It was so nice of him - he must have noticed how much I was enjoying it!

5gSinRkn9E1hL-1ZchXQ4w.text: The name says it all. Swordfish taco's were flavorful. Staff attentive. A must return to try more.

zAFYcRnnDzb6i3ZsI4RNGQ.text: A couple of craft brews and the Macadamia Nut Crusted Wild Alaskan Halibut with orange ginger butter sauce. Service was great even for the large group we were. Overall, for a chain restaurant especially, the seafood entree quality was better than expected. I picked the Grilled Zucchini Brushed with olive oil and Grilled Asparagus Topped with balsamic glaze as my two sides and left quite happy. Yes, the Tempe Marketplace is a busy place but at least you can find parking not far away even on a Friday night.

9RA67OcpvvT5MtrS_k2MpA.text: I came here for "easy hour" a while back with my ladies and what can I say...  At 5pm on a Friday, business was crazy busy!  We waited around for about 30 minutes before we were seated.  The wait time isn't so bad when you're guzzling pina colados and bloody marys with great company.    When we finally were seated, we ordered two oyster samplers, the baja ceviche fish cocktail, a garden salad with Caesar dressing on the side [my friend is quirky like that], a hot seafood combo, and the macadamia nut crusted Alaskan halibut.  The oysters were delicious and the ceviche was refreshing.  The salad had ranch dressing poured all over it even though we had asked for Caesar dressing on the side.  When we asked our waitress about this, she apologized and said she'll bring us a new salad in 5mins which actually came out 20mins later after a reminder from my friend.  Oh well.  It's just salad and it *was* pretty busy.  The seafood combo was very flavorful and delicious but the biggest disappointment was the overcooked halibut.  I was most excited for the halibut so when I ate a fork full of dried fish, I was pretty sullen.  My overall experience with King's Fish House wasn't too bad but I think I'll just stick with drinks and oysters the next time I stop by.

64d4t6UQDayi5aMyjImy2g.text: Tried this place out for a second time after Michelle, the manager, reached out to me about my fiance and I's last experience. I really appreciated the extra step in her reaching out and inviting us back for a better experience.  We started out with the raw oyster sampler.. delish! I only wish that the waiter would've stopped by and pointed out which was Oyster was which so I could know which ones to order next time. Otherwise, they arrived in a timely fashion and with all the yummy condiment additions.   I ordered the jumbo lump crab small plate as my entree with a side of grilled asparagus. Nice and filling portions of crab meat, drizzled in a spicy cocktail sauce and atop a bed of diced cucumber. The asparagus side is enough to share between people so don't let the price deter you from ordering it..it comes drizzled in soy sauce and breadcrumbs. For you health nuts, my dish left me satisfied without feeling like I busted my diet. Just maybe don't wash it down with 3 glasses of wine like I did :)  My fiance ordered lobster tail and a medium prepared steak with a sides of mac n' cheese and whipped potatoes. He enjoyed everything (he ate the lobster tail in no time!) but the steak which was a bit over prepared and tough.  Our server did a great job all in all, was attentive without being too in our space.   I truly appreciate Michelle going above and beyond to ensure we had a better experience. We will most definitely return to King's next time we are around Tempe and craving some seafood!

SnV1zlLlAvw0u9y92AEANA.text: I love this place. It is so much better than Red Lobster.   Menus are printed twice per day so the information is up-to-date and you never have anything run out.  The seafood is as fresh as it can be, seeing that we are nowhere near the ocean, and the variety of options is tremendous.  It isn't just your classic steamed with lemon or fried with tartar sauce.    Every experience here has been top notch. I highly recommend this place to anyone in the mood for seafood.

8SOLq7axcwjf9FIXSmifAg.text: I was taken to King's Fish House for my birthday by my wife and daughter.  We were wanting to try a place we had not been before.  Since we live in NW Glendale we were hoping King's would be better than average.  It was.  Oysters were great... not too fishy and a great assortment of sides with it.  Even tried some tuna sushi.  Courses went from scallops to macadamia crusted halibut to N'awlins shrimp.  5 drinks between us and a couple appetizers as well as a couple of deserts.  We requested to be seated outside (it was really nice outside) but no one was out there and it was a Wednesday night... makings for disastrous wait staff problems.  But we had a great waiter who came just the perfect amount of times even though we were "out of the way".  So... It's a 30 mile trek for us... and we won't go back all the time but we will go back when we want a great seafood restaurant!

RlTRtZJ0tcH1hP66EXGisQ.text: How we've lived in the east valley and skipped this place is beyond me. What a gem. Can't find any high quality seafood restaurant better than this. Everything was perfect but of special note was the crusted sand dabs. They serve nice bread with the dinner as well. Nice atmosphere and good service. No need to go to Scottsdale for great restaurants anymore.

qq_atI3fK51M9eGGTPfgBg.text: It's more like 3 1/2 stars. Not a fan but wasn't turned-off either. I guess if the service was quicker the experience would have been more enjoyable ~ That is where I am not a fan. It took FOREVER to get our appetizer...then an eon to get our entrees. It wasn't busy, as there were only 4 occupied tables present (small parties of 2-4). It took 25 minutes for us to receive our Cold Seafood Platter appetizer. Possibly another 10-15 minutes for our entrees after we finished our appetizer. Not sure where the service failure originated, if it was the kitchen or our server. But they were slower than a herd of turtles. I did enjoy my meal. It was definitely enough so fill me up. The quality was good. The taste satisfying. Presentation appealing. I ordered the King Crab Legs that come along with 2 side. I chose the Grilled Zucchini and Caesar Salad. The zucchini was grilled to perfection. The caesar salad was a liitle dry. It could have had a little more dressing added to it. This wasn't my first time here. It won't be the last time either. There are few places in the Phoenix Valley to get select fresh seafood at lunch time. This place beats the socks off of Seafood Market off of Baseline in the Dana Park Plaza. The prices are a little higher but much worth it as the quality of the fish and seafood is exceptional for being in the desert.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. King Crab Legs with Caesar Salad and Grilled Zucchini. MMMMmmmm!

mxizHU2X48nw-qT2EInqhA.text: The hostess was pleasant.  The waiter was courteous and efficient.  For the most part the experience was fine, but we went as a group and most of us echoed what many previous reviews say: it's just plain overpriced.  The food is Denny's quality and Morton's prices.      I got the Cobb Salad which should be easy, but right away my problem was that it was $17 and mostly a plate of iceberg lettuce with a few other ingredients thrown on to break up the bland, pale green presentation.    I expect a bowl of iceberg lettuce to masquerade as a "salad" at McDonald's or maybe as a dinner salad included with a meal at Denny's.  Otherwise iceberg lettuce should never be used outside of a nursing home.    My companions had several other dishes, but all had the same feedback, nothing really wrong, but the prices seemed way out of line for the quality of food that they got.   If you are going to spend $20 to $30 a person for a meal (before alcohol or dessert), you have much, much better options.

_SRRC4BTA6tJhVYX-5vLIw.text: What a wonderful place, amazing food!!  Great service!! I had the most amazing steak and lobster for my birthday dinner!! My first visit and definitely not my last!!

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States

8Wv5P1R68bPUhV5SWblrVA.text: I am a fan of King's I had the beer battered fish and chips and it was pretty good The fish was cooked well and the chips (fries) were fresh I also chose a Mac n cheese as a side  And it too was scrumptious, reminded me of Sauce's Mac n cheese They have a pretty good beer selection I went for the King's blonde ale and again, another good choice  On my next trip I plan on trying the sushi!

kYBs1ZCcurkFDZlJiOobAQ.text: The food is always delicious! The staff is even better! Great place to come and relax with the whole family! Definitely love it here. The bar has an open window connected to the patio. You can sit at the bar inside and get a nice breeze of fresh air! Waiters are very personable and tentative. They make you feel welcome. I would highly recommend this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delicious blue moon at they&#39;re relaxing bar :)

PmVILhBIdcdg5LadnsahAg.text: This was our second time visiting Kings Fish House and the service and food were excellent but I can see why this place is ran very well. Michelle and Patrick both stopped by to see how we were doing and their new manager stopped by as well to make sure we were doing great. Awesome team and managers, we will be back again.

_YZ7NRqcq6dV465ob4lYYg.text: I am giving King's Fish House three stars on customer service and that is about it. After my last review on our poor experience on Mother's Day I was contacted by the manager Kari. She was very nice to have offered to correct the situation and to give King's the chance to correct the problems that we experienced on our last visit.  We arrived tonight around 5:45pm. We were promptly seated and our server arrived within minutes of us being seated. She was very nice and attentive. I asked her how the mojitos were and she suggested that I get one. Unfortunately I would have to say the mojito was probably the best item of the night. My fiance ordered the filet cooked medium and I ordered the King's combo (fried shrimp, fish and scallops). The shrimp were pretty good, the fish was okay and the scallops were just the same as the last time I reported, gritty. My fiance's steak was severely under seasoned and had no flavor at all. He also got a baked potato which instead of being overcooked (previous visit) it was cold in the middle. I got coleslaw and corn as sides. The corn was good but the coleslaw had no flavor at all. For the prices that are charged at this restaurant I cannot believe the quality of food.  I am sorry to say that I will not ever be back here. Thank you Kari for the opportunity to make things right but unfortunately I think the quality of food is out of your hands.

wbKekkPUwQR9OmvLkZofiw.text: Thank god i had a gift certificate with this dump! Food was bland,.no taste, salad was small, for the price, nothing special about this place,.generic facade of a seafood place,.dont waste your money!!

Um-qZVJfktkVOBYWWnPEMA.text: Ate here on Father's Day plus 1, a hot Monday evening!  My son invited me out to celebrate his Dad, a loving gesture.  At 5:15 PM the place was very quiet, but then to be expected on a Monday night after a holiday.  The restaurant had a somewhat rustic appeal to the inner fisherman.  It had a clean look and no fishy odors detected.  The booth was large and comfortable.  Our server was pleasant and efficient.  My son ordered "Jumbo Shrimp Ballerine", (Tomatoes, garlic, basil and white wine) with tail-on shrimp, looked like about 8, with pasta in a mild red sauce with chunks of stewed tomatoes .... (18.95).  Not a lot of flavor but the medium shrimp were fresh tasting.  For starters I had a cup of King's Spicy Seafood Chowder .... (5.25) (but a dollar off with an entree).  Fabulous chowder, loaded with fish and potatoes, very spicy but super delicious.  This alone would  get me to return!  Next came Wild Costa Rican Mahi Mahi.... (21.95) which I ordered blackened, accompanied by Grilled Zucchini and Sauteed Fresh Spinach.  The veggies were vibrantly colored and super fresh tasting.  I had to send back the spinach because it was cold which our waiter did rapidly and graciously.  The fish was perfectly cooked, reminded me of New Orleans.  No room for desert unfortunately.  This is a very nice place for tasty fresh and properly cooked seafood, in a pleasant atmosphere.  I shall return.

q1lY7GSFUDiNgBR6UO4YVg.text: I did not like my meal at all. The swordfish was the thinnest fillets I've ever seen. Made me wonder if it was swordfish. Roasted rosemary potatoes were actually deep-fried and had no Rosemary. The crabcakes tasted more like a plain Fishcake.

EuHcIm8ccbxln0j9xgjBEA.text: $25.50 for a lobster roll that was more potato chips and bread than anything else. Service is horrid. Salad was warm. Hair in Cole slaw. Not impressed!

nNuKkaQbS-d6-jbtidhuPw.text: I got into a seafood kick and convinced a coworker to tag along. There doesn't seem to be a whole lot of non fast-food seafood places in Tempe. Google Maps pointed out King's Fish House.  The menu looks amazing. However lunch during the work week isn't the time to crack shells or have a food coma over an over indulgence. I had fried oysters on the brain and seriously considered several of the 7 or so different raw oysters (the Tempe menu is a little different from the one online).  We started with the fried oyster appetizer. The 5-6 pieces were lightly deep fried and were really oily. The breading didn't have a chance to stay on for very long but the oysters themselves were very tasty. The cocktail sauce was light and the tartar sauce was average. The spicy garlic sauce in a bottle at the table added a little nice kick.  Coworker ordered the skewered scallops and shrimp. They were overcooked. A scallop was cut in half with a fork and it sprung back into place like rubber. The shrimp was dry even with half the shell still on it. The blackened 5-6oz Atlantic salmon (Farmed Cypress Island Salmon) was half good and half very dry and overcooked. A few minutes after ordering, I had a feeling I should have ordered the swordfish. However it was seasoned well, was tasty and had a nice charred flavor to it. The grilled zucchini was very good. But again only half of the very unevenly sliced pieces were grilled - the ungrilled pieces were a bit undercooked (not really that big of a deal) and seemed to have missed all of the seasoning, too. The creamy-looking garlic mashed potatoes looked as if they were plain but had the perfect amount of garlic flavor to it.  There was a little bit of a wait between drinks/appetizer and the main dishes but the service was very good and our server was very attentive. The restaurant is spacious with high ceilings and gave it a roomy feeling.  I've noticed that this place seems to be evenly hit and miss with Yelpers (+grain of salt). The oyster selection will bring me back for another go but having all of our main dishes overcooked was really disappointing.

wpEErcJkDs2OrOA5irC7sQ.text: I came to Kings for the first time on Saturday night and ordered Blackened Swordfish with grilled zucchini and sauteed spinach as my sides. My meal was delicious. The swordfish was juicy and I loved that the spinach was cooked with lemon juice and garlic.  It wasn't extremely busy and the server staff was very attentive. My server, Katie, was very friendly and did a great job checking back with me to see if I was enjoying my meal!  I enjoyed it so much that I went back today for lunch and had the same meal but with mashed potatoes! I sat in Katie's section again and she immediately remembered me. Overall, great food and cozy atmosphere!

UmY-3rp141PCNoYSCMfRfg.text: What a great experience we had. Sat at the bar, Isabel was great. Michelle the GM asked how things were. Great service and team. Will always keep coming back.

JHnEUMFrgWi1n4EoHRR01g.text: This was my fourth time here. As always the quality of the seafood is the best I've had since arriving in Phoenix. Oysters were terrific, chowder (my son's) didn't last long enough for else to try so I'll assume it was good.  The fried combo platter was delicious, the fries were a bit soggy and underwhelming. My son had the grilled scallops and shrimp, they were sweet and toothsome, mac and cheese also didn't last long enough for anyone else to try, so we'll assume again. The hazelnut crusted salmon was meaty and fragrant, the grilled asparagus had a tart/sweet balsamic glaze that was a great accompaniment.  A family sat next to use with a small child. When the child was served his King's Fish House sippy cup, my son instantly recalled the one he had a few years ago. So King's makes good memories for family dinners.  Go there and splurge a little on the raw bar, you wont regret it.

BScKtIbmUlWOXuD8FwJ64Q.text: Excellent meal, wonderful service. Our waiter Andrew is the best!! We especially love the Chipotle ranch dressing and the shrimp taquitos.  Next time we promise to get dessert!

0X6DazHqH67ps2c27YYAKw.text: Totally average quality and taste... over-priced chain. Service is always lacking. I don't go here by my own choice.

KsRxJ0Qp5xoHV0fVn0XQuw.text: Food is so amazing!  We love Callie so much. She is so attentive and friendly.  She is extremely pleasant and we will definitely request her in the future

rMKIn8WCBDGxKHm-E9ULvQ.text: Good food & great service! Our waiter, Aiden, was awesome! We were seated right away on a Friday evening, no wait. This place has an extensive & impressive bar with everything from sake to JD.  My bf loves his sushi & fried fish... being able to get both was cool, but it was just good, not great.  I opted for the sirloin & it was delicious! The fried shrimp was also pretty amazing.

6QiT5UQtvL3mn6vb-V-X4A.text: Ok, I came back. I got the salmon cakes with Brussels sprouts and asparagus. Delicious today! Beat the rush too before 5 pm. Great customer service again! Thank you Michele and the supervisor whose name I didn't get.

7oIMv-ANkfhVS4kM4-6ImQ.text: Nikki our server awesome and helpful - we enjoyed our lunch even more with her thoughtfulness and attention making our "date lunch" that much more fun! Good times

IPaLGmqETApQd4XUHPGh1g.text: This place sucks you in because it is very inviting on the outside and in. I only give it one star because the service was nice. Other than that, the food was terrible and for what it cost it really was so so disappointing. I ordered the shrimp and crab Louie. It came in a big plate and the vegetables were all cut in at least half inch chunks including the red onion and iceberg lettuce. It was very unpleasant to eat. There was some shrimp and crab but all mixed up so you had a hard time telling what was what. Not much either. I am at a loss of who it would have been that prepared this salad. My nine year old granddaughter makes a better salad.   I was with my sister and she ordered the mahi-mahi with a side of spinach and zucchini. Everything was so over cooked it looked like it was three days old and had been warmed up a couple of times. The mahi-mahi was so dry it stuck in her throat. She would have sent it back, but she was so hungry she didn't want to go through the hassle. Being a big chain all over CA you'd think at least they could get the prep and cooking of the food down. We will never come again and will need to warn our friends not to.

LnVNMv1xbtH7a6KRVYdEMg.text: The best seafood in AZ!!! Definitely a well kept secret a must for all seafood lovers !!  The little necks were amazing and soooo fresh !!  The service is top notch!! I will be back !!!   If you love soft shell crab you must order them ! The best for sure :-)

UFgMl90C4LziHMhXEcPVDQ.text: I just got home after a fabulous meal at King's Fish House. From the moment we were greeted until I finished the best Key Lime Pie I've had outside of Key West, everything was perfect. I went reluctantly with some friends because I'm not much of a fish guy, but our server Lori made some excellent suggestions and I was completely satisfied with it all. I started off with a wedge  salad (which I'll go back just for that! ) and at Lori's suggestion,  had the Macadamia Halibut. Suffice it to say, I might be a fish guy now. Buttery, flaky and full of flavor, I was impressed!  Our server was so attentive as well. Drinks never were empty and empty plates disappeared without notice. A 5 star dining experience without the  $$$$  Best part was it was a light enough meal that dessert was a forgone conclusion!  Did I mention how amazing the key lime pie was? As a lifelong fish hater, Kings has won their Crown for me!

MuBPhsp5YOR_OXBrv_4kEg.text: So good! My family said it was the best clam chowder, swordfish, and mashed potatoes they've ever had. We also had scallops, shrimp, tilapia, glazed carrots, baked potato, and mac & cheese, all delicious. The kids menu activity book is really neat. Service and atmosphere were great too.

umS7jm-a7Ny2D97zUUZMWg.text: King's Fish House was awesome!  Four of us went in on a Friday night before an event.  The food was great!  When we told the server that we had a tight schedule, he made sure we got our food quickly and were on time for our event.  Thank you for great food and a great experience!

0CGVlyLQRaoh552wZGaTWg.text: service was OK- food was decent. However what perturbed me was the lack of any nutritional information about the food. Staff had no clue and there was nothing on the menu.. I like to (try) make healthy choices but it feels deceptive to not inform your patrons when they ask you! not saying it needs to be on the menu but there should be a book somewhere about nutritional facts...!  I won't be returning..

i5fMqQ0Sb1-o-1Jt-EOJbQ.text: Stopped in today on a rainy Presidents' Day. Service was attentive without being overbearing. Food and drinks were phenomenal. Place had and old world kind of feel to it. Clean and comfortable. It's a good find we will return to again.

4MmI-UVHQWJ1ac1zKc4f-w.text: I have no idea where to even begin to express my appreciation for this place and their staff....   It was remarkable and extremely nice to enjoy my birthday dinner at such a great delicious restaurant with management out of this world.   Michelle (Manager) was such a beautiful soul. We didn't know if she was a manager or a waitress serving us when we first sat down, until she made that clear 15 minutes in. She made us feel like we were literally guest at her own home. She was welcoming, informative, patient, fast and just soooo awesome!   Although it was sad to see her leave us, she handed us over to a great spunky waitress named Cassandra who was also very sweet and helpful!   The food was amazing!  The Buttercake was fantastic!!!   And If you make a reservation ahead of time they sit your party down quick and fast.   There are no amount of words to express my sincerest appreciation for making the end of my day a great one! We will definitely be back. Thank you so much Michelle! You are such an amazing woman and host!

Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Maui Maui Blackened Fish. Served with my choice of two sides. I got ratatouille and garlic mashed potatoes. Served with a spicy mayo

tWmPcjbdenOZbIC2JIyBBQ.text: Stopped in for happy hour after traveling all day and just getting into PHX. Sat at the bar where Rudy waited provided excellent service as well as a delicious drink. It was light and refreshing with a sprig of thyme and was perfect after a long day. I also ordered an order of fries and ahi poke from the happy hour menu and they were awesome! Ahi poke is one of my favorite dishes and this was one of the best I'd had. At a price of less than $10 for the HH special, it was amazing. As I visit Tempe for work, I will definitely make Kings a first stop on my itinerary from now on. Great food, drinks and service!

bLnJMLoUEjsrIYEyOppyNw.text: Who knew fresh seafood could be prepared beautifully in the desert. Fresh oysters from different locations were served with freshly grated horseradish and cocktail sauce and for the non-traditionalist, two Asian fusion sauces. We all ordered fish with two sides: nut-crusted halibut was firm; lemony creamy sea bass and our favorite, grilled salmon. The sides were generous, too. Service was attentive. Well-done!

qiYR1-wH6lUHQ4M0pQc_kg.text: I really like this place although I've only been here twice.  Here are two things that happened today during lunch that make me give a five-star rating:  1.  My dining companion and I want to share our lunches.  We tell our server and without us asking, he offers to split them in the kitchen for us.  Nice - most restaurants charge for this.  2.  With our fish came not a tiny little slice of lemon that cannot possibly be squeezed without getting it all over one's fingers but instead, a half a lemon!  Wonderful.    I will add the food is quite good - crab cakes, fish and chips.  I really like everything about this restaurant and will definitely be coming back!

DPtZ4A1m9bdJ-QS2rDECMg.text: I love writing a review on seafood-specialty restaurants.  I am deathly allergic to shellfish, so I'm impressed when the staff takes note and ensures that my meal will not result in a call for paramedics.  (Please note - I take the risk because I can eat fish - just not shellfish.)   Our department held their holiday lunch here - great day for patio seating (heaters and wind shields in place made it bright, cheery and comfortable).  GREAT place for a group of 40.   They had set up a special menu for us with 4 soup/salads, 4 entrees and 2 dessert options.  I ordered the Caesar salad, blackened tilapia, and apple cobbler.  I loved that our server checked to make sure that I was good with anchovies in the salad dressing, and ensured me that my food would be prepared in a way not to cross-contaminate with the shrimp orders.   The warm loaves of bread were a big hit with the group.  Those who opted for the seafood chowder and clam chowder really seemed to enjoy them. My meal was perfect - a generous order of fish, seasoned perfectly; grilled zucchini slices and creamy potatoes.  I ate every bite.  My cobbler had the right amount of ice cream.   Great service, good food, and great location.

Y5KsyDn7Gax85OHqtjAtaw.text: I had the King's Combo Platter. The Beer battered fish was a little bit salty for my taste but yummy with the tartar sauce. The fried shrimp and scallops paired well with the cocktail sauce. I tried some of the King Crab and it was a mix between Snow Crab and Lobster as the texture was deliciously dense. I also had a cup of Clam Chowder which was buttery and creamy.

ylz2DExR8aD3QIOkS5AKig.text: I give this place only one star because it the polite thing to do. Otherwise, I would give them a zero! The portion are tiny but the cost remains high. A classic tourist trap for those visiting Tempe. Over priced box store restaurant! Don't find yourself like me ordering what I thought was going to be a real East Coast lobster roll only to find a 4 inch by 1-1/2inch around dinner roll with 2 ounce of canned lobster and a scattering if fries and coleslaw all for a huge price of $20 plus dollars! I thought I had mad a visit to Tiny Town! For the price and portions size don't eat here! Go eat st a Long John Silvers- you'll at least get more food at a fraction of this joints cost with equal quality! I done and out!

PW_eSsczvMUzig58Aja9Pg.text: I hosted an event last night at King's Fish House and everything was totally spot on. No only is the food fresh and delicious, but the staff is over the top knowledgeable, friendly, smart and incredibly professional. The event planner Michelle was a delight to work with as well and made everything super easy. I just showed up and all was perfect. Thank you again everyone from King's Fish House - we will be back very soon!!!

mUi8T4_azCi1rxV1iTa7mA.text: When I'm going to a seafood restaurant I have slightly higher expectations for, well, everything than normal. I know the prices will be higher than most other fair and believe the experience should be better. Feel free to tell me how I'm mistaken.   I had the grilled salmon with zucchini with sauteed spinach. It was fine. Nothing special about it. Nothing about the dish made me think, I have to come back here.

iojEqI4AcSlDZ_NdF3elXw.text: Everything was nice with one glaring exception......stinky, spoiled mussels!  The manager took them, returned and agreed they were bad. Her solution was free dessert and compted the mussels.  Bring big mistake for a fish house.

bo-3gqD83IyEYXk0k1iOkQ.text: I had an amazing experience at Kings Fish House. The food is awesome but the service from Mike Smiley is what keeps me coming back. He is awesome!

uLPQjLI1f0z9fBZmSnEYJA.text: Awesome food, awesome atmosphere. Our server's name was Chris, he was really knowledgeable and provided us excellent service. Never had a bad time here.

HykCJ8FCHN56U6wZyo0bdQ.text: Decided to try this place tonight on a whim. We walked through the first open door we saw, which ended up being the bar. Once we finally walked in the right door we were sat immediately.   My hubby ordered the barbecue shrimp and clam chowder. I had the seafood Cobb. All of our food was great, especially the bbq shrimp. We will definitely order it again.   Service was decent and the ambience was good also. We will definitely go back again.

Tvnxt16Ncgt80gGHWTIQ8Q.text: A super shout out to Claire and Stephen our bartenders!! We ha had the Hama Hama oysters and the amazing bakes mussels!!! We highly recommend sitting in the bar area where you can sit and see the holiday lights come up at dusk! Beautiful and very festive! You can't beat this place for a romantic date night!

tZ79WWcia6wc62aetHU4Mw.text: First time at King's Fish House and it will certainly not be my last. Our server Jessica V was amazing! We started with a Pine Ave per her recommendation and it did not disappoint. Jessica's knowledge with the menu was very helpful. I tried the Macadamia Nut Crusted Halibut and I loved it. The fish was cooked perfectly and the flavors were outstanding. I can't wait to go back and try more. I will be asking for Jessica to take care of us every time!

roTTfqV_xWl_ybCqiBEVvg.text: I had the best experience tonight at king's! Ashley was my server and she helped me choose what to eat, I had the hazelnut salmon she recommended and it was delicious! Finger licking good! Will be back soon!!

B52D2kayYmou8VrRgCT53A.text: We tried this restaurant because it waw a mid point between us and some friends. Decent service, very friendly and excellent with menu suggesions, but just a tad on the slow side. It wasn't even busy the night we were there. Our table got the crab cake appetizer, which was perfectly cooked and seasoned. I got the New England Clam Chowder, which was very good, My wife got the King's Platter, which had fried scallops, beer battered fish and fried shrimp. All cooked to perfection and delicious. I got the grilled swordfish taco's and they were very good. Our friend got the grilled swordfish and it was tender, moist and a ver nice sized portion. Our friend also got the creme brulee and it was perfectly prepared. Well worth the trip to Tempe!!!

nemOLB0JufAKcasLJOZ34Q.text: The only reason I'm wanting EVERYONE to know about this restaurant is because of THE MOST AMAZING MANAGER ASHLEY C. She honestly took what was going to be a horrible visit and made it one of the BEST memories for my family!!! How do you thank such an AMAZING PERSON as ASHLEY C. Do yourself a favor and give them a try it's worth it. Just not the KEY LIME PIE!!!!

RVYDHHVu2-hsBrpGbZgBFw.text: OMG. Had the lemon-nut crusted sea bass with grilled zucchini and sauteed spinach. The fish was cooked to absolute perfection and the veggies were so fresh and seasoned just right. I am HAPPY to have found Kings and will be back when I am in Tempe again!

tkEwDoBEUrbceTJcSKnJUQ.text: Service was ok, food was mediocre, but the prices were outrageous. Over $75 for three double shot cocktails?!?

aU_6ZsfBQceJcZGcdq2hJA.text: Had New Years Day dinner here today with friends and had a great time!! We started with 2 dozen oysters for our appetizers and they were very fresh, which for Arizona is rare.  Our dinners were very good and we sampled 3 desserts- our favorite was the warm butter cake with cold ice cream which was suggested by our awesome waiter Gilbert.  If you eat here- ask for him- he is sarcastically funny and made our evening with his witty personality.  The manager Ashley was very sweet and checked in our table personally several times.  We give them an A+ and made reservations already for a second visit!! Thanks Gilbert and Ashley!

ah0D4OgcX4kgwboHOQdWKg.text: Gilbert was our service and he did an amazing job. He was cheerful and funny. Such a delight. Food was delicious and everything was on time. I would suggest going here for any kind of seafood and ask for Gilbert for your server.

wHkeDhYMaNdIIJjeVkBIpQ.text: I went with family tonight and the food was fabulous. I ordered the Jumbo Shrimp and Linguini. It was to die for. Our server, Jessica, was the best I've ever had wait on me. She was professional, friendly and amazing. If you go, I highly recommend asking for Jessica V. You will NOT be disappointed.

XAUNR7cbwgwBkQFDSoAQ2g.text: So, I don't eat seafood. Let me be honest upfront on that. But I totally enjoyed dinner here! My partner is a huge seafood fan, and he was in heaven with the oysters, crab, shrimp and scallops here. Totally fresh, prepared expertly. Beautiful presentation on the cold platter.  For me, there's lots to choose from. Chicken, excellent pasta, salad. I got the tomato basil ballerine pasta and it was fantastic. I tried the garlic mashed potatoes too. Totally yummy. I have to bring my mom here, as she loves steak and our server told us King's gets its meat from a high-end dealer...so the steak isn't an afterthought in this seafood place. That's very cool. I love the atmosphere, the decor and the feel of the place, too. They only built it a few years ago and it really looks like an older, classic restaurant.  Our server, Timber, was fantastic too. Very friendly, attentive and really seems to enjoy her job. I love that when people are interested and even passionate about what they do!  We are definitely coming back. I'm glad we live nearby!

fZpbSCrl5IqTKT4XmcMnbw.text: Excellent dinner and experience. The seafood, oysters, and beers are fresh and exhilarating!  Loved it!

q-kiyvldv7PuAUWNs5ZliA.text: This place is fantastic!! The oysters are delicious, the halibut is to die for, and Gilbert was fabulous!! Great food, excellent martini and the best service!

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gilbert holding amazing oysters!!! Best oysters and best server!!

EbPYqKdmWSjyISNcJStrQQ.text: Had lunch today at this fine restaurant. It was my wife and I's anniversary she 's in a wheel chair. They were very accommodating. Cassandra was our awesome waitress. We had a friend with us also. The food and service were excellent. Have never had a bad meal there. Plus since it was our anniversary we got our choice of free desert. Thank you Cassandra.

u7hHbMlHUhsAGyH2Fc6__w.text: Cassandra was super fantastic! We love coming here for work lunches and always get great service (along with great food).

dgEmG687_DV7WLB4EIsfEg.text: I was in earlier this evening and had the fish and chips. The food was delicious and the service my family and I received was great! Kimberly was extremely helpful and very friendly. I will definitely be back!

8Ukhw_oSSOjzTWCyxrx3tQ.text: Great food, and great service with a lovely smile from Cassandra! :) We were seated quickly and all of our (many) questions were answered quickly and knowledgeably. I enjoyed the nice dining experience. We'll be back!

93zNuikw2h3acBWSkqoxPA.text: We dined here for lunch the other day and it was delicious. I had the crunchy lobster roll with a side salad and it was a perfect lunch. Jessica was our server and she was on top of everything. Our drinks were always full and she was very sweet. We will be back!

jaXVJ3oPaL9ki81_Hasspg.text: It's been a few years and honestly I can't remember what everyone ordered.  I do remember eating Coconut Mahi Mahi and it was very good.  I would be willing to go back and try some other menu options, though it didn't stand out to me as amazing.

brMm98LKoyF9PbhLsBjh6A.text: We came here for dinner recently.  It was a horrible hot day. So I wanted to go out after being out of town all week. We went in the bar entrance. The bartender sat us in the restaurant ,but where he could see us in the bar. He was our waiter,which was fine until he got busy. M's Fish dinner had to be sent back because it was just not that good and incredibly salty. They did make him another one which came out much better. It was not the worst fish I have ever had, but not the best either.  Maybe because, it is Phoenix and I am comparing it with other cities. But, sad to say I am not a fan. However, the corn was really good. I am not a corn eater normally, but it was cut fresh off the corn and was really good.  The reason I am giving 5 stars is the dessert. It was such good Key lime Pie! I mean really good. They say they make it right there in the restaurant! It tasted just like what I had in The Keys! Who would ever think that you would go for fish and love the dessert instead, but it happened. This is a place I would go to in the future for dessert for sure, the seafood is better than Red Lobster, but that is not saying much. Because, I cannot say I would ever go to a Red Lobster ever again. I might go back here though. Maybe we just need to give it another try.   I thought the cocktail napkins were really cute. The menus are printed up every day so that would indicate they maybe just had a bad fish day. Bathrooms were clean and the parking is easy.

uyFrKdhbwxHJ8w9av7xO7Q.text: Never again... for starters the waitress kept us waiting for 10+ mins to even ask us what to drink... brought us our drinks and never returned. It wasn't until me and my friend decided to leave,  that someone tried to tend to us.   The menu options were not that good either. Hopefully no one else has to experience this.

BMEcFA8BgmkKKM8S8VapGw.text: This King's trip was a birthday dinner for me.  We had never been, reviews were ok and the menu enticing.  So last night we made a reservation for 630. Upon arrival, it is confusing because the entrance is on the north, when parking is behind. So then we went in the wrong door, into the Oyster Bar, not seeing a clear entrance. The hostess was fantastic, and we were seated right away. Our server Steven came to take the drink order promptly, but did not return promptly. I sat there for a good 20 minutes with a super hard chunk of cold bread with warm butter...and no drink. Our drinks were dropped, but we were not asked if we were ready to order or if we had any questions in the menu. And we wait. My pina colada was not well blended and quickly looked like the crushed ice at the bottom of your big gulp after the beverage is gone. Should have just gotten a beer or something else. Our orders are taken. And we wait. The cold platter arrives, which has an ample sampling of shrimp, crab and oysters with the accoutrements. The oysters were fresh and sweet. Horseradish freshly ground. I can't compare the oysters, since I've never had an oyster before. The shrimp were large and also fresh. I was not exactly elated at having to dig the intestinal tract out of most of my shrimp. I wasn't expecting to devein before I eat at a restaurant. The crab was not served with a cracker, so we tried our best on the thinner shelled legs. When we finally see Steven later, we ask for a cracker. And we wait. We finally finish in time for the entrees to arrive with perfect timing. I have the crab cakes with asparagus. Both are tasty and are cooked well. My husband ordered the N'Awlins BBQ shrimp. The sauce was hot but not very flavorful. At least those shrimp had been deveined! There was a random piece of lemon mixed in, and my husband, thinking it a pepper or something, got a big sour surprise! The entrees went well overall. And we wait. The hostess clears our table and my husband has been waiting for another beer for.ever. Steven returns and says "Are you all set and done or did you want dessert?". Maybe I'm crazy, but I found it a bit brash. It's not like I'm getting a free meal and someone told you I'm a crappy tipper (I'm an excellent topper, btw...I was a server once). Dessert (yes I want it! It's my birthday!) was Strawberry Shortcake, but only since they were out of Creme Brulee. Who runs out on Thursday?? Boo. The shortcake was cold, dry and hard. Not impressed.  It is not likely that we will return to King's Fish House.

B-bxwmSDX_V68-2juNcFpg.text: Service: 5/5 server was friendly, honest and very helpful Food: 4/5 food was good but too expensive for what you were getting.   All together we ate ciopinno, grilled salmon with sides, and med pasta with swordfish

DA1jfV3sWzNwLQLL6pW3oQ.text: While visiting Arizona we decided to look for an oyster house/seafood and came across Kings Fish House. We sat at the bar to watch some college football and get some snacks. Our bartender was very knowledgable on menu items and gave us great suggestions. The place is large and clean. You can also go pick out ur own lobster if u want. We decided to pick out three different oysters to try, yellow tail carpaccio, and Mac n Cheese. Yellow tail was like butter and also very spicy! I took off the jalapeno and it was perfection. I highly recommend Naked Cowboy oysters,Those were from NY. We also go Fanny Bay and Hood Canal from WA. Fanny bay were our second favorite it had a crisp taste w a punch at the end. Hood Canal surprisingly was our least favorite, it was way to fishy and "seaweed-ish" not pleasant. Our Mac n cheese was good.I've had better, only criticism on it was that it was a bit dry and stiff. My bf loved his bloody marry and I got a stoli vanilla w iced tea and it hit the spot ! I recommend u come try it out there are plenty of options for every taste bud and they have a neat patio! Come by

GykmZUzD3kixb2fsjGD4gA.text: Well.....strike two for you! After my last bad experience at this restaurant, I was immediately contacted by management. They were very apologetic and assured me that what had happened was not their policy. They followed up with sending me a $50.00 gift card, which was not necessary, but an appreciated good gesture. I gave them another try on January 24, 2018 at about 3pm to be sure to get Happy Hour prices. Well, if you can believe it? It was again a disaster! The first bill brought to me, over charged me by $20.00! I was billed for a premium wine that I did not order @ $12.00 per glass (my wine was $5.50 per glass). I asked the bartender if the wine was not on Happy Hour? He said no, but then admitted he had incorrectly charged me for a different wine. Yes, he was apologetic and corrected that error. Next, I gave him the gift  card that I had been given to pay for my bill. You guessed it!, It was no good!!! I was told by the manager that he could comp my charges ($34.38) but could not give me the remaining balance?! He suggested that I pay for this meal, and he would activate me a new card?! Well in the end he was unable to activate a new card but returned my invalid card w a note stating it was worth $50.00??? I am extremely grateful that I did not have a guest with me as it would have been even more embarrassing.  While I must say they were polite and apologetic, I can't help but wonder what's going on?? Do they pad these bar bills hoping most will just overlook it? Do they not have a petty cash fund to cover such mishaps? To ask a previously dissatisfied customer to pay them again for poor practices? Watch your wallet at this place!!!

KDXwFaXwKf2Xs4pKv9u7mw.text: Decided to try this place when our first choice the Salt Cellar had a 3 hour wait.  We arrived about 6 on a Saturday night to find the place virtually empty, greeted by 2 people at the door, they were pleasant and sat us right away. Waiter greeted us almost immediately with a loaf of sourdough bread. Bread was fresh but cold..would have been so, so much better if it would have been warm.   Husband ordered a lobster crunch roll and a salad to start his meal. The crunch roll was awesome, so very tasty. The salad was one word..meh. Way too much dressing that left the romaine lettuce wilted and soggy, plus the $4.95 price tag was a little excessive for a cup of lettuce, one small tomato wedge and a couple croutons.  Our entrees took FOREVER. The waiter came by several times to fill our drinks and tell us that our food would be out shortly. The couple across from us were seated probably a  good 10 minutes after us, had the same waiter and received their food a good 10 minutes before us. We both ordered the petite filet medium with spiny lobster tail. When our dinner finally arrived my filet was more like medium well and his was medium rare, both lobsters were over cooked slightly. All of the food was tasty just not prepared to our liking. One of my sides was fresh sauteed spinach and it was awesome, garlicky but not to much, the other was a standard baked potato. Husband chose the mac & cheese and coleslaw. Coleslaw was standard deli style, nothing to write home about..neither of us tasted the mac but it did look good, a little on the dry side with a light brown crust.  The meal as a whole was enjoyable taste wise but in all honesty it's just a step up from Red Lobster with a very expensive price tag. For the appetizer, salad,  the 2 entrees and 2 non-alcoholic beverages our tab was $128. Service was good, he refilled our drinks several times and asked if everything was ok..and it was just ok. Restaurant and restrooms were very clean.  I would make a visit back to King's if we were in the area just for that lobster crunch roll, it really was the best part of our meal, but we would probably not make a special trip to go back.  A solid 3.5 stars.

LTgwYg-8ps7QHZbP29tdMg.text: Me and my boyfriend decided to come here and try this restaurant out for the first time. We were greeted immediately and had a table outside in no time. We had a great server who admitted she was training but she was bubbly and answered all of our questions. When her shift ended we had another server named Steven that was always on top of everything. He consistently brought bread and drinks without ya ever having to ask, and brought our food out in minutes and consistently checked on us to make sure we were doing okay. The management of this restaurant should be very proud of their employees and how hard they work. The food was amazing and we left extremely happy. I would recommend this to everyone.

xDzu5uwdnvKS1kHW97cQ9Q.text: I contemplated writing this review for a VERY long time. My last review was a bit scathing, however the manager asked me about my experience and so I decided to give it another go.  Pros: Good service, great bread, AMAZING oysters  My family shared Fanny Bay oysters and they were absolutely wonderful and plated beautifully. The mignonette was also amazing and had a very nuanced flavor. If I come back, it will be for these oysters.   After our appetizers things started to go down hill a little bit. To sum up all our dishes- every fish dish was overcooked. Fish is a delicate protein and should be cooked that way. It shouldn't have a texture that resembles chalk. Besides the fish, everything was quite nice (the sides were tasty). For around $20-$25 dollars per plate, it is not worth it. Portions are also small but it wouldn't have mattered if the food was good-which it wasn't.  The manager obviously cares for this restaurant a lot, unfortunately the chef does not. The seafood is obviously of great quality, and it is truly unfortunate that they have been destroyed by not being cooked correctly. I would only recommend this place perhaps for lunch or if you just want to get some drinks with friends because the bread, service, and oysters were well worth the price tag. Don't come here for anything that is cooked.

4VKql_W4jszqujOzMP8c5A.text: Exceptional food and service! Good good good amazing. Like sugar and spice and everything nice Yum Yum Yum Yum Yum Yum Yum Yum

JMWTU7MzrfeSX00kL3g8Lg.text: Excellent seafood at reasonable prices. Menu is extensive and printed daily to assure availability. Oysters are a must starter. Good sushi also. At lest a dozen fresh fish to choose from daily. Don't missed the mashed potato side.

H2MUPwdFWJ-jlx2L7k07fQ.text: I'm a seafood lover and being away from the ocean it's hard to find fresh fish and shellfish.  Since I've discovered this place, now I'm a regular customer.  Let's start by saying the seafood is reasonably priced for being fresh and seasonal, and I go nuts for the oyster bar!! They print their menu every day, twice a day. So really you may not find the same seafood selection of the day before. They purchase their seafood from all over the world and I particularly love raw Pacific oysters, with lots of lemon. Raw scallops are also delicious! They are covered with a citrusy light sauce and herbs, perhaps to cover the taste of the seawater.  Get a sit at the bar and let Rudy or Stephen take care of you! They're great!!  Their hot dishes are also delicious, from the clam chowder to the lobster roll sandwich, and even the sauteed mussels were not disappointing.  This restaurant is located in Tempe Marketplace just before Thirsty Lion so parking is not an issue.   I'm so glad I live nearby cause I love oysters and there are not many places in town with such selection and quality!

rro6orfcGglylRBrm-GHPg.text: Although many seemingly positive reviews didn't see it.  For the seafood naive this would be great but not for those understanding good food and service with one exception.  Clam chowder - excellent.  Sushi - overpriced especially for the portion size.  Some seafood was bland and over cooked.  Mashed potatoes were very thick like instant.  Manager offered dessert which was chocolate cake and was a very good choice.  Server was more interested in making sure he gave use a check. Knew the manager had spoken to us yet brought us check without checking with manager first. Then had to remind. Should be more customer focused.  Place was not busy on a Friday night. Will only return for the chowder and cake.  After manager came by to tell us he checked with the kitchen and the mashed potatoes all had to be remade as they were made wrong. But didn't offer a discount for serving us bad potatoes.  Summary need training fcooks, staff and management.    Follow up- I was contacted by a manager offering to comp my next visit. Have yet to receive this.

ce2GFudlLYwi1SFdO11pIA.text: Went in to have lunch with my husband on Friday afternoon. We went to the bar area and our waitress/bartender immediately came over to get our drink order and offered us water. She was AWESOME and even helped my husband decide which oysters he wanted to try. The food was AMAZING. This visit we went in there not knowing exactly what to expect because of our last visit BUT the service was WONDERFUL and the food was delicious just like the last time. I also LOVED that the manager came out to make sure our visit was satisfactory! I am so sorry, I do not remember our waitresses name but she was super friendly and helpful. We will definitely return again and again!!

ZlqAFhlPKJuXJE97PVI-cw.text: Ate here a few fridays ago and it was quite busy so my husband and I decided to sit at the bar tops, great decision. We had oysters(kumamotos) to start, followed by chippino for the entree, then finished with a butter cake. Everything was delicious from start to finish.
