q2xbKNFyMqAE8GOYZmj0Dw.text: Very expensive, tiny portions and swordfish so overcooked it was nearly inedible. Service was very good, but not good enough to ever get me to go back. I hate writing negative reviews, but because of the prices I had to submit this review.

Qmm7nCt1PhOmj6t39m3VjA.text: Let me start by saying when I dislike something a lot I try to bring it to the manager or owners atten because I would hope if I was the owner I want 2 know.  I grew up back east and was very spoiled frequently try traveling to New England for getaways, the clam chowder their is so special and so good when I moved to az and tried the chowder here I thought no more I just surrendered the thought of eating it.  I have been frequenting Kings for 8-10 years.  Combined with the fact that they are the only place in AZ who has authentic New England clam chowder, coupled with an excellent friendly sweet and knowledgeable staff which I cannot give a great review if the dining experience is not super pleasurable. You might even be unlucky enough to get a really nice manager who coaxes you into trying their sweet  bread cake, regularly I'm a chocolate guy the sound of sweet cake doesn't excite mr in the least, if your like me never try it! You could become unexpectedly the next addict running to kings to get your fix.  Lastly the fish is the freshest I have tasted in az the fish &chips is better and more enjoyable than a prime rib, much wife always gets the Alaskan I think swordfish with nuts on it that she raved about.  So, 1) excellent dining atmosphere 2) excellent tasting food 3)excellent,competant,  well mannered and knowledgeable wait staff.4)consistency regarding a high level of excellency in taste, service, atmosphere.5) Desserts that are an eleven on a scale of 1 to 10.  For these 5 important reasons I gave them a 5 star, I have only one time ever given a five star rating in my 53 years and it was to another seafood restaurant in San Francisco.  So keep CV up the great wk hat's off to Kin'gs!!!!!

uTGyF1aSTR7VzQr8FYt23g.text: Went in with my girlfriend.   Place was dead.  Sat at the bar.  The bartender was good and attentive.    My girlfriend and I kissed a few times over an hour during dinner and drinks and conversation.   The very small manager "Napoleon Syndrome" came over and asserted himself.    You two are going to need to stop the PDA or you will have to leave.  We have children in the restaurant.    I went to the only table in the place with kids  I apologized to them if they were offended.   They replied we are not at all offended in fact we like our children to see affection. Their is not enough in this world.   We laughed and I walked away and paid my bill for $170 and left the bartender a $40 tip however I will never be back there again due to the managers lack of tact and decency.

8u8uVXI3ndgToj4GfViUZw.text: We arrived 30 minutes early for our reservation. We were immediately seated at a corner table in a side room. That was fine, the room eventually filled up. Our server was nice but she brought every one else bread, butter and cocktail napkin. We got none of the three. The food was good, well cooked. Side offerings were sufficient that I did not have to order a carb, instead spinach and carrots did me well. But where was my bread and butter.  Returned on January 12. Great meal of salmon, grilled asparagus and glazed carrots. Bread and butter was brought with the water. Excellent service and great food. Tonight was 5 stars.

nfePP_8dMUGiRzJzq39oCA.text: We went here for dinner and had Nikki as or server. This was a quiet Thursday night, no wait at all.  She was incredibly patient in explaining the menu and made some wonderful suggestions.  As a table we ordered the kings platter, fried oysters platter, a mahi dinner and a salad.   Nikki brought us some wonderful sourdough bread  to nosh on while we waited.  Everyone's food was good and we had a lovely time.

6LyD4ik4U0K15ldcWtRJZQ.text: I love this restaurant!! The food is off the charts delicious!! I had dinner there this evening and was very impressed with everything! Not only was the food great but so was the service. Our servers name was Lorenzo. This guy did a great job! He was very attentive and really helped guide us through their large menu. He really knew the menu and even did a fancy "tour" and his recommendations were great. Thank you Lorenzo for making our first dining experience here such a pleasure! Also it was very nice that Cassandra, his supervisor stopped by our table! We shall be back to conquer more oysters!

tl9T-_MSENkvL9XC57niog.text: We ordered the mussels with avacado and spicey mayo and they were tasty, tad spicey. The sampler oysters were very flavorful! After eating loads of oysters earlier this year in Capecod and the southern coast of Spain, I thought the oysters at Kings were on the high end of flavor and freshness! Get the Baja spiny lobster before March, they are excellent!! The Alaskan crab were sweet and not soggy and generously full of meat! The sides were done perfectly too.  This seafood is nothing like the bland junk seafood we experienced at Talking stick seafood place. You definitely get what you pay for. There is a wait for the food and it's worth it to eat in leisure and have the food done well. The wait staff was very nice. I give this place a 9 for food, a 2 for mixed drinks and recommended beer or wine, as my husbands bloodymary had a grossly high amount of horseradish. Other than a few minor drink misses, keep up the great aervice and quality.

rN2tPtD9wB9et23b3oBRBA.text: Delicious meal for a party of six. The food was well cooked and feesh. The drinks were great and service impeccable.  Our server was attentive and friendly  throughout.  Food was served in a timely manner.  The cost was such a bargain, we will certainly be back!

zarGfU4mc3EW3tpwwYHzMg.text: Went there for a company outing and we found out that the appetizers are better than the main dish...  The Mediterranean dish was good enough...  The waiter was very friendly and helpful when deciding what to order since it was the first time there...

7uBNiWjyVJ-nu_zFApH5_w.text: Best Lobster Bisque In the world. Got here about 845 pm and were greeted by some very friendly staff - the two bartenders, the great hostess and our awesome waitress Jen. The blackened salmon was spiced and done just perfect and my 2 sides of the sauteed veggies and zucchini were outstanding. Jen was great and checked in on our party frequently and was very attentive and quick. Got me extra lemons and I was just a happy camper. Had no idea there was an extraordinary seafood restaurant right here in Tempe. Love Pappadeux up off the I-17 and Peoria Ave and now have one on this side of town. Nice comfortable and classy atmosphere and feel. Be back soon.

wNQkA5rOSghhyaHAJaiBmQ.text: OMG what a wonderful time and dinner we had at King's!  My sister called to make a reservation for a double birthday celebration - Mom's 99th and my 64th. Sis called the ph# on the website and actually spoke to Heath Bumgardner, VP of sales in CA. He was very helpful and took it upon himself to make the dinner reservation for us. Not only did we get the reservation set up, but when we arrived there were 2 bouquets of flowers and 2 birthday cards signed by all the staff wishing us a happy day! What a surprise and delight! Patrick, Teresa and John met us at the front door and came to our table to wish us happy birthday and to make sure we had everything we needed. We had appetizers of grilled oysters and mussels - which were delicious to say the very least - always a good dish if you are looking for more of the same thing! We moved on to lobster and sea bass - which were all prepared expertly and melted in our mouths. Of course being our birthday we had to have dessert - we shared the cheesecake and key lime pie. I have now officially fell in love with both!.  We will DEFINITELY be back next year for Mom's 100th!!!

zu7AKf7nUVRh4w5w3Z8EJw.text: This must be my mothers favorite restaurant considering we've had her birthday dinner here a few times.  I love the decor, it's location, and the food here is delicious.  Considering we're in Arizona, the fish is excellent, and each dish I've had over the years has been spectacular.  It's no wonder mom wants to go back year after year. come for the bread, stay for the fish :-D

O7HP7PO-K3JfIWgAReBvOw.text: The staff was very nice but the the food was disappointing. My husband ordered fish and chips and I ordered the fried shrimp. 3 of my shrimp tasted pretty good but the last 3 pieces smelled and tasted very fishy, almost like they were unclean. Couldn't finish it. Also got the Mac and cheese for a side and some of the noodles were undercooked but overall has a decent taste. My husbands fish was disgusting. So greasy and soggy and also had a strange unclean fish smell and taste. His side of fries were good though but unfortunately he couldn't even finish his $18 plate. So unless you plan on just eating sides for dinner I'd stay clear of fried fish and shrimp. Here's hoping neither one of us gets sick. Definitely will not be going back.

juzfMxWCVe851Ru3-p973A.text: It was so tasty and fresh !  Def a must try we had the clam shower soup & the drinks were delicioso

wV-lKRJA58HImEOU6Cq62A.text: This is the best oyster bar in AZ....Kaylin our server was very knowledgeable about the food and had a great attitude. Ashley the manager was amazing as well. Our first time dining experience was fantastic, food was top notch. We will definitely be back... a must try

Bs8g9Ekv2rJBW1fFG6Bd4w.text: A decent dinner. Nothing especially stood out, but nothing was wrong, either.  The restaurant was quite crowded; we didn't realize there was a major sporting event the next morning and 100,000 people were carb loading for the marathon. The wait was still only 10 minutes and service was quite good. My biggest issue was that a lot of the space smelled like fish. Husband said, "It's a fish house," but no, it shouldn't have a fishy smell!  Husband ordered a hazelnut encrusted salmon and I had the trout amadine. The fish was perfectly cooked. His was sweet in a sort of surprising way. My fish didn't have a lot of flavor, except what came from the sauce. Sadly, there was not enough sauce to cover the ends of the fish.   I like that you can choose your sides. I had mashed potatoes (good) and spinach (they give you a lot but it's not really seasoned; should have used salt and lemon). Didn't taste husband's but he had zucchini and ratatouille.  There's a lot to get into at this place. Like I said, quite decent.

6Pj7u403nXsHJasHv8DV7g.text: I had grilled Mexican (Baja California) Yellowfin Tuna (rare) with garlic sauteed spinach and grilled zucchini. Very Good!!  Great setting, service was good.    I others in my party really liked theirs too, they had halibut.

JzCX5q5cxGs5-W9n0kv-Iw.text: Eaten at their location in long-beach, CA on many occasions this location I would say to be slightly better I like the blue cheese candied walnut salad (on a diet) the shrimp cocktail was excellent (ok I was a little bad with my diet) I had to have the key lime pie (it's tart, but oh so sweet!)

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shrimp cocktail
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Blue cheese candied walnut salad

IQ6X1ob6RLXWh-i-Cqe2Dw.text: This place is awesome! I was in town visiting family and craving some seafood and the front desk suggested Kings Fish House in a beat. We went in on a Monday evening and got seated quickly. Our servers name was Cassie; she was friendly, attentive, and patient when I couldn't decide on what I wanted. She suggested sushi or the mahi after listening to me waiver. I got the mahi, which was excellent- perfectly seasoned and not overcooked. My boyfriend ended up ordering some sushi also, which he enjoyed. I will definitely be going back whenever I'm in Arizona.

1VAltFEa7axWUccJRibwsQ.text: It is too bad that this location is so far way from home. I have been to several King's Fish House both in AZ and in CA. And have always been very happy.   I am not a fan of the Tempe Market Place area. It is a little difficult to get in and out of.  But I do like the setting.  We were able to sit outdoors and watch people go by which was enjoyable.   We had Salmon for both orders. Very well prepared. Just a nice piece of fish well cooked.   Service was very good.  This is always a go to if we are in the area for a nice piece of fish.

6oivX9pP6dez9h8leLAMig.text: It seems that when we are looking for fresh fish, King's is the go-to place. I think we've been to King's at least five times this year and have tried several of their selections. Always have a great variety of fresh oysters on the half shell....some of our favorites are always on the menu. The menu changes daily, depending on the fresh deliveries of fish. The sushi menu is surprisingly extensive....the ahi poke is expertly prepared and delicious. We like to try other seafood restaurants around the valley, but when we don't want to take a chance.....King's is always dependable.

xbVJ-4F3fAiCJn-uFY91Eg.text: Was VERY pleasantly surprised with King's Fish House!   I was expecting this place to be very mediocre BUT I was in the mood for SEAFOOD so we wandered in...  We went later in the evening, around 8 o'clock or so and we could basically have our pick of the place. For your reading enjoyment, we settled on a booth :)  We ordered a sushi roll, the Rainbow Roll to be specific, and it was hands down the best Rainbow Roll I've ever had (and I've been around the block a couple times when it comes to sushi...). I usually put a touch of ginger on every roll I normally consume. This dining experience-ZERO ginger was used! There was no 'fishiness' to the fish and everything tasted so fresh.  We got the Clam Chowder too. AMAZING.   I got the Cioppino. Definitely a GREAT value for the money. The boyfriend got the Fish-n-Chips. The Fish-n-Chips were a little pricey for what was presented, but no real complaints.    For drinks I got a glass of red and the BF had two on-tap brews. The waiter clued us into a special that was going on at the time. Buy a $100 gift certificate and you received a $20 gift certificate complementary.  We were able to cover all that food, drink and tip with the $100 AND we have TWENTY dollars to go back again.  It's like they want to pay me to stuff my face. Thank you Mr. King Fish house :)

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. The cioppino! If you LOVE all types of SEAFOOD this is a MUST!

O3fHmmXXIb1HzL_jqc2tqQ.text: King's Fish House in Tempe is an awesome restaurant to visit when you're in town. The service was great the hostess was very friendly and especially the GM Michelle went above and beyond to make sure our dinner was up to par. The food was beyond great went there for my birthday and the rest of my family fell in love with the food. And will be visiting again.

dx81sRk4M6W0lhigS9jF2Q.text: FOOD: my mom and I decided to splurge a little and MAY have gotten a little more food than we needed! Ha! CLAM CHOWDER: super yummy! It was creamy (as it should be) and had plenty clams! My favorite thing about the soup was how they chopped the potatoes into small pieces. I know...it's a weird thing to care about, but I do not like big chunks of potatoes so it was perfect! 1/2 DOZEN OYSTER SAMPLER: pretty good, but my mom said she's had better. They were on the smaller side. SHRIMP TAQUITOS: hmmm I think we envisioned these to be made a different way than they were. They weren't horrible, but noting amazing. The shrimp was good, but the wrapper they used was meh.  ROASTED BEETS SALAD: yum!!! So refreshing and delicious! The combination of the beets, nuts, cheese and berries was amazing! Must try (if you like beets)!!!  SERVICE: quick and our server was friendly! No complaints!  PARKING: it's located in the temple marketplace so plenty of free parking.  ATMOSPHERE: Has both indoor and outdoor seating and a lot of space. Very clean and nice decor.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. 1/2 dozen oyster sampler
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Clam chowder, yum!
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shrimp taquitos

RuWj0prVc0JT1VFHk5qBHw.text: While I was in Arizona I was recommended this place. The food was really good but what made the experience memorable was the staff. Rudy is insightful and hilarious with great recommendations and made the day enjoyable. 10/10 would...

QUNvHwaT0HHd7CxtPy96KA.text: Food was great and pleasant atmosphere for a family of five birthday celebration last night.  Our third time at the restaurant.  We highly recommend this place.

MLVtkRKDcNBIW6i8SEmyJQ.text: While meeting friends at the bar. The service was great as well as the food. Gilbert the bartender was personable as well as the management. I recommend this restaurant for atmosphere, service and quality of food / beverage.

pvBbAT_2SZYxhtF7lxP5UQ.text: We went here for an early dinner after some retail therapy in Tempe Marketplace. It was not very crowded for a Sunday evening and we took a booth near the Bar.The interiors are warm and welcoming.Service is friendly but a little laid back.  We just had some Beer (Indian pale ale) and cocktails.The Cosmopolitan was pretty basic nothing extraordinaire! I did like the King's Combo Platter it had Shrimp,scallops,Fish(Cod) with coleslaw and fries with 2 types of dips.The fries can be substituted for mash potatoes or a bunch of other stuff.The scallops and shrimp were crispy and breaded well but the Cod was not crispy and had a little too much oil.  They serve sourdough bread on the table.They also have beautiful outdoor seating. The menu does have a lot of options which i would like to try. Overall it wasn't that Bad and i would go again to check out the Mains.  Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Outdoor seating.
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cosmopolitan.
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Racer 5 IPA(India pale Ale)

m7eA1_iuNyQphwVhjCedBQ.text: This place has the best employees! I usually ask for Richard, as he is the best! I come for lunch about once a week or every other and he always comes out with me tea and is so helpful in deciding what to order! The shrimp Louie salad is so delicious and their homemade dressing is great! I am a big fan of Kings Fish House!!

6bgnhNxiOn-sEcoLtZP2Rw.text: The restaurant was surprisingly empty for a Sunday night at dinner time. The hostess was very friendly and seated us immediately. We received our menus among with a desperate drink menu that was a bit greasy, which we didn't say anything about. The manager came to our table and took or drink order. She was very friendly, knowledgeable and made a great drink recommendation. They use freshly made juice and you could really tell the difference. I would definitely recommend this place for drinks. When our waiter came to the table he introduced himself and wanted to take our order. Although he was nice enough he seemed in a rush to take our order. Our food arrived, presentation was adequate and food was hot. However, the taste was mediocre. Crab cakes were ok, Coleslaw was tasteless, scallops were over cooked. Overall, this restaurant was just okay. In a highly competitive arena they need to up the game or get eaten by the competition.

uVpVGEt9Gy6JcUtHo457wQ.text: Amazing place to enjoy seafood. I always get the lobster roll here and my wife loves the captains platter. Kaylin was my server and she was great. Great suggestions for drinks and dishes. Thanks for a great experience and good seafood

uYwtf-iVZ6607eMDTVIZPQ.text: Amazing dinner for my Mom's  birthday! She so loved her 99th dinner, we had to go back! She received the special treatment that she deserved! Thank you Michelle, Lindsay and Kaylin..and our server..sorry didn't get her name! And the entire staff..it was a very special event for us!!!

7ZTpEWJuHezmMZRCgsOhgg.text: Really great food, the salmon and the halibut are to die for!  Prices however are NOT 2 $$.....unless you feel 20-40 a plate are low cost?  This is easily a $$$ to $$$$ eatery.....

2P-T6LVygMmPNRkcu3j0kQ.text: Please explain how it is unclear that My visit wasn't firsthand when I stated the date and time I walked into the restaurant?  I WALKED INTO THE RESTAURANT AND COULD NOT EAT THERE.  Stop removing a valid post.  If you are ashamed of your corporate practices, change them.  I was a patron.  I have been a patron, this is a firsthand experience.  Let's see, I walked into the restaurant on 3/13 at 2:2 and wanted to meet a friend for lunch.  Until I saw the sign preventing someone from lawfully carrying a concealed weapon therefore I had to abide by the Arizona Law which prevented me from having a delicious lunch.  Then, I posted the below feedback which led to a Yelp complaint where someone said I wasn't a customer.  If walking into the restaurant with every expectation of having lunch was met then seeing a sign preventing me from dining doesn't make me a customer then I am unsure what the term means.  Below was my initial post.  After visiting this restaurant for years, I always enter through the oyster bar door but something told me to check their front door where a sign "preventing" guns from being lawfully carried inside hung proudly next to the door.  Not wanting to break the law, I immediately exited.  96% of all mass shootings happen in supposed gun free zones.  The restaurant management has every right to not allow lawful carry inside their restaurant and I will find another seafood restaurant to visit.  I encourage any law abiding citizen to do the same if they practice their 2nd Amendment rights.  Now, before the Yelp content police censor this post, I visited the restaurant and I am expressing my concern with their policies regarding patrons

0sw3HiIKEiFW2vQMbmIzaw.text: Kings is one of my favorite go-to lunch spot.  Tried something new today (Sand Dabs) at the suggestion of Cassandra!  Thanks so much for the great service and recommendation!  Another great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Parmesan crusted Alaskan Sand Dabs, Brussel Sprouts, and Asparagus!  Fantastic!

mPkCxqs4PrC7I_-RWOV42g.text: My boyfriend and I came out here for dinner one night. Our server's name was Sarah and she seriously made our night. She suggested the bay scallops and oh my god, they were amazing. She also frequently refilled our water and checked on us often enough but not so often that you get annoyed, you know? Definitely an enjoyable experience.

TyRvbCvBhgJppQVFACAilA.text: So you think that because this is a chain the quality of the seafood and its preparation could never be good as what you grew up with (for those of you who of course grew up on the ocean - in my case Long Island and New England).  Well, the answer is... it is a chain and it could NEVER be as equally as good.  Here comes the BIG however...  (big)HOWEVER(big), for what this place is I gotta tell ya, you can get a "thank you that was oh so close" meal here.    Firstly, the warm bread that they give you unlimited amounts of may be the best in Phoenix.  (Dude, did you just say bread?). Yes, I did!  Bread never tasted so perfect, so yummy.  Fresh out of the oven and perfect every time.    As for the meals, some are better than others and their menu here is VERY seasonal - changes out daily almost.  That said, soft shell crab was in season when we went and a bunch of us got it "Picatta" style - lemon, butter and capers.  And... Wait for it.  Wait for it... It really was almost a 10 out of 10.  Just so so good.    Thank you Kings Fish House for bringing Long Island to me and my family. Thank you for making such a beautifully prepared dish.  Thank you for making me smile inside (in my mouth and stomach) and out.    P.S. So I have heard, the meats and pastas are good not great.  So do as the Romans do... When at Kings Fish House, get FISH man!  You'll be glad you did.

DyaoF-WcEKjaKa8LX1vA_A.text: Dinner was delicious and our server Ken was outstanding. For my first time here I had a wonderfully pleasant time. I'd definitely come back.

7cPCmBIUZ-mVJIphbRvvYA.text: Had lunch on Tuesday their clam chowder was very good. They start you off with a sour dough bread plate with whipped butter very good. I had the shrimp and scallops with mashed potatoes and Mac and cheese all very good. Could have used a few more scallops on the plate. Dessert was homemade butter cake with homemade vanilla ice cream. My friend had the New Orleans shrimp plate that was good and she had the bread pudding for dessert which she loved. All very good food. Service was good. The food served quickly. Overall nice lunch. Been there 3 times and each time no complaints.

T-3lMYxuCPDCaoMgKYWS-g.text: Rudy, our waiter, was awesome! The grilled tilapia and blackened mahi mahi were great!!

gPHNvyUFQoNQ6NYeZ0RS9g.text: This is by far the best seafood restaurant in the greater Phoenix area! I have tried others and none compare Kings. Kaylin was my server and she was phenomenal. She was very attentive, personable and quite knowledgeable about the menu.  There were many items on the menu that sounded beyond desirable and I couldn't decide. She suggested their seasonal dish called Cedar Plank Roasted salmon which was just as amazing as her service! This definitely will not be the last time I come into Kings Fish House

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States

qIRBHYQQZH9mEdxXLs2XIQ.text: After initially posting a review of the poor experience I had, management got in touch with me and wanted to fix it. I went a second time and really enjoyed the service. The waitress was really helpful and kind, and both entrees ordered tasted pretty good. Not the best food ever, but definitely does the job if you're looking for accessible seafood in Tempe. My mind has been changed!

AIYFCW3U69lG8O00eTx2nQ.text: Met a friend for lunch here today (3/13/15) and had a very nice lunch.  I had the Albacore Tuna Salad and it was really very good.  She had the fish and chips and it looked very good also.  The server was very accommodating and although I have been there several times, I will always go back.  Food has always been good.  Not necessarily inexpensive but that is usually the case at good seafood restaurants here in AZ.  It always seems fresh!!

ZeelabJr0Ahh8N-yJQLKPA.text: Finding a FRESH Seafood Restaurant in Arizona can almost always be a chore so we were delighted when they presented us with a menu printed daily with a great selection of fish - shellfish etc.  We immediately got the party started with a selection of several oyster types harvested from Canada to Mexico and were amazed when they arrived super fresh and prepared correctly.  Very uncommon to get them so fresh without grit or shell pieces.  Without doubt the best we've have had in Arizona.  Im a Clam Chowder fanatic and I cant believe I'm saying this but this place had the best of anything I've tasted on either coast.  The chowder was filled with fresh clams not chunks of potato filler much appreciated!  Seems like we ordered one of everything and all of it was fantastic never experience a fishy smell or taste the entire meal the way fresh fish should be.  Nice atmosphere and a cool little pub area makes this place my favorite Fish House.  Prices are fair for this type of meal possibly a little steep for the Tempe Mall I would imagine they could triple their ROI with a location in North Scottsdale hint hint.  Anyway this place is well worth the 30 minute trip from our home and we will be back again soon.  Forgot to mention they have great craft packets to keep the kids busy at the table better than any other restaurant - our six and eight year old girls loved it.

pVs8w4yy19vBzwx9-xK7SA.text: I have been going to King's for a little over a year and normally the overall experience is quite pleasant. Unfortunately my last two visits have been less than ideal. The food was great, the service was good, what was wrong?  The sulfuric odor that managed to fill the entire place. Two visits ago I figured they were having a sewage backup problem which seems to be common in Tempe. I gave it a couple weeks and went back with my family. The problem seemed to be a bit worse, we even tried changing tables to see if it would help. No luck.  We mentioned the smell to the waiter, he hesitated nervously and explained that he couldn't smell anything.  I figure I'll give them a few months and try again.

gYF3PbihPFLztqTlIob3Yw.text: It started with the waiter- horrible, then went downhill from there.  The sea bass was brown inside, the filet was tough and had a horrible taste,  the crab cakes were served with tartar sauce and were bland.  The waiter rarely came around and when he did, it was like he was forced to and doing us a favor.  Do yourself a favor,  DO NOT come here, there are much better seafood restaurants to go to that also treat you better.

RL1yL2w19YFBWpOtJ7pwuQ.text: Went in for the first time and I must say I am FIVE star impressed. Went in alone and sat at the bar and a delightful gentleman named Chris G helped me. Since I wasn't familiar with the menu, he suggested a bunch of different options. Went with a sushi roll which was delicious. I was hankering for something else light, and Chris recommended the grilled zucchini. BEST decision ever! Soooo good. I sincerely appreciate Chris and his great personality and way he guided me through the experience. And the menu, yes please! I'll definitely be back, especially to see Chris! Thank you thank you!!

uNjE4W4GTD94RHCLlwKEIQ.text: This place is terrible.  The only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because the waitress was very nice and tried to be accommodating.  Having lived on both coasts, I'm always skeptical of going to seafood restaurants in landlocked states, and have actually had some good experiences, but this place was an EPIC FAIL.  It was way overpriced for th quality and quantity of food provided.  We ordered the crab cakes to start, and they were mostly breading.  I didn't even see any crab, just grayish and mushy-looking filling, so I didn't even try it.  My friend ended up sending them back and just got some grilled shrimp instead.  I ordered the Cioppino, which looked and smelled good when it came, but it had several issues.  It was lacking in flavor, the squid and pieces of fish were ridiculously tiny and the crab legs provided were the legs with the least amount of meat.  For $26, I expected to be impressed.  Waste of money!  My friend ordered the salmon and seemed to be pleased with it, but its pretty hard to screw up a simple salmon filet.  I do not recommend this restaurant at all!

RzTZZ_u2FkCjPot0v5x-WA.text: We decided to stop in tonight after some shopping at the Tempe Market Place.  We haven't been there in a while and we all felt like seafood, and Kings is our go to sea food place.  I will start off by saying that our server John was very attentive and never had to be reminded of anything.  Very much a plus when you want to have a nice evening.  I ordered something not on the menu and he asked the kitchen if they were able to prepare my scallops the way i like them which is pan seared.  The only thing I suggested after I got them is that they should have been seasoned with a sprinkle of salt and pepper. Otherwise they were perfectly cooked, not crowded in the pan which as any cook worth their salt would know that steams scallops and they become rubbery.  These had a great sear on them.  My husband had linguini and clams and he really enjoyed that the clams came out in their shells because he said they were fresh and not canned white clam sauce.  Of course I would be remiss if I did not mention that this is about the only place in Phoenix that you can get sourdough bread that tastes like the piers in San Fransisco.  To finish off our night the manager Miriam came over to ask us how everything was and we were happy to tell her how great the service was and she told us that John had only been there a short time.  I told her they need to keep him because he made the night worth our while as well as the food.  Good job folks keep it up!  We'll be back when it is wild salmon season.

r4FDflsV6jOaFI6rCkYk0Q.text: Pretty good, not so sure on how fresh the oysters were. Service was good, food not bad for a mall restaurant

yyG7lF2BRYSaY7dvUCwkLA.text: I had the char broiled sea scallops and they were cooked perfectly. My husband had linguini with clams and he loved his also. If we didn't live 6 hours away this would be our new favorite.

y-3Jmy3EkMQXzvcTVaGZhA.text: Payed 20+ bucks for a piece of wahoo the size of a fun size snickers bar, overcooked to the point that it tasted like a burnt pork chop. Drink sat empty for multiple 15-20 minute intervals. Total bill came out to $125,  yet everybody left still hungry. Hell of a way to waste a birthday dinner. Should've been tipped off by the fact that there was nobody waiting to be seated on a Friday night.

TZA6nB9JvGwnyAuu7AZUUg.text: Granted with a seafood menu that changes daily, due to availability, it certainly is a fine find for Phoenix.  However we had some mixed reviews.  We both had the spicy seafood chowder.  It was extremely good with plenty of seafood, had a nice favorful taste but not necessarily "spicy", but that's our taste and we would most definitely order it again.  Just don't be put off by the "spicy" label.  The bread is awesome.  I had the Ahi tuna and my partner had the whaoo.  Perhaps it was simply an off day but the tuna they served me was full of membrane (grizzle).  Out waiter saw the piece after he served it and was very quick to remove and replace it.  The sauce that accompanied it was tasteless and couldn't figure out what it was or suppose to be.  I had to request wasabi which typically always comes with ahi. The garlic mashed potato's were a garlic lovers dream.  Now to the wahoo.  We were surprised to see it offered in the desert as we always order it when on the Yucatan.  If you haven't had the pleasure it is a firm white fish with a distinct taste.  Unfortunately, this piece was overcooked and thus dry.    So perhaps an off day for the kitchen and with that much fresh fish combined with the length of time they have been in operation, we will definitely give it another try.

GDjXCigI5d77dXXlbe99nw.text: I come here for the oysters and a cadillac margarita.  And it is awesome, every time. They have possibly the best oysters in Phoenix (shhh!).  The kids gets fish and chips when we visit, and from what i've sampled, that is good too.  As for the rest of the menu?  Who knows.   The options are plentiful, but nothing inspires me to stray from my usual.  For whatever reason this place is not very popular, which means you can get a nice booth to yourself.  Steep prices, location, or fade-into-the-background vibe could be a factor for keeping others away...  but personally, I like that it isn't too crowded.  Sometimes you want  a spot to get away from noise and this fits the bill.

74GFpfbHe_XYCrrkch2QpQ.text: Surprisingly decent variety and quality of seafood for a chain restaurant. I've had several business lunches here and it hit the mark. The service tends to be substandard similar to what you'd expect from a chili's waiter making near the poverty line and being forced to wear an obnoxious amount of flair.

-1FkT9t7iCnDzpDykM_2RA.text: Nice establishment. Booths are nice and long so you aren't crammed into the persons arm, next to you. The menu provided a pretty decent selection. They have a lot of oyster and clam options, but I didn't try any as I don't like oysters or clams. The rest of the menu offered some great fish dishes and some steaks, salads and burgers. I opted for the king crab legs, they were hot and tasty. The sides were pretty good, although the garlic potatoes were just a bit on the dry side. Hubby got a Filet mignon. It was grilled perfect, and very good. He wasn't a fan of the cooked spinach side, but everything else was good. He enjoyed the coffee stout, and said it was nice because it didn't have an "after-bite" like some of the stouts can.  Our waiter was a 8/10. Although at first he got our drinks and then didn't return to our table for almost 10 minutes, once he came and got out order, he was much more attentive, and came to refill our drinks often. We sat and visited for quite a while, so we were sure to drop some extra tip on the table since we took up one of his booths. Overall, I was pleased with the visit. We will return again.

WBV7vWr_oL21_pVZTZMnsQ.text: Food was great, and Timber's service was truly exceptional.

58_DxY5bFM6-M32dlzD_Lg.text: I was contacted by the manager, Michelle, who apologized for our poor experience and invited us back.  It took a couple months for us to make it back, but our second experience was amazing. We didn't ask to speak to Michelle until after we had already been seated by a friendly hostess, quickly received cocktails from one of the staff helping our server and then been greeted by our server who took our appetizer order. We then met Michelle and she remembered us from our review and was happy to see us back in. Soon afterwards  are appetizers arrived--a delicious sample of oysters on the half-shell--followed soon after (without rushing) by our entrees. They even allowed us to customize a kids meal for our son who is gluten-free. Everything was prepared exceptionally well and was quite delicious. Our waitress checked on us at just the right frequently, Michelle said hello again and we were asked about dessert without it being "pushed" on us (we passed as no room after the yummy dinner).  Doggie bags and the check were brought out and handled timely.  We must have just caught people on an "off" night last time. We'll be back to King's for sure in the future.

rgFPIvDaN3r4VE60RFCYhw.text: Funny thing eating at King's Fish House, I ordered the cheeseburger. Well, it was the very best cheeseburger I ever ate. It was covered with swiss cheese and sauteed mushroom and cooked to perfection.  The service from our waiter Jason was excellent! He was very attentive to our family and took the time to explain the menu and answer any of our questions. I highly recommend King's Fish House for it's YUMMY food and for the service of Jason. We will come again!                             Sarah

ueiSPWMkO61uTIORgFs8PA.text: The Hostess that was very friendly and happy.  We didn't have the best service but the management went above and beyond to help ammend things.  I was impressed by the managements customer service skills and communication skills.  This is the type of management every restaurant should have.

KD2R2MLPWM6qLdnVEp7M_A.text: Dined here and had another phenomenal experience. Service was great and it seemed like the entire wait staff/server staff/busser staff was in synch. I always appreciate it when staff at restaurants are all willing to help, regardless of their "job". It's not often that I crave a fish dinner, but when I do, I can count on King's Fish House to hit the spot. The food is good, the service is good, and the atmosphere is great. I would highly recommend it to anyone.

yf7thfEe-H81TW7y7XoHkQ.text: Okay, I'm fron Orange County, California and seafood is a staple for me. King's was a definite go to restaurant even when I lived close to the coast. It simply cannot be beat. Now imagine that freshness and quality in the middle of a desert at a place that only uses their freezer for ice cream.... Yeah, super fresh and super tasty. We started with the dozen sampler of oysters which was phenomenal. We then had the house salad and the AMAZING sourdough bread and butter. Let me just tell you, I could have had the bread, salad, and oysters and called it a day and been happy. For the main course my girlfriend had the filet and lobster tail and I had the linguini with clams. You simply cannot do better than this. King's is the King. The staff is super polite, friendly, and speedy. The general manager even came out to make sure we were doing well. Best place to go for a high quality meal that will never let you down!!!

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. The most amazing oyster sampler anywhere.

KVaY2TkKvKY1lQ6GJjZtDg.text: Food is very decent here. I enjoyed my trout and sides very much. The grilled zucchini was quite tasty. My daughter had the yellowtail and loved it. My friend had the fried combo platter and it was also great. Service was extremely slow and lackluster. Our server was disinterested and inattentive, not filling water glasses, no bread for the table when asked, and order confusion. The wine we ordered tasted old, but we did receive a 2nd glass gratis, thank you!!! I do like the menu here, and will be back. But I will hope for better service.

MP1r3We04EzucrIG6Z62AQ.text: I was very disappointed with our dinner here last evening. Starting with freezer burned bread that was terrible. Our food was tasteless and the worst part was the small flies buzzing around our heads and food. When I mentioned it to our waitress (who was very nice) she acted like it was normal for them to be there. No apologies or can I move you - nothing. There was literally a swarm you could see! Mahi Mahi & Swordfish was over cooked and dry, trout was tasteless. When several flies flew into our wine glasses and we didn't want  to drink them, I complain to the waitress again, who said oh I'm sorry let me get you another one. She literally brought back less wine in the glass than what we lost - guess they didn't want to spoil us.;( Prices reflect expectations of better food and definitely no bugs. Next Call is to health Dept as that can't be acceptable!   Update: I received a call from the General Manager of this Restaurant who actually read my review and called me to apologize. She said they used my feedback in their training seminar to ensure this would never happen again. I must say, I was impressed with her sincerity and willingness to improve their service.  Thus I've adjusted my review because it's not how you fall - but how you get up!  Thank you for caring. I'll be back.

Fo76GsZVYYlj3AzbHW4_dw.text: Came last Friday night for my birthday.  Had drinks, apps, dinner and dessert.  I got there a little early so was able to find open seating in the bar area (which was a nice sized booth that comfortably fit four) and the waiter/bartender was very nice.  We had wine and beer, then ordered two types of oysters on the half shell.  They were INCREDIBLE!  I had not had them before so I wasn't sure how I would like it, but I LOVED them.  At the recommendation of the server, we got the Kumamota and the Black Duck Salts.  Served w fresh horseradish, cocktail sauce, a white wine sauce, and a new mango habanero (DELISH) and they were OUTstanding.  Also had the edamame (salted) which was good.    For dinner we tried: blackened swordfish, Parmesan crusted ono, grilled ono, and fish and chips which the waitress said were the best she has ever had.  They were good, it was all good!!  I highly recommend the Parmesan crusted ono and the blackened swordfish!!  The Brussels sprouts are good, too!!    We finished off w a shared Jack Daniels Bread Pudding.  I would go back weekly just for the oysters and the bread pudding!!  (Okay, and the Wine of course)   Try it out if you're in the Tempe Marketplace area

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States

GOONC66gSDVlVvH4-muZnw.text: Did someone say fresh fish??? Yes please. Had an amazing lunch yesterday at Kings Fish house. It is Halibut season and they did not disappoint. We had the Macadamia Nut Crusted Halibut with an orange butter sauce with mashed potatoes and grilled zucchini and we add on some grilled asparagus!!!   We also had the  Crab and  avocado toast that was absolutely out of this world!!! The bartender was on top of it and new the menu like the back of his hand.  We will be back very soon!! Thank you Kings for a great meal!!! CHEERS

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. what a great start to a Wednesday!!
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Crab and Avocado Toast!! Yummy!!
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Macadamia Crusted Halibut!!!

PWUlLUwsegJgHpyYAK8fwA.text: After a lackluster first impression, Michelle, the GM reached out to invite us back for a better experience. We ordered a sushi roll to start and I thought it was great. Our entrees were delicious and I Highly recommend the crusted halibut. For the price, I expect a higher level of customer service. Our interactions with the hostess and servers just seemed a bit cold. A smile goes a long way. If you are looking for a delicious seafood meal, I highly recommend King's Fish House. Service is a bit slow, but overall a decent experience.

FlXdCH4094QcfgcdYX1big.text: Excellent service and the food was delicious. I enjoyed my steamed crab so very much!!! Great clam chowder too. Very good selection of fresh grilled fish and great sides to choose from. Butter cake was awesome too!

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Steamed crab and mashed potatoes

_FddXx2rEIlEY3RtxfhITA.text: We had a large group here, and it was amazing how wonderful the service was! Even with the loud big group our servers were incredibly patient and friendly, and did everything they could to get everything out in a timely fashion. We had a couple cocktails which were great. Their food was good - not the best seafood I'd ever eaten, but definitely nothing to truly complain about. Prices are high, but that is typical in a seafood restaurant... especially one in the middle of the desert! We will probably come back at some point. Overall we had a very lovely evening.

ibataZ7yj3bN3qWZB9ushw.text: When I went there it took me a while to be noticed be an employee to be seated, about 10 minutes in a somewhat empty restaurant, but  once I was seated I had a great food experience and the customer service was lovely. I think the guy was a manager or something but he was exceeding friendly and explained my oyster sampler in depth, along with everything else I got. The restaurant is quite pricey but it had some damn good oysters that were well worth the price.

qvyNfgz3PVAzPGzYzWbErA.text: First time in Tempe! Rich gave us excellent service! What a great experience! Can't wait to come again! The Lobster Roll was to die for!

BatZdCmJVDO5HMh2EpZnqg.text: Having just moved from California, I was skeptical of land-locked seafood. Wow, was I wrong. The quality and flavor of King's is quite remarkable. The scallops exploded with flavor and you could taste home in their bowl of clam chowder. Our server informed us they have a warehouse right on the coast of California where they get all of their fresh seafood... and boy, can you taste it. So excited to have amazing seafood in this toasty state. Cheers

EuPSy8HO_32eHhNxTIPEPA.text: My wife and I dined here Saturday night and this would of been our 3 time visiting King's Fish House. The reason I am writing a review this time is because our server Callie.  It was our anniversary and we came here for the lobster roll(which are incredible) sadly they were out. Our server made sure our anniversary was still special with a dessert and a gift card to come back for some lobster rolls another time. Instead for dinner we had bowls of chowder, crab legs, and filet mignon.  A little more pricey than we anticipated but well well worth it, very delicious!

JMYrvLhhxE4Rv1h6EJJTcA.text: My wife and I ate at King's on Sunday, April 14th. Upon arrival, we were checked in just after a large group of about 30 or so people. The restaurant did their best to accommodate them and all their other guests with a limited staff. Our waiter, Lorenzo, did a fantastic job balancing the large party and our needs. The food was a hit and miss and took rather long, but it was understandable. My wife and I would like to go again on a day when they aren't so busy. I cannot praise Lorenzo enough for his care though and was definitely the highlight of the dinner.

8fvZPQe-joFuV0ZhT49iew.text: I've only been here twice.  This is a really solid, high-ish end seafood place.   And I mean, legit seafood place.  The N'Awlins BBQ shrimp is not authentic (just sayin') but the oysters on the half shell rock the house.  The service is decent, the ambiance is nice.

Mfn_W8aMWiumIPxjfvMVGw.text: Great food as always! The clam chowder is amazing! Our server Lorenzo was awesome! Will be back. The oysters were fabulous.   Great service and atmosphere. Lorenzo was so knowledgeable about the oysters.

_DsGZ1mX26yFCjfZbyAGeA.text: I think this was my best seafood restaurant experience of all time. Lorenzo was an amazing server, the food was outstanding. The prices are on the higher side but it was worth every penny. For fresh fish and outstanding service this is the place to go when in the area. The experience was well worth it the price didn't matter.

o6huNMB9BeDHG0aajinMHQ.text: Steven the bartender is awesome. He makes awesome drinks and is friendly with all patrons.  The food is phenomenal al

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States

oxjqUlzraoPqFmpPx-Kacg.text: My family and I ate here when we were visiting from out of town. We were greeted right when we walked in, seated quickly, and we didn't have to wait long at all for our server to take our drink order and then our dinner order. When our food came out, it was hot and delicious. The macadamia nut crusted halibut was amazing, the oysters were fresh, and the Alaskan sand dabs were the best I've ever eaten. The manager, Rodney, stopped by our table to make sure that everything was perfect and asked if there was anything else we needed. It was so nice to have the server AND the manager be so attentive to make sure that our visit was great. We loved everything about this restaurant, and will definitely be back next time we are in town.

33gLqoybLVuyriIuW4JYiA.text: This place used to be one of my favorites. While the service is still quite good, the food quality has gone downhill in the last few years. N'Awlins Shrimp- really greasy. Instead of using chili's for flavor, seems like chef used chili oil in copious amounts. Sushi seemed very dry like it had been made hours earlier. Very sad - I probably won't be back.

W5D-cLcTy5ERjEYMMMEVLg.text: We have been here a few times in the past, a couple times for a special occasion... This time it literally took over an hour to get out food, every single table around us that arrived after (5 tables in total) got intricate dishes while we waited on basic fish and chips, a burger and chicken tenders. We were not checked on or updated and actually saw our food sitting on the kitchen counter in the back ready to be picked up for some time. Forgot basic condiment requests as well... This was a Tuesday night and only one waiter was working 6 packed tables which was clearly insufficient. Fish was greasy as hell for the fish and chips and chicken tenders were super over cooked. Not too enthused to have to wait an hour for sub par food.

wKEJjqxPDWu1BVvUM9g_EQ.text: Way to go Amanda recommended the place to some friends and they loved you they said she recommended many dishes and apps that they loved this just may turn into a hot spot for when the company folks come to town for this group

OSQv9R2Q7B3Y1Ca_ihoIbA.text: Best place for oysters in Phoenix!  There are always several varieties from the Pacific Northwest, often some from British Colombia, and the eastern seaboard as well.  Our visit tonight was made more enjoyable by our server, Gilbert.  Attentive and also very pleasant and enjoyable.  Personable!  Like he enjoyed his job and likes people! I will look for him next time we come in.

XdYv1B2YKjODjADq0Z8Igg.text: Here for a HappyEvent!! Food and service is awesome.  Oysters were perfect and all the dinners were great.

SNc5Qi7X9w_JZcrVKufU3w.text: I loved this place despite the reviews. Our food was excellent, service was amazing, and everything was clean. Those are the three things I always look for and this place passed with flying colors. Would highly recommend if you're ever in the mood for some good seafood.

AWLWqhDYJYctUBpZ7D1FYw.text: Great experience! Really good food. I don't recommend the grilled artichoke...it was a pain on a date. Not the restaurant's fault. But good prices, good food! I'm not a bread or sugar eater and they totally accommodated! My husband had grilled grouper, I had crab. Both delicious options. We sat outside it was empty and it was like he rented the place out for us! They never even forgot about us!!!

DU2IYi9W-pgQOkb1YQF8DA.text: Food was amazing! Seafood was incredible! Service with a smile! Even their hot wings are phenomenal! You have to get their butter cake!!! Best I've ever had!

vcpZ-3XUEFzoUacCwsHu6Q.text: I normally do not leave one star reviews, however I was in this location yesterday for lunch and ordered the rainbow trout almondine. I chose it because it was the chefs special. It was terribly overcooked and the sauce was far too sweet. This should be a firm and flaky type of fish. I usually catch, clean and cook my own. This piece of fish was mushy and had no flavor. I took 3 bites and did not eat the rest THANK GOD. This was the only meal I had eaten yesterday. At about noon today I had the worst stomach cramps and issues that I don't want to get into detail over - food poisoning. I called to speak to the manager and she was conveniently "on the phone with a customer" the lady who answered the phone did not offer to take my number for her to call me back.  Do not eat the fish here guys- it's not worth trying to work and run to the bathroom every 20 minutes.   Needless to say I will not be returning and I will be letting everyone I know about how sick this food made me.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States

sTALXJkA3NQHde1ArxG4nA.text: Wandered in on a Friday night after walking through the mall trying to decide what to eat. Well we landed in a winner. Our waitress Timber was probably one of the best and most knowledgeable waitresses I've had in a long time. She knew the menu and offered good suggestions. The food was wonderful my guest and I had the mussels and then had the surf and turf. Everything was cooked well and was flavorful. Timber was attentive and checked in on us at the appropriate times and just overall wow'd us on service. Great place, great food, great service.

23eqYHl_0sCcpzL_pujHow.text: I've been here twice. It's one of only two places I've found that have good oysters. I love the ambiance here, the oysters are top notch (Texas, you need to visit here and learn what a freaking good oyster is), the fries are good, the warm bread is awesome.  They could use some better brews on tap -- good seafood calls for a good beer (e.g. pale ale).  The service was really good, fast, friendly (unlike Hertz).  My first visit, I also had the soft-shell crab. Being from the DC area, I get these whenever I can find them, and King's' was perfect.

BDMqU3bIraqhYbRzDuaDuw.text: Thank you Gilbert for making my ASU grad celebration extra especial. Your recommendations were divine. And that "Hooked on Butter Cake" was delectable!!!! The oyster sampler was such a treat. Thank you.

z-4AMziK_zWTtJbPJsFHsg.text: We were fans of the Fish House in San Diego, so we were thrilled when we found this one while visiting Tempe!   Amanda was the best bartender/waitress.  She was interesting and made our dining experience even better!  Definitely recommend this place.  Ask for Ananda!

Y3CClkHZ5mH7f_Au7_PRfQ.text: I Should have paid attention to another review, the food was great but the service was absolutely horrible, we sat for 15 minutes before they took our drink order- the funny part was the place was 75% empty, we should have walked out. I stopped a waiter and he said it wasn't  his job??  He could have at least asked if we needed something- very lost  goosie place - they don't give a crap! The whole time we ate we had to get up and ask for drinks- at the end the manager got involved- very nice but too late, we should have gone to our original  place we all wanted- my bad because this was my choice- never again! If that punk worked for me I would fire him!

fX2VJlesAhnPlram29V7zA.text: Outstanding seafood and desserts are to die for. I had the seafood platter and my wife had the blackened mahi mahi. For dessert we shared the chocolate cake and it was outstanding.

3WaBTkNaExIc1wrtV7sseA.text: Came here and had a great meal and great service. Highly recommend the Atlantic salmon with mashed potatoes and Mac n cheese.  Great atmosphere.  The server was very pleasant and very attentive. KAYLIN was wonderful. 100 stars for her.

4IXCR8z6OYLorwbbMstm3A.text: What a hidden gem! Came here after the movies for happy hour - sat at the bar! Bar is fabulous! Made perfect by Gilbert's outgoing, friendly personality! He's also very knowledgable of the menu!! We will definitely be back!

3DSfd-cY82Pb_SkImrTLpQ.text: In town for the weekend. Saw the review on King's Fish House on YELP! Certainly helped and affirmed the majority of the reviews...fantastic, yummy, and satisfying. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone on the Tempe area looking for some excellent seafood.

Ct7-5Y50pIo-06CzMwwWcA.text: We had dinner here for my birthday, there was about 15 of us. The food was great, service was great, and the prices not so great... I guess that comes along with great food and seafood! I recommend this place, at least to try it. We went on a Sunday evening and it wasn't busy at all.

RYSYgloGhN0U2tFZ57BjcA.text: We had a great Valentines Day dinner at Kings Fish House in Tempe. We had the oyster rockefeller as an appetizer and it was superb.  I had a great martini and my wife enjoyed a glass of their pinot grigio.  We had the wild Alaska halibut and wild Mexican swordfish.  They were excellent and delicious. Having been to Alaska numerous times (my son lives there /USMC), the halibut was as good as we have had up there.  I had requested some flowers for my wife and the restaurant provided her with lovely roses.  Thank you Kings Fish House for making our Valentines dinner very special.  We definately will dine there again during our 2 month stay in Phoenix.

teWoiqUbXQZV9XAXSgIoOw.text: I was so happy to see a King's Fish House in Tempe during my recent visit to the area.  I have been to the one in Long Beach and Rancho Cucamonga and love their food!  I ordered the three oyster shooters first. They came with grated horseradish on top--it is NOT cheese!  So I stirred that into the shooter and shot it. Oh so good!!!  For my entree I ordered the Wild Jumbo Shrimp and Lump Crab Meat Salad.  The shrimp and crab were really good, but I was surprised to see chunks of carrots and celery--the celery appearing to be the dry ends of the stalk which I gently removed.  How weird to have big pieces of carrots and celery on what I considered to be a shrimp and crab Louie.  It was good, but I (obviously) was a little too hung up with these other two items to really enjoy it.  Service was nothing outstanding which is typical by today's standard.  I'll go back, but I'll tell them to leave the celery and carrots off.

-1utohjkSWGZwOhjn2y09g.text: Our server was awesome!! Food was lacking flavor. We ordered calamari as our appetizer and it was good, but the sauces were terrible. I ordered the lemon nut crusted sea bass and it had no flavor at all. My husband ordered the scallops blackened, but they were actually just Cajun scallops. Overall the experience was ok, but not worth the price.

0SlBcTGPPXdYr5Hd0JMw1A.text: Amazing food and fantastic service!  We couldn't decide what to get so ordered a ton of food which was almost as good the next day ;)

tMVQRH1cxr38MjsWrcctfA.text: Service is excruciatingly slow and the waiter had absolutely no knowledge of the menu. He had to go to the kitchen over 8 times to answer each question we had about the menu. It took 20 minutes to place our drink order and an hour to get our entrees. The portions are tiny, tiny!!!

C8txvS2lu8cu8mqunl-RiQ.text: I love this place. I have been going to it since it first open. I had my first oyster there and love them.  Great service and great food! Huge menu that includes a sushi. They serve sough dough bread while you wait for your order. The have huge booths. They have great take home kid cups and a very nice kids menu that even comes with tattoos. The house wine is also pretty good. I highly recommend it.

qdsGEHHall3bAMS32SLWsw.text: I ate dinner here with a friend and her parents. Everything on the menu looked fantastic but I decided to be good and order trout with glazed carrots instead of pasta or fried fish with fries. My friend's mom ordered crab cakes before her meal and offered me a bite. I was impressed it was all crab and lightly breaded on the outside just the way I like em! I enjoyed my trout and tried my friend's halibut and her mom's Alaskan Sanddab. Both were equally delicious. We finished our meal with key lime pie and creme brulee. I am extremely picky about what seafood restaurants I will eat at and I give King's Fish House two thumbs up!

kmbrimQsoRLCp3YMconzDA.text: So after spending $150 on dinner for 4 people, without alcohol, I have to say the food was horrible.  I would have complained more at the time but we were celebrating my parents 50th anniversary and I didn't want to ruin their evening.  My $25 salmon dish was overcooked and for some god forsaken reason they put a ton of spice on it.  My husband's fish was also dried out and tasteless.  The only things that were good were the cheese grits and spinach.

K5lFo2qukvlinkA_n0fCHA.text: Met a client here for lunch yesterday. We were seated promptly and our server, Katie, was great. My client had a burger and I ordered the scallops. Our lunches were out within 15 minutes and we snacked on the warm bread and butter while we chatted about business. This is a nice, little more upscale place to meet for lunch if you want an upgrade over the normal fast food type establishments. The scallops were cooked perfectly and the grilled zucchini was especially nice with a seasoning that I was not typical in other places that I have been. I also had the mac n cheese and it was obvious that it was freshly made. My client said that she really enjoyed her burger and sweet potato fries also. (maybe it was a little extra good because I was paying ;O)

Xm_yV6Wc0bo_CSsMezEQpA.text: Perfect Sunday lunch.  That's not a bad way to start a review I think.  We went here last Sunday right before going to the movies.  We ordered the Cold Seafood Combo; it was crab legs, peel-n-eat shrimp, clams and oysters. Plenty of food for 2 people.  It was a really slow there but that's fine by me.  The beer was very good and cold. For the meal for 2, plus we each had 2 beers...it was only about $50.   We spoke to the manager and he gave us a coupon for next months Lobsterfest, buy one lobster get one free.  So of course we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sunday Lunch

vsPpT_Wh6H0pY3MI9OONGA.text: We were invited back as guests of the restaurant and had a good experience.  Based on our first visit we stayed with fish dishes only.  The halibut, tilapia and oysters were all excellent.  The tilapia was very good.  The halibut was excellent again.  The entrees came with two sides - we chose spinach, baked potato and rice.  The dozen oysters were $28 and were  6 different types.  After asking  about oyster happy hour specials we were told the shooter oysters (3) were $4 in the bar.  The service was also very good.  We still did not feel the entrees were a good value for the money but had a good meal.

LS55mIi9xXGDqC9OI0wzfQ.text: My hubby and I came here for lunch. I had the salmon salad and it was delicious! The service was quick and waiter was very nice and never let our drinks reach the bottom. Once you sit down they bring a sourdough bread which is delicious and dangerous if your watching your bread intake! The only thing I would point out is that there are two entrances one is for the bar and the other the main entrance. We walked in through the oyster bar entrance which wasn't bad it's just that when we did this we had to walk through the restaurant to get to the hostess. Other than that this place knows it's seafood!

hxUbwBLfkil40ORiu2vBDA.text: I went in on a whim, out shopping, saw sign, & "fish" sounded good. A Monday, late afternoon, I was recommended that the bar had Monday specials. Ordered house Chardonnay, expected "ok", it was delicious! Unexpectedly sour dough bread appeared & I took a taste & it was exquisite! I told the bartender I felt I was in San Francisco, & she said it is flown in DAILY for them! The fish tacos were a great choice, they were delicious & even though I was really hungry, I couldn't finish them!  I can't understand the negative postings here, surely having everything much better than I even expected can't be just an accident!  I am a picky eater and only expected to "grab a bite to eat" & was very pleasantly surprised!

6klkeyy_gmtfLceenTxkqQ.text: I tried this place for lunch a few days ago.  Their lunch menu is HUGE and is probably about the same as their dinner selections except for the prices.  I wasn't in the mood for a $50 lunch so I opted for the Caesar with wild bay shrimp.  The size and price was reasonable but it was just "eh".  My buddy got the Louie salad with crab and shrimp and it looked "eh" as well.  The service was excellent.  The diet cokes almost came faster than I could drink them.  Their fish and oyster selection look great so I will definitely be back because there really aren't that many places in Tempe with decent seafood.

ONJQBqv9P1IMIhzEa6Nk6Q.text: 3.5 stars  After a failed attempt to dine elsewhere, we ended up at King's.  Unlike Maria Maria, King's was more than happy to promptly seat us without an unnecessary wait.  There is quite an extensive menu, and a lot of complaints on Yelp about price.  I didn't think it was all that expensive.  Most of the entrees were under $20 and that includes two sides.  I had the crab cakes with french fries and mac 'n cheese.  The crab cakes were good even if not the best I've had.  Mac 'n cheese fell a little short for me.  Not much cheese.  More like mac 'n bread crumbs.  My husband had the king crab legs.  Expensive ($43) but 1 1/2 lbs and tons of crab meat.  I tried and it was delicious.  We had excellent service.  Could not have asked for better!  My one suggestion would be to serve the sourdough bread warm!  At least until June!

1W4Gnrc1jnehkNaOWdILCA.text: our family stopped in at 8pm on february 10th.  there was no wait and a few folks eating in the restaurant.  we were sat very quickly.  our server, cody, was awesome.  we ordered coconut crusted wild ecuadorian mahi mahi, wild baja californian yellowtail, wild alaskan red king crab and southwest salad.  we loved all our meals!  we did not have any problems with our order.  our meal for 2 adults and 1 child was around $41.  the restaurant is very nice inside but it was disturbing to see so few people inside.  so we had a great quiet dinner.  for the record parking and traffic sucks real bad at this restaurant location in the tempe market place.

aEr1HpaYfjFjfjoZXktBxg.text: I've been here a few times.  The service is good.  The side items are great.  But the last two occasions I went there the fish was just average.  The prices are a little high for similar restaurants, but, if you need seafood and are at Tempe Marketplace, it's not a bad option.

4iWF0p6yauti6nkhNpf40g.text: Hungry ? Want something to eat , like maybe fish?  Well this place has fish.  This is the kind of place to go when you want food but not really caring how good it COULD be .  Service was great and very prompt. The host  , bartender, and wait staff seemed very into their jobs.  But the fish itself was not memorable.    A bit pricey , but offered many kinds of fish which seemed to be flown in?   I wouldn't go back unless a group of people were meeting there and it was what everybody else wanted. Enough said.

7KmyT3NND455bphTvHQJLg.text: I was delighted when I was contacted by Sarah (manager) through Yelp to elaborate a little more about my negative experience at King's Fish House 2-3 weeks ago. I sent her a message back through Yelp giving her my personal email so Danny the GM could contact me but I have never heard anything back since. Maybe they dont check Yelp that often.. I am not sure what the reasoning is..  :o(

UTePyMG7e7wwsWDeWIRm6w.text: An upgrade to five stars is necessary after weekly fish lunches for the past several months.  I have managed to cycle thru the various seasonal "wild" salmon plus a portion of the other fish.  For me it is hard not to order salmon but will be forced to make a change in the fall at the end of the season.  Today was the Wild Kuskokwim River Coho Salmon summer salad with asparagus, tomatoes, blue cheese and fennel in an orange-soy vinaigrette.  An excellent recommendation by the waitress versus my standard cedar plank roasted salmon that masks the rich mild salmon flavor.  This time simply grilled and very, very tasty.  What I am really beginning to like about King's Fish House is excellent service in the center section under my favorite fish.  The mighty AK Chinook King Salmon...I remember catching a similar King 20 years ago on the Kenai River in AK.  My dad and I each caught Kenai King Salmon on separate days.  Each fish was 42 inches long but mine had 27 inch girth and my dad's fish had a 26 inch girth.  The scale was broken so never knew what they actually weighed (40 to 45 #).  My dad claimed his fish was larger so there you go.  The photo of us holding the fish at sunset with a background river shot is proof of their size but not of their quality.  As I recall they were the best tasting fish ever but 20 years is a long time to try to remember taste.  As far as service goes either waitress knows that I start with a Kiltlifter  but not the size - sometimes 16 oz and sometimes 22 oz.  Both waitresses know I like salmon but if the same type of salmon is on the menu I have switched to sea bass or rock fish.  Hard to believe but sometimes change is good but I almost always remember to go back to salmon the next time.

PjlJQmd0C_mznfRdTv2cVQ.text: This Review is for the General Manager at Kings. She got in touch with me (I'm sure, after verifying research on my history with Kings.) She promised changes coming and has sent me a pass for another dining experience. I will try Kings again and re-post my next experience.My conversation with her was very professional and she is very sweet. I hope to have a nice meal there soon...like it was when they first opened and had me hooked (no pun). So 10/21/14 I went back for LUNCH at the bar and I had oysters, fish and chips that was fresh and fluffy and paired it with a tasty craft IPA. Seriously, the raw bar is excellent, and the food is good, service was slow, but very pleasant as they checked in after lunch was served. I did not see any new sides of the menu yet, but I was told they were coming so I just had tavern fare. The restaurant did really try to accommodate the lousy experience I had with the previous review. What else can you ask for really? This is a real fish restaurant in Tempe aiming to please.

9__XEBzLegnTgrLVmhiRxw.text: Just ate there. Had an awesone meal. Sat on patio and enjoyed the beautiful weather. LEVI WAS A SUPERB WAITPERSON. He was informed about the menu and made great recommendations. Will go back soon.

iOmvGu4wfZ9sdNT_brGryw.text: I agree with Alicia, it is a bit pricey here, even for a place nowhere near a fish producing body of water. Back home Cioppino might cost you a little less, even at the classiest place, however I will say its pretty good, but I'd have to wait until I become a millionaire to try it again to indicate any authenticity.   I was just here with a classmate about two weeks ago, and I must say, I was kinda disappointed. I ordered the fried oysters ($16+; I got like 5 small oysters with some fries and cole slaw) which I asked to be fried "hard" which I think the cook mistook my request  and thought I wanted to be served the most dried out oysters I have ever had in my life. Our waitress was alright, but she was very slow for a restaurant with only 5 other tables. I don't really appreciate being left vulnerable to choking without a drink to counter it.    I think my first visit here was the best. The oysters, which we got as a appetizer and not a meal, came out great (even with my hard-frying request), the sourdough bread almost sparked memories of bread from home. And the Cioppino was delicious, but the bowl was very shallow and didn't get me messy at all! The bib isn't suppose to be for looks!! Haha, I'm joking with you slightly, but I always remember making much more of a mess with the soup back home. And our waiter was great, very knowledgeable on the dishes and drinks and was charming. I think I enjoyed sitting in the bar section much more than the general dining area.  If I had been able to type up this review after my first visit, King's probably would have gotten 5-stars from me, but blame the dry-ass oysters and the inability for our waitress to not fill my ice tea glass up quick enough to make me give King's Fish House a 3.

QakWSq906aayxkd2oGNFEg.text: My boyfriend and I came here last night for a belated birthday dinner and I felt like we made a good choice. Our server, Katelyn, was fantastic. I had multiple questions about the menu and she answered every question with a smile and gave us some great recommendations. We started with the grilled artichoke which was messy and delicious and exactly how I like my food. I ordered the swordfish tacos and loved how colorful they were. These were a little messy as well but delicious. My boyfriend ordered the sea scallops with carrots and spinach as his sides. He cleared his plate. We took a look at the dessert menu but decided we were too full to have dessert. We will definitely be back.

QOc_N4yrl2gg1dmpQJQteA.text: I seriously considered giving King's Fish House 1 star, but our waitress was helpful and tried to accommodate us as best they could.  However, my oysters on the half shell were small and served with some weird shaved horseradish, my steamed shrimp was rather boring, and my wife disliked her fish so much that she couldn't finish it and asked for it to be sent back.  She said it was over-cooked and flavorless.  To be fair to the staff, the waitress and chef both came out to our table and offered to re-cook the fish or make something else entirely for her, but by then, my wife was too turned off to have anything else.  I would never try King's Fish House again.  For a guy originally from Maryland who's had some pretty amazing seafood, there was just too much wrong here to be given a second chance.  For what it's worth, my brother-in-law had the New England clam chowder that night with us and said it was the best he had ever had.

Kp2BNebGY3tqtRoTZOSmaw.text: On a Sunday after church, we decided to dine out for seafood. My friend remembered the building and sign while visiting Tempe Marketplace, so we decided to visit. Accidently walking in the bar side entrance we were pleasantly greeted and suggested to sit wherever we would like. Choosing a spacious private seating area offside the bar and restaurant allowed us to enjoy ourselves with tons of room to spread out and without the worry of disturbing others with loud laughter. A refreshing Desert Pear Margarita for happy hour made it hard to have just one! We ordered a great Coho Salmon dish which was fresh, juicy, and seasoned wonderfully and an awesome Lobster Crunch Roll as well. Friendly service from Paul the manager and Anthony the bartender; loved the special touch of meeting the chef tableside too!

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yes, the Coho Salmon is tasty!
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Desert Pear Margarita

64wvg71BEOWCHiFI2sdtqQ.text: Overpriced is the first word that comes to mind.  And the word that dominates my feelings toward this place.  They never mentioned that the "KING" in the name actually  means you have to be as RICH as a REAL KING to afford to eat here.  $13.95 for a ( relatively forgettable ) simple oyster Po' Boy with 5 oysters on it and a side of fries?   Yep.  Who's dumber - me for paying it, or them for charging it?  I think Me.  When I saw the price, I should have just closed the menu and left.  I also had a $6.95 "Cajun Bloody Mary" which had nothing Cajun about it, as far as I could tell.  It was mostly ice, served in a 16-oz glass.  So maybe about 6 ounces of "drink material" inside.  It lasted about as long as it took me to take 5 drinks out of it.  Let's do the math:  At $6.95, with 6 ounces of substance, that comes to $148.26 per gallon.    So at least I can say I had a Bloody Mary which came in at around $148 a gallon.  I will never, EVER go back to that place.  And if you do go, bring the credit card with the highest available balance, because you are gonna need it.  P.S.  A manager attempted to contact me after seeing this review, trying to make things right for me.  I understand their prices reflect the "going rate" for fresh seafood in the desert.  I've upped the star from 1 to 2 to reflect the respect for management for trying to contact me and make things right.  Kudos for that.  P.S.P.S.  I had Pete's Fish and Chips the other day, and I realized that their fried oysters are the EXACT SAME ONES which are served at King's Fish House.  So if you want to know what these fried oysters taste like, eat at Pete's.  You can get about 15 oysters there for the King's price.

AxTslvMdBvI5IQM8URXt5A.text: Yes this is the place. Creative with all the dishes. Excellent presentation. Very clean. Restrooms clean. Staff very professional

JDw-b-UnhJ1DLQ7i-P_kvg.text: This place is "aight".  It's not a fancy seafood place, but its not Long John Silver's either.  I actually found it to be a bit pricey for the type of fare, even though understandably seafood tends to be more expensive.  I felt like they were charging more just because they could, but not because they deserved it.  I've had dinner here and a few happy hour events.  Everytime I leave like I enjoyed the food, but was slightly ripped off.  If I were to recommend something:  The calamari and fish tacos were good.

ncl1vLGlkRB52DPUTidiWw.text: Started with oysters and Chardonnay - then grilled Tilapia, rice, and zucchini - a perfect meal!    All recommended by our beautiful bartender who looked exactly like Thandie Newton!  Then - walk the mall at tempe mkt place. Very nice!!!!

4pndzfYOcPbiN5wkPM313A.text: Food was excellent and Ashley1 did a super job with our large indecisive party!  I had the swordfish and ratatouille-both delicious .  I'm lactose intolerant and asked for no butter and they were very accommodating.  Again, Ashley was all over it, making sure the spinach was sauteed in oil, not just steamed.
