lvvYCR9UfQeamq41ZkUACg.text: This is the first time my husband and I ate inside the restaurant.  The last two times my husband ordered takeout.  We usually order the fish and chips.  My only complaint is the fish is soggy by the time he gets home.  We live about 12 miles away.  So we decided to see if it would still be soggy if we ate there.  Unfortunately it was still soggy but still very good.  We will probably go back and order another 2.5 lbs lobster.  That was yummy!

Mi96sSUYyRqfcgLVBVkF7g.text: We stopped here for a drink and wanted to share a cold seafood platter.  Although everything looked very fresh and our service was very good, the cook who prepared our platter (in front of us, as we were sitting at the bar) completely mutilated our clams and oysters and the crab claws we got were pathetic.  We were there during a shift change and watched the next cook prepare the same platter and I really wish I had been the people getting that one......

B4CPJzJZaDar3TlEIcNtUw.text: I'm not a fish fan, but the group I was with was, so as long as there's some non-fish on the menu, I'm fine with it.  It's a nice place, and the service was friendly and attentive. The cocktail napkins with incredibly corny fish jokes (where do fish borrow money? a loan shark) was kind of a fun addition.  I ordered a pasta dish which included chicken, peppers, and a creamy tomato-based sauce. It was good, but I don't know if it was $14 good. Prices went up from there for the various fish dishes, but I can't really judge those without trying them.  I've got no complaints, and I'd probably go back if I'm with people that want to go, but I think I can find similar quality food for me at about 4 or 5 dollars less for lunch.

_Vp4-ThfzUS6zAbf2H8alQ.text: Atmosphere was good.  Had shrimp angel hair pasta and oysters. Food was great.  Want to try sushi next time.  Service was decent.  Wasn't busy and service was still really slow. If service was better I would give this place a 5 star

E_DKTms38e9J8ImPKWNh7g.text: Had the Parmesan Crusted British Columbia Sanddabs.  Eh.  Too much parmesan crust that I couldn't really taste the actual fish itself.  Had cheesy grits as a side - bleh.  From the taste of it - the cheese was somekind of processed velveeta like cheese.  Yuck.  What I thought was really good was the grilled zucchini.  Perfectly cooked and seasoned.  The highlight of the meal.

CzoSf7mA34ujTV6utGrjMA.text: I had read a review that King's was an over priced Red Lobster. Unfortunately the food didn't even measure up to that. Over cooked fishy tasting salmon that wasn't fresh, soft shell crab was horrible, and for the price point we were expecting much more.

6iq2aZL4oufwr4bIB6bGSA.text: We wanted lobster and remembered this restaurant from Southern California so thought to give it a try. We were seated promptly and served warm sour dough bread very quickly. The oysters were fresh but very small and at $13 for a half dozen not a great value. But the main event, we loved the steamed lobster. It was fun and our professional friendly server let our 9 y/o pick our fresh lobster. The bar was nice and it seemed like a fun place to gather after work.

6nZkYsiA2wXPJjeN2d9yKg.text: We had our anniversary dinner there, we wanted top notch sea food and boy did we get it!! Our service  was fantastic and our night was topped off with the manager delivering us our desert. She asked how our meal was as well as congratulating us on our special night. I give five stars to the food the staff especially the manager "Kari" it showed great hospitality.  Good job Kings Fish House we will be back:)

fdjvZhXbTchpaDBlc_yGjw.text: I am rather picky about my seafood and was surprised by some of the negative reviews of this place; so I decided to give it a try. The ambiance inside was a bit cold so we ate outside (pleasant) and the service was excellent. The food did not disappoint. The grilled artichoke and crab cakes were wonderful appetizers and our group ordered the Mahi Mahi, Tilapia and sea bass. All were flavorful, cooked perfectly and included pretty good accompaniments (i.e. fresh spinach, cheesy grits, garlic mashed, etc.). Their menu offers a huge variety including fresh oysters, a nice selection of salads, and lobster. And for the non fish eater, there are sandwiches, chicken, pasta and steaks. They also offer a very nice list of beer and wine. For a restaurant in Arizona that specializes in fish, King's is a pretty good place. I would go again.

XuocenaGH6o1RDGiptZ6Gg.text: So we've come here multiple times trying to give it the benefit of the doubt, after tonight we will not be returning. We ordered the Tilapia with Mac and cheese and fries. After the first bite I told my husband, "This tastes like..." And he finished "How our wet dog smells" which is exactly what it smelled and tasted like. It was horrible! I ate three bites but could not stomach it anymore. We waited for the server to come ask us how it was (usually they do that) but he never bothered to ask and barely even stopped at our table again. You think he would have noticed the barely touched fish on my plate. The fries were also over cooked and the Mac and cheese wasn't good either. We took the leftovers home intending to give it to the dogs and not waste it. But on the way home we both started feeling queasy. He ate more than I did so he felt it more, I'm pretty sure it gave us a small dose of food poisoning, but thankfully we didn't eat much of it. We decided to throw it all away instead of getting the dogs sick as well. We will not be returning to this establishment.

RkhsUCeYoiSrYJekCiV96g.text: This place is not worth the price. I ordered the shrimp louie salad entree which lacked any flavor at all. I expected that I would get nice large shrimp only it was a pile of tiny cold, boring shrimp on top of a plate full of lettuce with large hunks of unseasoned raw veggies. I took a few bites and then just stopped eating it. I am a person that loves salads, they can be made healthy and flavorful when done well, but this one is something I could have thrown together at home myself. When our server saw my salad not eaten, he simply asked if I was finished but didn't even ask if I enjoyed it. Clearly I did not enjoy it since I took only 3 or 4 bites.  My boyfriend ordered the smoked salmon tortellini which actually tasted fine, however the price was high and there was only a small amount of salmon in the dish. It was more of a pasta with cream sauce and a little bit of salmon thrown in for flavor. We each had one drink from the bar and the bill came to $50.00.  The best thing here was the sourdough bread, however I expected them to ask if we wanted more bread after we finished the first piece on our table and they did not ask if we wanted more. Personally I don't mind not getting more bread because I don't like to overeat it, however I think they should at least ask if we would like more. Overall, the food was so-so but the main thing is that the prices were shockingly high for the quality of the food we received. In my opinion the food, atmosphere, and service was not worth it.

6UuvOoK5ip5sUxH_G5QGjQ.text: My wife and I loved this place!  The menu was outstanding - thoroughly impressed with the wide variety.  I had the New England Clam Bake - delicious lobster, clams and mussels... the clam chowder was delicious as well.  My wife had the ono, which she thoroughly enjoyed, too.  Highly recommend the oyster sampler as an appetizer.  We took home some bread pudding for a late night dessert too.  Service was great, lots of good recommendations from our waitress.  We went to Wildfish near Fashion Square not long ago, and I'd have to say we'd return to King's way before going back to Wildfish.  Much more reasonable, price-wise, as well.  No complaints - they made a great first impression on us!

z472QgzQ4zIcIiheFaXEdg.text: The fish tacos were delish.   The lobster bisque was awful.   It had a poor after taste, too sweet, and was missing any noticeable lobster.  We splurged on the diets with the sourdough bread and while I feel guilty on one hand the other was happy because the bread was yummy.

8GHKzvfEr4tcHPQrfLNpLw.text: First time having a bad experience. Received bad calamari and everything went down hill from there. Tried to make the best of it, but since it was early and only a couple of other tables seated, didn't have good food or great service.

Q7vcEQ32HQ0jvKVfMUqbEQ.text: King's Fish House is a chain restaurant.  Not as big as McCormick & Schmick's.  They have locations in CA, NV, and AZ for now.  It's located in the Tempe Marketplace which is always super busy but that's not a problem.  Actually the first time we went to King's Fish House, we liked it so much we decided to come back again the next day!  The seafood here is GREAT!  It's so hard to find a place for good seafood.  I actually prefer King's Fish House more than McCormick & Schmick's!  They have something for everyone even if you're not in to seafood.  But if you are they even have sandwiches, sushi, oyster platters, and pasta.  I learned from my first time here that their portion sizes are pretty big, so when we came back a second time we shared one of the plates haha.  Well we shared our sides, we each got our own plates.  Also the calamari is a good choice for appetizers!    The restaurant overall is not too bad.  We came here in a group of 8 and they easily accommodated us last minute.   And our server was on top of everything with orders, drinks, knowing who got what.  Great customer service!  Also they sometimes have good deals where you buy their giftcard and a bonus gift card.

WsdqB7-R9Sl84tmqpP7a0g.text: Excellent service and food. Never disappointed with any off the Kings Fish House franchise. Been to several in SoCal. Kudos to Kings!

0Gf9i-6KdcxaJdoFPdhILw.text: All kinds of seafood choices from sushi and raw bar to fried or grilled. I suggest you try the macaroni and cheese for a side or the New Orleans spicy shrimp. The wait staff is attentive and even brought warm wet napkins with lemon to clean up your hands.

_WmP2YaOb_9PwhT3EcLfhA.text: The service is great but the food was bland and nothing special. The prices were okay and the portions big enough that I had some leftovers for lunch the next day. Had high hopes due to the location and limited seafood options around the city but one trip was enough for me.

bS11799GFblqMlGiwTb9-w.text: Let me cut to the chase. Many places sometimes decline in quality with the length of time that I have been away from here. King's has improved in that timeframe.  First, Michelle is now the general manager and still has the same fun, vibrant personality that my wife and I have come to appreciate.  Second, there have been a few new items added to the including a butter cake that will remind you of the St. Louis Gooey Butter Cake.  That cake was so tasty, I had to get some coffee to go with it!    Rest assured, Michelle, we will be back a LOT sooner!

A2InDYfmT7V_vAk_yCt2wg.text: My wife and I visited Tempe last weekend and we ate dinner and lunch at King's. The menu is extensive, food was great, and we received outstanding service from Scott. We'll be back!

97PSyVrURqlaz0kFvXGKzg.text: I visited this restaurant with a colleague of mine for lunch.  I had the wild jumbo shrimp pasta dish.  The shrimp were not completely shelled, and so I had to pick the shells off.  The tomato sauce used in this dish was watery thin.  My colleague asked for no cheese of any kind on his fish tacos but he still got cheese.  So he just picked it off.  Our waiter was not the most attentive person.  A manager never stopped by to ask how things were.  There are definitely better places to eat at Tempe Market Place.  I seriously doubt I will ever return here.

GxicAYkOKSlk24xd_xgzuQ.text: A really cool atmosphere, but service could have been better. I went with my fiance before a movie and they completely messed up her order. Ordered her yellowtail blackened but it came out grilled. Ordered the Zucchini but instead got mac n cheese. The waitress offered to send it back, but we already short on time and I couldn't continue to wait for a new meal.  The food was OK, but it didn't stand out so much to make up for the mixups for the order. Maybe you will have better luck, but we won't be back.

BWcf2Pkp3AxYIc6keumE_w.text: Cassandra was great! Loved the food and service! Coming back again!!! We had a large group of 7 and they were able to accommodate no problem. The service was timely and the food was delicious. Cassandra recommended great food options that were delicious. Great location and great food!

Rx_cUBRas5Xmg_q7BEaYCg.text: Gonna Have To Do 3 Stars.     After earning our meal by doing a few miles of fast paced hiking over at Papago Park earlier in the evening, my wife & I decided to check out King's which, for some reason neither of us can remember, we both already had bookmarked on Yelp.  We were in the mood for seafood and had some cod at home ready to be prepared, but decided we were hangry enough to just jet over to King's to spend what ended up being $150 for a mediocre dinner.  While we always enjoy each other's company when out and about, kind of wish we had just gone home.    Started with the Oysters Rockefeller, which was tasty.   Everybody seems to do Rockefeller differently, and King's prepares it with what I think is sort of Hollandaise sauce on top.  I liked it.    I then had the King's Spicy Seafood Chowder which was awesome and hearty.  One could do a bowl of that and a salad and call it a meal, honestly.  Very good.    I then had the "Fish House Favorite" Macadamia Nut Encrusted Alaskan Halibut.  It was done nicely, and was a truly ample portion of Halibut.   But there was no evidence of an "orange ginger butter sauce" and I'm not really sure how to describe the flavor other than just sort of "blah".   Not impressive, especially at $31.  On the other hand, the dish came with two sides, so I had garlic mashed potatoes and mac&cheese.  These sides were both delicious - they do a really nice job with these two sides and the portions of both were also ample.    I try to keep Yelp reviews limited to my food / my experience and not that of other people in my party, however, I have to factor my wife's experience into this one.   She ordered the Filet Mignon (med-rare) and South African Lobster Tail combo.   Her lobster tail was huge and delicious, but her filet was overcooked and I think it was a bad cut of meat in general as it was extremely dry even though it looked like it was a solid medium in the middle.  Per the restaurant policy, they "unconditionally guarantee their product", so upon pointing out that the steak was overdone, our server immediately offered to have a fresh cut prepared.    It was better, med-rare in the middle but still overdone closer to the edges -- but at least much more juicy throughout than the first cut.   To her further chagrin, she also found that her large baked potato was raw in the middle.  She did not send it back or mention it because by this time we were basically done with our meal.   I had a single beer from one of my favorite breweries -- North Coast Brewing Scrimshaw Pilsner -- something that's not common here in the valley, and she had a glass of the Nielsen Pinot.   So, the good -- Oysters, the chowder, my sides, her lobster, our drinks. The not so good -- my entree, her filet, part of her side, and the cost of our all-told mediocre meal.

Z18Vyztte_ZfTir0ruk3SQ.text: I ordered a seaweed salad.  The portion was approximately 2.5oz.  It was good, but it was too small.  I also ordered the cold seafood platter.  It was good, but when I spend $45 on lunch, I don't expect to have to devein my shrimp.  The Bloody Mary was great, so that bumped the score to two stars.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shrimp poop

mlvlGGnhIxmzDSQKAc5XMA.text: Given previous mixed reviews, I was expecting a decent meal, but nothing like what it ended up with. Probably the most enjoyable meal I've had in years - every course was outstanding for both me and my wife. Excellent service as well. The highlight was the YellowfinTuna (following their recommendation for medium rare, which was just right), with perfectly cooked asparagus and a creamy, cheesy Mac'n'cheese. No doubt at all that we'll return next year when we're back for Spring Training!

2nJeXCYGvLL2itD0K_ABHg.text: Highly over priced for Red Lodster style food. I paid $22.00 for 3 shrimp and 2 scallops.  Serously better food Joes crab Shack.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Not a masterpiece.   Highly over priced for Red Lodster style food. I paid $22.00 for 3 shrimp and 2 scallops.

whbas_Jj5eBvp0fYDl6RUA.text: Service was decent, fish was dry and not very tasty. $100 for a couple definitely not worth it , fish and chips were mainly all batter and dripping with oil . Contacted us within a week sent us a $50 gift card haven't used it yet but will give this place a second chance for sure ,,,,,moving them up a star for that....

cUOce1sFhlafEgQbLjTmzw.text: This is a good restaurant. We are seafood fans. We ate there for the first time based on the Yelp recommendation as we were visiting from Georgia. The Hot Seafood Appetizer was splendid.  The food portions were appropriate (probably the right proportion size, but you always want more!)  The restaurant did not receive 5 stars as the fish that we ordered was bland.  The wahoo was very fresh, but the blackening was only on top and not throughout.  My daughter ordered fried catfish and had the same issue as she ordered mustard to provide more flavor.  The standout was the grilled zucchini which was excellent.  Our waitress was excellent and the food arrived promptly.  The food just needed more flavoring throughout.

PJnY88BuDCGML7Ea2rmXPQ.text: I came here for the first time the other night and was very impressed! I had the blackened swordfish with grilled zucchini and northwest vegetables. The swordfish was seasoned with cajun spices and came with a side of dipping sauce (have no idea what it was but it was delish!)  The zucchini was grilled perfectly and the northwest vegetables were glazed carrots, snap peas and string onions. Our waitress was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed throughout our dinner.  Will definitely be coming back here!

EZ5tdEwNUS9xV_ajbCah5Q.text: Great food and wonderful service, Cassandra took great care of us.  Will definitely be back for the macadamia nut crusted fish.  Desert was very good too.

k497EMlnBeIOMgT9-AfMYg.text: Mr. Gilbert is a definite MUST KEEP. Had no idea what to order...and he gave some recommendations and we absolutely loved it.  Very personable, courteous, and will keep you laughing!  This guy knows his restaurant like he owns it!  A Must Keep!!  We need more ppl like him in this world. Thanks Gilbert

hjpXG6kXfyTCSrMYyraNnQ.text: First time here. Was really good!! The hostess was friendly and classy! Loved our server Gilbert! He was engaging, fun and very knowledgeable of the menu. Loved that he had pride in his place of employment and his job.  I had the raw kumamoto oysters!! Yummy and fresh!! I'm picky about oysters, don't like them big and these were the perfect size. Appreciated the freshly grated horseradish but it could have been hotter. I also had the filet mignon and it was cooked perfect (med for me) and was very tender and flavorful! I will definitely go back and also refer Gilbert and Kings Fish House.

nI4A4MH6TJtDEFv1Mn1j0w.text: It's a gem of a restaurant - fish house tucked away in the desert.  Great food and atmosphere- reminds me of restaurants on the coast.  Amanda was a fabulous waitress - it was my friend's BD and she made it special.   Just a great place!

ZaMFlhDaO6J_GFDETy-AaA.text: Our orders of Trout Almondine sans sauce and Halibut Macadamia Crust were perfectly cooked. Sides of mac and cheese and fries were lukewarm, but fish was still nice and hot and so tasty, even though we dfish until finishing our mac and cheese. Wish there was consistency with wine service, the past few times our wine was not served in chilled glasses.  Update: Never expected to be contacted by manager on 4 star review. 3 of us returned and our sides, as well as our fish, were served hot and delicious. As always, excllent pleasant service with speedy coke refills.

XKgb34MM0S9De3cbWOx03Q.text: Nice but pricey and quality of food not so great.    Clam chowder was watery , the shrimp Louie salad was underwhelming, the scallops were like rubber   However, the service was great and the environment was nice.  Wish the quality of food lived up to the rest.

XqzZDeFq0MieH24DtK78vg.text: My hubs is a creature of habit and even though we are out of town, he wanted to go to the same place we have in CA. Glad we did!!!! Amanda was fantastic! Great service - Amanda honored every request we had, with a smile on her face. She was so gracious and made our night out perfect! We always have a lot of requests. The food was delicious, as always. The night ended perfectly with a dessert to take home and hot towels to clean up (seriously!). Come here, even if you've been before. Here's a few pics of the sushi I always love!

CdTLiyDv3MqxA6lL6duNTw.text: My husband and I have taken a few trips out to Arizona as we are looking to relocate. On our first trip, our google search led us to King's Fish House in Tempe. Excellent service! The restaurant was clean, it didn't take long for our server to greet us,  take our drink order and offered us bread (it was so good).  What we really appreciated is the Manager of the restaurant stopped at our table after we received our food to introduce herself, make sure we were happy with what we ordered and we were. We have been to several restaurants and that is not common but it was appreciated. We did notice she did this with other tables and thought it was pretty awesome.  The food was great, from the appetizers to the desert. Some of our favorites were their ahi poke appetizer, avocado toast, Salmon, old fashion drink, and the bread pudding.   On our next trip a few months later, we decided to go back again and sat in their bar area, the 2nd visit was just as great. This time another Manager stopped at our table. We took the opportunity to ask if that was common, he said yes. Their company is all about making sure those that dine at their restaurant are happy (he used a term I can't remember). We told him we thought it was great.   Thank you King's Fish House for giving us a couple of great visits, we look forward to our return!

fcsujE3a3iXKFdWAX6WOGQ.text: If you want to fit fresh perspective on Seafood in Phoenix you have to make it out the King Fish House at the Tempe Marketplace they have a great variety of different Sea Foods that are there including oysters which are ship I believe every day.  Our server was very diligent and knowledgeable about the type of fish that they had that wears in season not to say everything wasn't in season but the Fresh Catch of the Day. I had to macadamia nut crusted halibut in my wife had the Almond crusted Salmon which was excellent with the zucchini grilled zucchini and the brussel sprouts the edamame with the garlic spice was excellent also you can get there between 3 and 6 for happy hour which is always at the bar and then got great specials going on always.  Various restaurants in the area but you definitely got to try them on if you look for seafood seafood is just excellent the audience and also the area is perfect you might have to know park off-site because parking is limited due to that it's in the marketplace but King Fish House in Tempe Marketplace is an excellent place to go ahead and enjoy a night on the town.

b5KriLfdI8y7FHW89kioDw.text: I had Happy Hour here and I was at the Bar. I had the same awesome experience. I feel like I'm in SF every time I walk in this place. Fresh food, great service, and smiles from all the staff members. This is becoming my Go-To for my business meetings and seafood cravings. Got to get the Ceviche!!!

vRzjeVnllZVW3ppWQ7RSeA.text: As always it was awesome!! I'm obsessed with the Kings Albacore roll and the Spicy Crispy Tuna, I highly recommend both! Bartender Brian was very helpful through the menu and I really enjoyed his wine suggestion! The manager stopped by to see how things were and she was so welcoming and a delight to talk to! Can't wait to go back!! Thanks Kings for a great experience every time!

Kb-SlwXpru4DGyutbfgT7w.text: What a disappointment! Had a hankering for fish & chips, but not a fast food version.  Checked "Yelp!" and away we went.  Should have known when the place was empty.    We ordered ceviche for an appetizer.  The portion was great for four. Unfortunately, it was fishy, like the fish was old. It lacked citrus and salt.  The "Fish & Chips" came with shoe string potatoes cooked in old ....fishy oil.  I could smell them before I got them to my mouth, ewh! The fish coating, also cooked in the aforementioned old oil was also pungent with the smell and to add insult to injury, the batter was chewy, not crispy.  I had to strip away my favorite part to be left with some "meh" fish.   We were a party of four, so other had entree with similar reviews.  I can't find a silver lining in any of it. Food was bad, service was average and nothing makes me madder than over paying for bad food.

_ExkTUdVv1wcSEmiqm4mNA.text: Very disappointing.  I had crab cakes--sort of mushy.  Nice crispy outside but nothing special.  I also had the Caesar's salad--limp and uninteresting.  My husbands fish was dry and overcooked.  Probably won't go back because it's pretty expensive for mediocre food.

NmylFoVE0OVGe2eEdO4M3Q.text: So I've been here a few times always enjoyed it services always good food is always great but this time something much so maybe for the fact it was has hot inside as it was outside so sweating and eating is no fun Server was kinda crabby mood didnt really come around much i guess because of found a cool place to hang out in for the food orderd a few oysters the were ok but not cold more room temp i almost allways order the    cioppino and its always fantastic but not this time i think the whole experience was how hot it was i will definitely go back maybe in the winter

LlLLYuK1xlNkiUQ8KJnq6Q.text: Second time visiting, while in town on business. Both visits were excellent, due to the service and food. Most recent visit included a group of 8 of us and Laine took good care of us along with a few of his peers (great teamwork). He was friendly, attentive, thorough, and knowledgeable of the menu. I had the blackened sea bass and it was perfect. I believe everyone enjoyed their meals. We had a great time and will be back!

kSBfSNSMm_vL5hdzNbUmFQ.text: I've been here twice and both times were very good but I must say the last time was much better. I have some rock crab cioppino which was delicious!!! I am also a big fan of raw oysters which this place is heaven to me!! Recently we went and I got the sampler and tried oysters from the west coast to the east. The east coasts are much sweeter and to my taste much better! But they explain it all to you which makes it very fun. Hard to find so many different oysters any place else in the valley. Would go much more frequently if I didn't live one hour away. 10/10 would definitely recommend.

66ROJLFna9zgnlGcMZQHcA.text: My husband and I had dinner here tonight. Our first time in. Cassandra waited on us and suggested our  entree's.  The macadamia crusted halibut and the scallops were cooked to perfection. The off the Hook butter cake for dessert was OMG! I wanted to lick the plate.  We will definitely be back   Dawn and Mark  Scottsdale

1je0bKOWgxC6zRJUk_-MLw.text: Food was amazing . Paul our server was attentive with the perfect touch of humor .   Real fine dining experience

H8Gdjw1gy2P6OT9-CfIDUg.text: Great service, fun atmosphere, good prices. We had blackened Mahi Mahi and the sampler plate. Both were very good. The menu is huge, and our server was very willing to make suggestions, as this was our first time here.

NwRu5CmMsxcsuR7tY7MkAw.text: I come to this place a lot, and it never ceases to amaze me... the food is a great! The service is amazing! Tonight we had Callie as a server.... what a delight! She was so good to us. Thanks to all of you that take such good care of us when we come in.... Michelle, Cassandra, Callie and everyone else that makes this place so special for us.

U3XXICr4NrjXrll2vh4lLA.text: A good fish food place in the desert? HECK YES!  This restaurant is amazing no matter when you come in. The service is ALWAYS friendly and prompt and they go above and beyond to make sure you are beyond satisfied with your meal!  They are always willing to accommodate any special dietary needs as well!  The manager Michelle,  can be seen going from table to table to say hello and to make sure everything is exactly as you ordered it.  It's so refreshing to see a team that truly cares.  I always order the clam chowder, and crab cakes with garlic mashed and every time I leave so full and happy.  I brought my father in law, and he loved it. He said the remoulade sauce was "fan-f******-tastic"!  I will be a life long patron of this delicious fish house!!!!

ODZsw92jqeSc-e4beiEXbQ.text: Pretty good seafood for Arizona. They were able to accommodate a large party and still maintain a high level of service. The calamari and poke were awesome.

qmFHRnoY_3Uva0XI6A3sMg.text: My mother always says if you can't say anything nice then don't say anything at all.  I'll just leave it at that.

hjzAzM-cGvB_o1EbKHSggQ.text: I had lunch here and enjoyed it very much.  The menu is very diverse and loaded with good fish and other seafood.  The atmosphere was nice and the service was quick...although a little over attentive.  I will definitely try dinner her.

tXY6joj9pgQZeTHUxWtWqw.text: Our first visit here was mostly a pleasant experience.  I had the Yellow Tail Tuna, spinach, and rosemary potatoes.  My gf had Fish and Chips.  We shared a bottle of Riesling.  It was very busy on the Saturday night we went, so instead of sitting out the one hour wait we decided on eating at the bar.  The fish was terrific and fresh--I understand it's shipped in same day from Los Angeles.  I felt the "chips" part of the Fish and Chips were kinda lame given the price of the meal.  Also, occasionally a really nasty odor wafted in--I think maybe a sewer smell from outdoors coming in through the open windows.  That only happened a couple of times & I wouldn't expect that to be the general experience for people eating here.  Altogether a good eating experience.

G8ylDo_1gMujletAQMSuPQ.text: Great atomosphere, great food, great service. At our table we had the salmon, yellowtail, sand dabs, and scallops. Scallops & Sand dabs were out of this world. We're all on diets so we passed on the big yummy looking load of sourdough bread. (ahhh bread). Our server was cute, he offered to bring us Rye because I told him we were all on diets.  I dont usually get geeked up about salad dressing, but the basil vingeratte was really good! The sand dabs looked more like Patrole sole & had a yummy lemon caper sauce & my scallops were perfect.

0S0uUUKuukfSpfHyPauoFw.text: Let me start off by saying I really don't like seafood... so I'm not very qualified to review this place. However, my friend invited some of us to stop by here Friday to celebrate her just-received and hard-earned master's degree from ASU. So I went. We ate in the oyster bar area. The place is really cute. Sure, it looks kind of corporate, but in a nice way. It's definitely the kind of place I would want to stop by for drinks with my friends. The wine list was OK, and they had some nice sake and martinis. Our waitress was great and really friendly.  The seafood platter they ordered smelled good.. and everyone who ate it said it was tasty. It's definitely a bit pricey, but if the seafood is really that fresh, I guess it's worth it.  I'll probably bring my parents here when they visit and then I'll try something off the menu. The choices (aside from the sushi and seafood platters) range from pricey things like $20+  for the trout or the macadamia-nut crusted halibut to $12 tuna melts.  In the meantime, I have a good opinion of this place. Oh, and it's actually in the parking lot area of Tempe Marketplace, not in that annoying pedestrian part dubbed "The District." So that earns it some points, too.

eyzeO2JFQTxv-7nW7a-JMA.text: It's rare that I take the time to write a review but my experience here was so bad I felt compelled to alert anyone who is considering dining here.   My husband and I had a night out and were looking forward to good food and conversation-we had spotted this seafood restaurant and thought we would give it a try. We went in and immediately it was clear that we just seated ourselves. Then a friendly waiter came by and took our drink order. However, it was at least 15 minutes until the drinks returned.   Looking over the menu, we quickly realized that it was more expensive than anticipated (most dishes running between $15.00-30.00) But we rationalized that it's worth paying the difference for quality seafood. So, we placed our orders.  When the food came out and we glimpsed the plates-immediately we were concerned. The presentation was awful and the portions small. My meal consisted of overcooked Talipia, with a small, sad pile of potatoes and coleslaw. I don't consider myself much of a cook but I can tell you that I've made far better fish and potatoes at home. My husband took one bite of his shrimp and pushed the plate away. His shrrimp, also overcooked, was completely unappealing and repulsive.   We discussed the situation and both decided the last thing we wanted to do was spend roughly $70.00 on a horrible meal. We agreed that we'd had far better at Red Lobster. The price rivaled one of my favorite seafood restaurants The Chart House (where I can guarantee you, you won't be disappointed).   We flagged the waiter and asked him to remove the meals from our ticket and that we'd go elsewhere for dinner. Something my husband and I had never, ever done before.   The one good thing I can say, is that both the waiter (and the Manager who came by) were very apologetic and accomodating. They were the one bright spot in a truly awful experience.

WIjbDQ7-mq39CvO-BNe3tQ.text: 4 Fabulous stars! My mom and her boyfriend were in town and I have heard good things about this place so we decided to check it out. My spring mix salad was good, but standard. Let's face it, we did NOT go for the salad anyway. I ordered the Parmesan crusted Sand Dabs with my two choices as garlic mashed potatoes and steamed veggies. My Sand Dabs were fabulous! I had only had them one other time at McCormick & Schmicks and I think these were just a tad bit better. They were perfectly fried. I must admit the sides were a tad bit lacking. My husband ordered the Mexican coconut shrimp and they were quite good as well. Mom's boyfriend ordered Halibut Almondine and was in love at first bite. My mom had a salmon dish and she was also quite pleased with her choice. Now. I can over look the standard salad and the slightly ordinary sides but this place gets -1 solid star for the dessert. I ordered creme brule... one of my favorites. It tasted like it was from a box. A standard custard... Blech! I held out on dessert every other night we went out to dinner and this place was quite a disappointment. Now on the other hand my husband and mom both devoured their bread pudding with out complaint and the mom's boyfriend claimed his key lime pie was only second to one and that's saying A LOT.   Now. This place COULD have been 3 stars but they got the bump up for the following reasons:  -Fresh fish flown in with menus printed daily  -I caught a buzz off two martinis.  -We were all happy with our selections which is quite a feat.   Should have been 3 stars because:  -price is on the higher side... I'd rather go to McCormick & Schmicks for the price  -crappy desserts.   I admit I am a little surprised to see some of the reviews at 1 or 2 stars. We had great service and our food came out in a timely manner, as did our drinks.

CX4PIC6jd4Wfv5x3D8ALDQ.text: We came here for our wedding anniversary last Fall and were very disappointed. My parents love this place in Southern CA, so they recommended we eat here in Tempe. The waiter didn't seem to know much about the menu and wasn't able to offer really good advice. He just would say everything was "really good." He also seemed to take occasional smoke breaks, because he would come back to our table wreaking of cigarettes and stink up the whole area. It was extremely unappetizing to smell that odor throughout our dinner. Every time he'd come back to the table, the smell of like wet musty cigs just kind of lingered in the air and my husband and I would look at each other. In addition to that, the food was bland. I ordered steamed mussels and they really didn't offer any kind of good broth. I also ordered a white fish off their most popular menu thinking that I couldn't go wrong and it was completely bland. My husband thought his meal was decent. We both agreed we would never go back to King's Fish House when we want to eat a nice seafood meal.

fQgFz3XQzYDYCQWjl86PAg.text: This place was really good. For seafood in the middle of the desert this is the place to go. Great clam chowder, good bread and calamari, fresh fish and good service. The interior was very comfortable and the beers were good. This place isn't cheap, but it also isnt too expensive. I like to go here for dinner and a movie.

Uu2BzGDf0KmihVP5nNlETg.text: My husband and I love seafood! we had been wanting to check this place out....we finally did and were really dissapointed! totally overpriced! We had a bowl of clam chowder to start off and it had maybe one clam in it and super salty. We decided to go with the cold sea food plate(not sure what its called) the description said for 2 or more ppl. They made it sound like a very large plate with shrimp, crab, oysters and clams ($27).finally got our food and were surprised to see a big plate full of ice! Only 4oysters 4shrimp 4 small clams and 3very small crab legs! This was not even enough as an appetizer for 1 person! Our server was very distracted, even though it wasnt busy at all. deff wont be coming back to waste money on something that is not worth it at all.

LdLAxHeFmlYsR9tuQFgTfw.text: The only reason I don't give them a single star is because I'm hoping one day they get back to form. My family has been going to the Salt Cellar for many many years and this place stole our business. They always made amazing seafood, fish, and believe it or not had the best wings hands down! Now its just not the same. I heard they switched or lost their main chef, I don't know if thats True. But I bragged this place up for years and finally got my entire girlfriends family to try it as they're big seafood fans. Absolutely terrible the last couple viists. Nobody finished their plate. The staff is still excellent and extremely knowledable about the menu. The cook needs to go! I feel bad because I know it hurts their tips. To say the least after paying for the whole meal and about $200+ later I was upset and won't be back. Salt Cellar is a farther drive but if I'm dropping that much money in a restaurant I want my money's worth.

3pis00RVpPh7mMzjjUTDiQ.text: This has to be my favorite seafood restaurant hands down. The service is always impecable. They are very helpful and go above and beyond to accomidate me and make sure everything taste good. I usually order the salmon or sushi and I am never dissapointed.  The sushi always taste so fresh.I always like to finish off my meal with there creme brulee, which My server told me they make from scratch. I haven't found any seafood places to top kings fish house and I don't believe I will.

9DZa8TdvAGhYquEkWxywHg.text: Convenient location with good parking.  I ordered the sand dabs.  They were excellent.  The sides were just ok.  Would not recommend the mac & cheese, but the veggies were very good.  The drinks are expensive.  The service was friendly, but don't expect a leisurely meal as they tend to rush through the courses.    We will probably go back as it is difficult to get good fish in the Valley, but will skip the cocktails next time.

4s7pKu5XjYTyMUze-7LshA.text: Ok, so we've been here  a total of two times... the first was a pretty good experience... not memorable, but ok. Then we went again, last night for Mothers Day. My Dad wanted the Trout so bad, so us Mothers gave in. The only positive thing to say about them is how nice they were, we called to see if we could get in at for dinner at 8:30pm, (they closed at 9pm) they said not a problem. I was kinda impressed cuz we've called other restaraunts and they have turned us down in the same senario.... when we sat down, we ordered right away, it took awhile for us to get our food, i finally had to flag our waitress down and ask her to bring whatever was ready whenever it was ready. My salad was probably the best thing I had that night next to the water. Come on tho, how hard is it to mess up salad and a water! My Dad had the trout, he finished it but said it wasnt the best, my Mom had the Chicken Parmesean. She picked around the stuff she didn't like. I ordered a coconut shrimp apetizer, it arrived cold. The bill for two adult entrees and one appetizer a small ceaser salad and one childs meal was $80....  we still tipped $20, but $100 for one of the worst meals in a long time wasn't worth it. We won't be back at least for awhile.

1VumsYP4fUruWPybsD-qiA.text: I went here with my best friend recently. Her fish was dried out and full of bones and the waitress acted incredibly rude and pious to us. I ordered a quesadilla, and it came in a little basket cut up and stacked, was incredibly thin and tiny, and tasted funky and gave me a bad aftertaste that lasted all night. We're never coming back to Tempe Markeplace, let alone King's Fish House.

Op7aNBV0KFUD70wWW5Iz7w.text: for being located in a land-locked state, the seafood was really good. i had this spicy bbq shrimp dish and the shrimp was done perfectly. it definitely had a lot of spice, so if you like spicy food, this one's for you.  the clam chowder was not too thick and not watered down. could have a little more seafood in it, but still worth eating. the service was really good, our waitress was super nice i didn't have to ask/wait for a refill on my drink. will go back if in the area.

x9xDYB-7FqlG3sof0LHEoQ.text: Almost any place that has Stone Pale Ale can get 4 stars with me...  I've started taking visitors here regularly, especially if they want fish.  They print their menus new every day to reflect the fresh fish.  The garlic roasted asparagus appetizer is the best I've ever had.  Sometimes, I just want this for lunch all to myself.  I keep experimenting with the fish, and I've been both pleased and disappointed.  Had dry Thresher Shark once, and I don't really like their blackening seasoning.  And their side items suck.  But if you're looking some good fish or oysters, and hate side items, check it out...

eA-2PTYZ0QxX5yF54F5oNg.text: On our first trip to Tempe Marketplace we decided to dine at King's Fish House as me and my wife rarely get to eat fish with an 8 year old in tow, but their kids menu seemed adequate, so we decided to say.  We started with the Clam Chowder which was flavorful, but the portion was small, which turned out to be a theme throughout the night.  My wife and I split the Blackened Mahi Mahi with Mango salsa along with Jasmine rice and Glazed carrots. I won't argue with the price of a good meal, but our portions were really small for the price. The rice had only a hit of Jasmine, and the carrots were underdone. The fish was very good, but again I was put off by the portion size.  For dessert we had Strawberry Shortcake, and while the "cake" was good, size was again a problem as the shortcake wasn't much larger than a half-dollar.  Our waiter was inattentive as we had to ask for drinks and bread several times, and he didn't seem very knowledgeable about the menu.  Overall the food was good, but there was nothing special about the experience at all, and there is not much value based on the portion size. I would not recommend this restaurant.

cPgxpItDt65zqtRg3WoN6w.text: Great service. Staff was super friendly and attentive. Fried food over cooked.. Don't expect to taste crab in your crab cakes. They were deep fried which is a no no especially at fine dining restaurants. Price would have been fair if seafood was fresh.

bZkQBLhI4EzYOpr8yT4rYw.text: We are all the way from Reno, and they have great food they have there seafood delivered every couple days and they print there menu twice daily and thats how fresh there food is depending on what is they het shipped is that's on the menu, they have great service we had Jeremy and Stephen (the gray haired kid) as our server, they we're implacable they gave wonderful service and very knowledgeable on how, when, and where there food is coming from and how it's prepared.

QjFqI9LngkZjW_Fz2lnyrg.text: Came in with my best friend and her family and had an amazing experience! We were sat on the patio and it was beautiful and the temperature was perfect. There was a decent variety of menu items from sushi, to fish, to pasta, to sandwiches. Our waiter and even the staff passing by our table were personable and attentive! A bottle of wine, lobster, and good friends... ideal night!

t_aAkZe3x0FMLtPR7RfPJg.text: Great service- Amanda at the bar was great. Great food. Fresh lobster and everything is made in house and not pre-made. Fresh seafood and good variety of fresh oysters. We will back for sure.

wuacETfsQpEGvFFcCwQnDA.text: Just put this place out of its misery and close it down. I mean, I'll give it 2 stars for the food which wasn't terrible but definitely forgettable. My husband, daughter, and I went when the restaurant was practically empty on July 18th between 2 and 4 pm. It was my birthday. We sat in the bar area. We were definitely seated in an area where a shift change occurred as our appetizer orders were taken by a woman and a man ended up taking our entree and dessert orders. Everything took very long and there was literally 1 other table in the restaurant besides us. Both waiters were exceptionally uninterested in giving us even decent service. I hate having to leave a tip for people who don't really do anything and you almost get the feeling that they want you to leave. Nevertheless, I left a tip to keep some sort of strange dignity for the black community which I am going to stop doing. People are just going to have to think black people don't tip because I just think it's unfair to have to continually tip people for giving poor service. Even so, I don't think it was a race thing, I just think it was a genuine IDGAF thing. These days, it's like people think you owe them everything, as if being polite is some sort of task or strenuous chore. They expect so much but give so little. You're not feeding animals at a zoo, you're feeding people. That's how I tried to think when I waited tables. I always asked people what brought them in today, tried to find out if it was someone's birthday, if they were celebrating an anniversary or some other special occasion. That's really basic stuff, some people will be rude and not want to be bothered, wait on them accordingly, but give everyone who walks through the door a clean slate for a good experience. It will not go unnoticed.

nZ8NPGKFccTL18ZdM5jH0Q.text: GREAT SERVICE. GREAT FOOD. Aiden was amazingly hilarious and made our time at King's so much fun. He is hands down the best server I have ever experienced in this life time. I will never forget the memories that were made tonight and will most certainly be back very soon...   -Maclyn

CG5fwACZjS70AK95ngmh-w.text: My coworker and I went here for a quick dinner after work and were pleasantly served by a quick-witted and engaging maitre'd.  Aiden was knowledgeable and also hilarious. We spent the whole dinner laughing and really appreciated his humor. Kudos to Patrick (GM) for hiring him! He's a great representative for the company.

PWdpC-b639cwFaAQJKpa8A.text: Fish tacos were good.  Sever was pleasant and took good care of us.  We enjoyed the outdoor seating.   Go here and not Dave and Busters.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States

RGPmYKRODxRGbQrNMBPJaA.text: At at Kings Fish House last night with my wife and two toddlers. We had an awesome experience mostly because of our waitress Jessica V!  She new we had kids and time was limited. She took our order right away and was so great with our kids. Jessica was such a pleasure at a time where good service is hard to find. We loved our food as well. I would highly recommend Kings Fish House for a great atmosphere and how great it was for our kids!!!  Well done Kings!

ogjO6g3GLl7OeuUJEvvswA.text: Wow!!!  What an experience!  I'm not even joking when I say this is the best seafood restaurant in the Phoenix metro area! Jessica's service was professional, friendly, and extremely detailed.

SqE2wnBZuMba0VOAd3yQuA.text: Service was great and the food was awesome! Thanks for making our Father's Day awesome with a perfect lobster dinner. Props to our server Raeshel!!!

b6GgDr_NGsohJxBRvEsnSw.text: Wandered in on a Sunday night.  The place was darn near empty.  Settled in at the bar. Claire was our bartender.  She was fantastic!  We decided to just order a series of appetizers while enjoying some cocktails and the Sunday night sports.  Oysters on the half shell sampler were pretty good. A little on the small side. I prefer the bigger ones personally.  Next were the Blackened Shrimp Taquitos. These were tasty. Good flavor and crunch. The Baked Penn Cove Mussels are a must. A different twist on traditional baked mussels.   We decided to venture into sashimi and a roll.  The sashimi was average at best.  The Lobster Crunchy Roll was a score! We went back to shrimp with the N'awlin's BBQ Shrimp. The shrimp was good but the real treat to this dish is to dunk the bread into the sauce and then place the tomatoes on the bread similar to bruschetta. That was a home run!  Don't forget the Butter Cake!!

00dNUwdmyUB333D5o44Nrw.text: This is the second time I've eaten here. the first was about three years ago. I remembered the first time I wasn't really disappointed but really wasn't impressed; especially with the portion size for the price. Time has gone by and Jen and I figured why not try it again.   Jen ordered the Barcat Oysters and really liked them. We also ordered Crab Cakes as appetizers. I was a little disappointed in the Crab Cakes.  Breaded and fried like typical cakes. they were good and the sauce accompanying them was also good. Unfortunately, all crab cakes we eat will be compared to the cakes we had in Sedona at Creekside (see my review and pics).  That was at a breakfast type restaurant and you would think a place with Fish House as part of it's name would be able to blow you away with their version. $12 and the portion size also was lackluster.  For entrees Jen order the Yellowtail Carpaccio and I ordered the Sea Scallops.  Jen said it was ok. The mash potatoes as one of my sides and.was very gritty which means they were overcooked.  The Mac and Cheese was, well, Mac and cheese. They do sprinkle it with panko breading which I like cause it gives a nice crunch. Portion size on the scallops was ok but they were a little small for sea scallops; quantity of 8.  They were good but a little overcooked on one side to the other.  I told Jen were just going to Costco for seafood from now on because we can't find a REALLY good seafood place around Phoenix.   Bill was $75 and for what we got was too high. We ate at The Keg on Chandler Blvd. a week ago and both had prime rib and a scallops app and it was $10 less.  I don't mind paying top dollar for good food and service but I want to get what I pay for.  On a final note, our server Korey was really friendly and very helpful when I asked questions about menu items.  He was also very attentive and probably the only highlight of our experience there.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States

FHRr4GHSIVOMYOdJ4g3WEQ.text: So being a desert dweller seafood in a land lock state is risky business.  But right off the start you can tell that this isn't the normal seafood parlor.  Our bartender who's name eludes me but I'd like to shoot props to was great and described the menu along with her fav's.  We did the sampler of the oysters, beers and the Scallops and overall everything was freaking DELISH!  If you're an oyster fan the Hama Hama's are amazingly briny and the Scallops are a presentation that's on point.  We visited on a quiet night and the one thing I admired is that there's no TVs which makes for guaranteed conversation.

pyEysm1m_JVHQ7HSsV8Kzg.text: It was my pleasure to again visit Kings Fish House in Tempe Marketplace. The food and service is always great. The Seafood Chowder is great. Spicy and piping hot.  It was our good fortune to take a seat in one of the gigantic booths in the bar tonight, Fat Tuesday. Among the talents that stand out, was Gilbert who is a great talent.  The outstanding feature of this restaurant is that they operate on the "Team concept". If Gilbert gets tied up, another talent jumps in to help, including the supervisor.  Good food, wonderful people make for a great night out.  Did I mention the rich wood tone decor. You can't do better.

tdxM3bXAagRe8RFDTgdhuA.text: The King Fish House Happy Hour is fabulous! Great food and wonderful service from Gilbert at the bar. It was a great birthday for my boyfriend - thanks to Gilbert and King's Fish House for a wonderful birthday celebration!

QH2yRx8BDeUgrhrmXb6dJw.text: Best seafood I've had in Tempe! The staff is super friendly, management is well engaged and our server Kaylin was awesome! She was so helpful in explaining the menu and giving us suggestions. The butter cake dessert is a must have!

Og71uEwXr-SxLtiYvbzcaw.text: First off, I would like to give credits to the management team of King's Fish House. Managers are open to take customers' opinions into consideration, and I found it very proficient and adequate.   As stated in my previous review, I will draft another updated review based on my last visit for lunch at this place, and also for the invitation of the management team. This time, after jumbling through the menu once again for a closer look. I decided to go for Rainbow Trout Amandine with mango salsa, plus 2 sides of sauteed spinach and grilled zucchini.  At this moment, I am impressed. The trout is crunchy from the outside, but it also contains enough moisture. The garlic sauce (you can find it on the table) and the main entree is a perfect combination together. However, the sauteed spinach is just not my taste. The sourdough bread is fresh baked, and I prefer to enjoy it with sugar and butter on top.   Once you know what to order, you can't go wrong with the your selection. They rotate the lunch menu every week, so each day they will have different specialties. Overall, my experience was improved this time. Thanks King's for the hospitality.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Trout, grilled zuchini, sauteed spinach
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. This sauce is goooood

7_fl6FylR7pF_yEjUEV2Iw.text: Came here for dinner with a few girl friends and I was very pleasantly surprised with the service! Our waitress's name was Sarah and she was very helpful and attentive. She recommended the salmon to me, my favorite kind of fish, and it was delicious. Can't wait to come back again!

TDBTscintuNUTjDj2kIzZA.text: We had a fantastic meal here.. We enjoyed the macadamia crusted halibut it was awesome. We had the fish and chips the fish was great but the breaking was a little less than expected we didn't even really complain about it the just noticed we had pulled the breading off and because it was not to our standard they took it off the bill. We had fat astir customer service from Claire and Michael who was training but very personable and attentive. The Manager Patrick came over and talked to us following and was very appreciative of input. We feel the only thing we would change was the restrooms they were clean but had no character related to the rest of the restaurant put some effort into fixtures and decor. Good food excellent selection food prepared to preference.

Qppt44rxu_voDTxe4X6n6Q.text: If you're looking for an East Coast style lobster roll, King's Fish House in the Tempe Marketplace is the spot to go! The bun was perfectly toasted and sliced to create a pocket filled with a generous heap of warm and delicious chunks of lobster. We also had the grilled wild jumbo shrimp plate paired with asparagus which were both cooked perfectly. The fries, mac n cheese and cole slaw were your standard sides.  The restaurant itself was nice and spacious. They brought a sling for our little one's car seat so he could rest while we had dinner. Wonderful service! Will definitely return for future seafood meals!

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lobster roll with fries and cole slaw. Grilled wild jumbo shrimp with mac n&#39; cheese and asparagus.

p97K44ZJDjQJX3qYcVCn_g.text: I was excited to try this place seeing as I love seafood! It's super close by so by no means was I going out of my way to visit here.   We entered by the bar (later realizing that wasn't the main entrance) and navigated to the front before we were greeted. We were quickly seated and waited for our server. The restaurant was quite empty on a weekday night but we didn't mind at all. A pretty large menu full of seafood options left me completely indecisive. Our server greeted was friendly and gave us time to go through the menu before we ordered. I opted for the Trinidad Swizzle cocktail, shared the King's Crab Cakes for appetizer, and chose the Farmed Idaho Trout Amandine with a side of spinach and a baked potato for my entree.   It took a while for our food to come out, enough for us to keep looking in the direction of the kitchen hoping our food was on the next tray out. The rum-based cocktail was great, and the crab cakes had good flavor despite a mushy. I was a little underwhelmed by the entree; although it looked good and was filling, I found it didn't have much flavor to me and was a bit bland.   The service was still nice and I'd be willing to try something else on the menu next time; hopefully something with a bit more flavor and pizzazz to it.

FkMz9B_FBriBEoHDUSOTkA.text: My boyfriend and I stopped in this restaurant and I was worried because it was around 4pm or so and the place was empty which I thought was strange and hoped it wasn't an indication of the food and service. The service was great. I ordered the N'awlins Jumbo BBQ Shrimp which wasn't really BBQ but more of spicy tomato based sauce. It came with Jasmin rice but my waiter recommended subbing the rice for the mashed potatoes to help offset the spiciness.   I was pleasantly surprised at just how generous they were with the jumbo shrimp.. there were 12 jumbo shrimp in my dish! Most places do not give you that many. The mashed potatoes were divine.  My boyfriend ordered the herb chicken with mashed potatoes and also enjoyed it. I would definitely come back!

wP7L0C9wpNfNROzazKl0wg.text: Came here for birthday dimmer 9/16...the food was amazing, Richard our server recommemded the halibut macadamia and it was delicious. So glad for the recommend. He was attentive and friendly. Definitely will be back.

hf_tQN-ujvBHkJQzghDjlA.text: I had a really good experience here. Richard was my server and made amazing recommendations. I was so surprised to experience such a great meal.

ThoCXnd1n6zdqdCSlcz5Fw.text: Gave this place another go as we had friends who wanted try the food here. It's still a solid 2 stars. The food is still blah... no flavor or way too battered... but Lorie(our server) was great and tried to make up for the food.   My husband had the Cioppino which was ok. The snow crabs were tiny and not cracked, other seafoods were so small it got lost in the broth. I had the King's Combo Platter which was ok. Fish was way too battered and 2 pieces of over fried shrimp and 2 halves of scallops were over cooked. A friend had the Clam Linguini which had no flavor. Another friend had the Halibut which she was excited to try, unfortunately she had to ask for sauce for it to be decent. Kids ordered the Kids shrimp plate... 3 pieces of over cooked shrimp and some fries. But at least the calamari was great this time! The Brussel Sprouts were great too. Fortunately the company and service made up for the food which was over priced(our bill was over $300) and over cooked.

wfZUaKxYVB8YjHL7mmfT5Q.text: Pretty solid seafood. I called ahead while shopping in the mall next door on a Friday night and had a 45-60 minute wait. No big deal, that just means it's probably good. Boy, was it! We ordered a dozen various oysters, and for dinner we both ordered the king crab. Phenomenal. My daughter ordered the fried shrimp and it was also delicious. PRmd774O8sS_h_rDmpyR9A.text: I am a big Cioppino lover so was excited to give it a try.  I had that and it was a big disappointment.  Crab was almost impossible to crack the shell and the meat was soggy once I fought my way in.  Shrimp arrived with head and legs still on.  Once I fought my way in the shrimp was not only tough but they were soggy too.  The only reason this is not a one star is my wife and our friends had better luck.  Wife had fresh halibut and it was very good.  The other couple had trout and the other Alaskan Sand Dabs.  Both reported excellent also.  I tasted the Sand Dabs and would order those next time.  Restaurants that have Cioppino on their menu need to know people ordering it are people with high expectations and need to go high quality or take it off your menu.  If you are on the hunt for excellent Cioppino thy Avanti in Phoenix.  Update: GM Michelle reached out and asked for a second chance. We had dinner there again Sat night.  All is well.  I had the Sand Dabs this time (3 of us did).  They were amazing.  Service was excellent.  Thanks Michelle for reaching out.

ryVDlJLb_aXhLwYgCBqQcQ.text: This place was exceptional from beginning to end. The service was first-class. The ambiance was very tranquil and delightful. The entrees were simply marvelous. I enjoyed the hazel nut salmon with grilled zucchini and macaroni and cheese. My wife had grilled shrimp and scallops. My children had grilled salmon, fish and chips, and a cheeseburger respectively. For dessert, we had butter cake and key lime pie. This place was off the chain! The server, Aidan, made me and my family feel like royalty. I will definitely be returning to this fine establishment.

4OF9EfU7zY3qvHeeP3uZ3A.text: I've been to King's Fish House three times over the past two years - the food is always amazing and atmosphere is perfect in the middle of the day on a weekend.   Today our server was Brandon; he was very good. A little scarce, but we weren't in a hurry, as it was my husband's birthday.   At the table we ordered these items:  1. Ono (fish) - excellent, five stars. Comes with two sides, and all the sides are good; you can't go wrong.  2. Fish & Chips -- their Cod is as good as it gets. This was fabulous, which made me glad because it's what my husband ordered for his birthday.  3. Cheeseburger - very good; my daughter couldn't even finish it all, likely because she scarfed down so much of the fantastic sourdough table bread.  4. Tuna Melt sandwich - the sandwich itself (bread and fixings) were perfect, but the Tuna (it's pieces of a tuna steak) was very dry. I eventually took most the fish out of the sandwich and it was very good. Unfortunately, I would not order it again because of the dry, though good-flavored tuna. Maybe they should consider making it a tuna-salad kind of tuna melt? 5. I ordered a cup of the New England clam chowder and it was out of this world. Best I've had in a super-long time. I could have had only the clam chowder and the bread and I would have been in hog-heaven.  6. We received a free dessert for my husband's birthday and another free dessert because a ramekin of ketchup was spilled all over the seat and floor as my food was being delivered to me (I had white shorts on but thankfully it hit the bench, not me-phew). She was super-apologetic and wiped it up thoroughly. Not sure if she was a hostess or the manager.     These things do sometimes happen - no points off for that. The manager gave us another free desert for the Ketchup issue. Sooo... although we were stuffed, the four of us managed to eat both desserts. They were very delicious as well as appealing to the eyes. Yum - creme brulee and a very chocolatey piece of cake. Both were excellent and the creme brulee was a good size - not skimpy unlike how some restaurants bring a tiny little creme brulee. I would certainly get the creme brulee again in a heartbeat. 6. The bathrooms weren't in the best working order. They looked great when you walk in - nicely decorated like the rest of the restaurant. However, in the ladies' room, the lock on the handicapped stall doesn't work. Hard to believe that they haven't fixed that. The sliding lock doesn't match up with the hole on the doorframe. I used it without locking and hoped for the best.    One of the sinks, the closest to the door, has a faucet that is about 1/5th or 1/6th corroded where it has been eaten away by calcium or some other chemical. On the same sink, the soap pumper is loose and barely works. Weird. Here's hoping they will fix these items in short order. All three toilets are kind of low-flow and they don't flush everything down very well, even after 2-3 flushes.      We will certainly be back when we have another special occasion. You should consider it too - lots of sushi and sushi roll options, fabulous-sounding salads, plentiful fish, shrimp and crab options, interesting pastas, and hamburgers for those who just have to have their beef. Reservations are recommended.

C3GPlXohdWjZkfUmIIDvHg.text: Service and Food: 12 Stars!!! This is the absolute best seafood you can get in Arizona!!! Had the Crab Cakes to start and then the Oyster Sampler. Had to try some sushi after that so I ordered the Lobster Crunchy Roll and the  Caterpillar Roll for dinner. Absolutely AMAZING. The Old Fahioned is perfection!!! Brandon, our server was one of the best we've ever had. His knowledge of the menu really helped make the experience memorable. He was so friendly and helpful. I will definitely be back!!!

LlOAYiLQoPZcmiCs2v-7yQ.text: I want to let you know about the stellar server we enjoyed today during lunch at your Tempe location.  Her name was Amy and she was by far one of the nicest, most genuine servers I've had in a long time.  It wasn't one really big thing, it was all of the little genuine ways she made us feel welcome and valued as patrons.  I feel that people are quick to complain and much less likely to post a positive experience.  I hope that you'll let Amy know that she made our group of three feel truly valued!

uLURZMPGg81i23zakhsUlw.text: Ok.. coming to a seafood spot you know you're going to be spending some money. I don't mind that as long as its worth it. The sourdough bread appetizer was awesome. The clam chowder was also very good. $8.50/bowl. For our meals we each had the sea bass. Which was only about $20, so not unreasonable. The portion was decent and the Brussels sprouts and kale sides were very good. BUT.. the sea bass was overcooked and not tender. The flavor was ok, but the texture just didn't melt in your mouth or cut like butter. It felt more like pollock due to the overcooking.
