DaggSsuZSBmEEh03_XKwxA.text: Had a great meal as always and we always sit in the bar because we love the service we get from Ashly!!! As good as the food so it one of our regular places especially during football season.  Thanks for another great time!

5Rr0AI-BfThVyPYXOApZFA.text: This was my 2nd time to this restaurant and will be our last. Our waiter Cody spent more time "chatting" with his fellow co-workers. Salad was late and only brought when we asked about it. Iceberg lettuce for $4.95! Food was immediately brought after salad. Food was luke warm. Ordered scallops and paid $25.00 for them. 8 1" fishy tasting. Worst scallops ever, especially for the price. We ordered a bottle of wine and Cody put in a bucket at the end of our table. Not once did he come back and pour for us. Very sub-par for the money. Won't return!

lWfbzeSYsnsFM7HPoVx-BQ.text: My wife and I have dined at this chain's Long Beach, CA location as well as the Tempe, AZ location.  Based on those previous experiences we chose the Tempe location as the place we wanted to dine on our 45th wedding anniversary.  Based on this most recent experience I don't think we will be back.  First, we were both disappointed with the portion size.  My wife ordered the grilled catfish and she was served 4-5 ounces of fish.  Normally, one would think in terms of an 8 oz portion, especially catfish, which is one of the more common of fish.  She thought it tasted OK, but just OK, nothing special.  I ordered the ono, one of my favorite pacific fish, and I also got about a  5 ounce portion.  It was good, but nothing special.  The catfish was $17.50 and the ono was $20.75.  Very skimpy portions for the price.  There is a $1.50 extra charge of you want asparagus.  That's a little high given that most grocery stores sell it for about that much per pound in season.  My wife got about 6 stalks.  For sides I chose mac and cheese and the corn.  I got mashed potatoes and corn.  The mac and cheese was promptly brought out when I noted the problem.  It was good, but you only got about 4 ounces.  The corn was so loaded with silk that it was barely edible.  My wife said her mashed potatoes were good.  The wine list was standard, nothing outstanding.  Prices for wine were average$7.50 - $11.00 per glass for most choices.  Service was OK, but just OK.  The waiter did not seemed impressed with our response to his questions that we were celebrating our 45th anniversary.   "Cool.  I've been married ten years," he responded (at leasat he didn't say "Awesome.").  Good for him.  He never asked if we wanted a second glass of wine, which cut his tip, of course.  He did come back once to ask if everything was OK.  My wife questioned the size of her portion, but he just said that that was what the kitchen prepared.  Tip and tax put us over $80 for just a so-so meal.  I could not recommend this restaurant.

a2cdYq_7RsudNIwWWOgvKg.text: My daughter and I ate here for Mother's Day. We were seated and met by our server, Brian, immediately. We asked to sit outside which was beautiful and relaxing. We had the calamari, the best I've had in the valley. My daughter ordered the lobster, which she said was amazing. I ordered the salmon which was seared perfectly and cooked to perfection. I don't want to leave our the two desserts we had. The creme  brulee and cheese cake topped off an amazing meal. Our server was very professional, friendly and made our evening very enjoyable. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.

muadfYVsSWqLkODOhqt4ng.text: We are restaurant connoisseurs...we try all different types of places and have our favorites...mostly seafood fares.   So we were excited to learn of the Kings Fish House and the wonderful menu. We decided to try dinner last Saturday and to make a long story short, we were disappointed.   We rate restaurants for our overall experience, not just the food. And unfortunately, this place delivered neither. Our server, to put it mildly, was very curt and not helpful with understanding the menu. It seemed like we were a bother to him, eating at his station. Awful service. Now to the meals...everything was was over cooked...for a seafood restaurant, you would figure they would know how to cook it...not the case. It was a shame to have over cooked clams, King Crab legs and lobster...chewy, ALL of it. Even the rice was over cooked...really?! Again, too bad...giving this place 1 star for convenience of location....that's it.

elnmOdMKGQvAF9FoVXg6Eg.text: My wife and I went here a while back and wont go again! She had a burger that was OK. I was the one that had all the problem! I ordered the fish with the side of mac. and the oyster sampler. The oysters were good but way over priced for the 8. My food got there at last and the fish was around a 3 oz portion which the waitress pointed out that I had a bigger portion coming! Why the hell would they even send it out if it wasn't right? I at my two bites of fish and while I was waiting for the rest of my missing fish I try ed the mac. I was old and dried out. I sent it and they brought me another portion that was nearly as bad. By this time my wife was finished with her food and I still waited.I finely got the attention of one of the wait staff (I hadn't seen my waitress for a while) and asked when the rest of my fish was coming? No one knew what I was yalking about. They hunted down my waitress, the girl who brought me the skimpy order and the manager. By the time it was all straightened out we were ready to leave. They comped the fish but for the burger and the oysters and a couple of beers the bill was still over fifty! I wont be back!   I have to now give praise to the Fish House! I first posted my thoughts on a food blog and never had a response. Once I posted on Yelp I received several e-mails all from different individuals voicing their concern about my experience at Kings! I have to say that my opinion has changed drastically about this establishment! If I get a response of concern like this from just my complaint I feel that they really do care about everything related to their establishment and have to give them cu dos and high marks! I will continue.....

SVVLlCfWGV5kbUCxVsUmjg.text: Great place, for some reason i don't think it is ever really that busy though which i guess is a good thing if you are trying to snag a table quick. The wait staff were really helpful and friendly and knowledgeable on everything they offered up.    The only reason they don't get Five stars is because we ordered the Thresher Shark and they were out, so he offered another dish in place of it, but he pulled a sneaky quick one when the meal we got in place of it was more than double the price of the shark.... lol

mMZtBqG1yvmblatqMhVTAQ.text: Best seafood in the East Valley by far!!!! The fish is really fresh and incredibly delicious. The service is excellent. And the ambience/decor is lovely. The problem is that this restaurant is not cheap. This is not a $$ restaurant. More like a $$$$ restaurant.  But the food is so good, it's worth the splurge every now and then.

G9uENtH9mvdqrwNWhxV2BA.text: I ate their sushi on 3/22 and found that it was fresh. Service was pleasant and not hurried.

XtI10ZBeMfaW_5ozF_rROg.text: We've been here several times and always experienced great service and food. However, we walked out about a week ago due to awful service. We asked for a booth and were seated in the bar area. Maybe we had bar staff waiting on us and that explained the service, but there shouldn't be any difference from the main room. We ordered two salads, I had soup and appetizer, and we got a kids meal. The service was fine at first, with the kids meal coming out first, then my soup....then my appetizer....then nothing. Had to ask for more bread. About 45 min after waiting, we asked the front staff to tell the manager to get us some service. A few min later, our waiter came back, no apology, no eye contact, very sullen. He took a couple dishes away and said the food would be coming soon. Fifteen minutes later, still nothing, the waiter couldn't even be bothered to come by again. An hour after we had arrived and my husband still hadn't gotten anything to eat except the bread. We decided to leave and talked to the manager who apologized, comped what we had ordered and gave us a gift card. We'll obviously come back since this is clearly not normal for a restaurant like this, but was very surprised at such poor service on this night.

6bMGsCsCwsy3Lhsgo_HLMg.text: I had the live Maine lobster, she had the Mahi Mahi.  Lobster not bad (though not the best), and the Mahi Mahi was a little overcooked and dry.  Nothing terrible, and - unfortunately - just what you'd expect at an upscale "Mall-oriented / Chain" operation.  Overall, the place is OK but I doubt we'll be back.

XYHTAcOhmWR6EImAHeq2aQ.text: King's is a great experience.  The food is fresh, well prepared, comes in a good portion size, and is served by attentive staff.  I even enjoy the decor of the restaurant; it fits the bill quite well.  I'm not saying it's the best fish house ever, but considering the somewhat reasonable prices, it's a safe bet.

g1FiBKkjIX3gOPGvAckVfw.text: A restaurant with "fish" as part of it's name should know how to cook fish perfectly.  I ate there twice because I wanted to give them a second chance...mistake.  The fish was overcooked and dry (both times) and the lobster was rubbery.  It was such a let down.  The lobster bisque that Costco sells is far better than the bland version at Kings.  They did have a decent California roll though.  I was disappointed and will avoid this place in the future.

3WUoEdhXxGQK2K6_-0x7lw.text: My wife and I have gone to this place twice. The first time the service was mediocre, but the food was excellent. Today, we went back because we wanted to try their sushi. Overall it was a good visit, the service was OK, the sushi was good, but they didn't do a very good wrapping for the sashimi. I don't think we'll go back I'm just not sure it was worth the bucks.

cPsHsz-RrH8yDnTJSS_iKA.text: I have driven by King's so many times and wondered how the food was.   I finally went in for dinner Saturday after a movie and was pleasantly surprised.   I had grilled catfish, rosemary potatoes and spinach.   It was great.  My friend had the trout and he loved it.  It is a little pricey though.    BTW, the movie..... Shatter Island... HATED it.    I know hate is a strong word But I really HATED it.

-zGA3HVZAeJJEeIelFFfpA.text: My family and I had a wonderful dining experience. The food was very tasty and fresh. The waitstaff/ manager were very friendly and informative. The oysters were AWESOME!!!! The prices were fare. I will definitely return!!

wMZZeRgl3kEYZN1GIxDwCw.text: I drove by this place a bunch of times going to Tempe Marketplace and from the outside it looked like a cool place that was worth a try. I went with a work group and we got crab cakes and calamari as an appetizer that were decent. I ordered the trout, which was just okay, it was quite plain tasting, not much flavor. I can't really say too much good about this place, its nothing special, it acts like a step up from Red Lobster, but its really not. At least Red Lobster has great smoothies and cheddary biscuits.

rl8Gmn6ey95Q1077SFaT6Q.text: Hands down the best place for bivalves. I've dropped about about two hundred bucks on oysters there and have never been disappointed with one of them. Sitting at the bar (go figure) I like to start with a Stella and a dozen huge slurpers with some hot sauce. When a few friends show up we move on to the crabcakes and crab legs.  After a few more Stellas and few more friends we do oyster shooters till Lindsey cuts us off. Of the oysters, I mean.  Apparently their labor costs were getting a little out of hand with our group ordering so many. I love this place for the food and the good service. A definite must at the Marketplace.

5XaJw58D3iDGUgokSrvSog.text: We've been here twice and on both occasions the service and food were excellent.  Our server, Chris, was phenomenal and provided us with excellent recommendations for fresh oysters and our entrees.  We ordered the halibut, trout almondine and yellowtail.  We didn't have the tiniest morsel left on our plates.

-8nLvWne0z6tNoW56OD1Ig.text: I'm no seafood aficionado, but this place seemed pretty good to me, and I hope it sticks around because fresh seafood like this (and at these prices) is fairly unusual here in the desert. Our table tried the fish and chips, swordfish, seafood kebab and catfish -- and all were satisfied. As noted in other reviews, the staff is jovial and the atmosphere is pleasant. Whew -- saves me a trip to Boston!

aAU4ayEQGhbNw1LLUI4-kQ.text: One word comes to mind: overpriced. Then again, I'm no fish expert and can't really fathom why a pasta dish would reach $30 or why their appetizers can be $12.   The prices for oysters are reasonable. The ones I had just weren't shucked properly. Every one I slurped came with an unexpected piece of shell. It was really a bummer. This place does have a helluva lot of sauces to choose from, though, if you're adventurous.   Their Happy Hour menu isn't anything impressive. Not at all. Yucky American beer, like Bud, counts toward the $3.25 pint. Nothing else does. They do have a great Honey Ale and also offer Moose Drool here, as well as Orion, the best Japanese beer you'll find. And it costs $7.50 for the 22 oz, whereas you'll pay $9.00 for the same at Kabuki.  They also have a short sushi menu. It's not too impressive, but it's enough to pique your interest. I really loved their Rainbow Roll.   Maybe it's b/c we sat at the bar, but we barely got any service. And it began to annoy me. We had to ask for water. We had to ask to order. We had to ask for another 'round. We had to ask for soy sauce trays. We had to ask for just about everything, in fact.   The atmosphere is ordinary - what you might expect from a place called a "Fish House." Nothing really stood out to me.   Would I be back? Uhm, maybe, since they do have a couple good beers available, they serve fresh fish and they have a pretty wide selection of oysters to pick from... I just hope next time they're shucked properly.   I would like to try their King Crab/Shrimp appetizer. It was served to the gentleman beside us. It sounded good on the menu. It looked even better in person.   All in all, an okay place. But again, I think it's overpriced. You can easily walk out of there having spent $40 on a beer, a sushi roll and oysters.

uLpKpjC7VC9p0Q7XWZjYJg.text: I am not the biggest fan of seafood, but I happened to visit here and Nicole (bartender) took very good care of us. She was definitely pleasant and had a lot of suggestions for our likings. She is an excellent server!

M7bm3IRyg2x6E4HxPJzmwg.text: Super-nice staff... our server was attentive and friendly.   The decor/ambiance... well, it looks nice. As we walked up to it, we noticed a very fishy smell - that's never a good sign at a fish restaurant. However, we noticed on our way in that they had some oysters sitting on some ice at the bar and we decided to believe that's where the odor was coming from and not the actual entrees. Our menus were even fancy and clean and had today's date printed on them, so we knew we were getting some fresh shit. Overall, we were pretty impressed.   Now, I'm usually at a loss at fish restaurants since I'm more of a deep-fried cod and chips sort of guy. Most foo-foo fish places think the fish doesn't need any sauces or spices. To me, most fish tastes about the same - like not much. It's all about texture basically. Anyway - I had the Halibut and it was tasty - although a bit dry. It was also pretty expensive for a restaurant located in a mall built mainly for college kids at 26 bucks - though it did come with two "sidekicks" (which i assume refers to the fact that they will feel like a baby in your belly kicking your sides and squirming for the rest of the night).  They brought us some bread to snack on and it was great sourdough (the butter pats looked like 6 pack abs). The mac and cheese sidekick was very tasty and the fries weren't so bad. I mean, there's really not much else to say - I got great service and ate my food until I was bursting. The only drawbacks were the price and the Halibut was a tiny bit dry (but still good). I tasted the Salmon as well and that was prepared perfectly (but I don't like salmon).   I like this place better than Wildfish simply because this joint lacks the pretension you get with the type of patron it attracts. King's is very nearly a 5 star... I look forward to hitting this place up for a happy hour sometime to save some bucks. I'm also looking forward to getting some shrimp or scallop dish.

N0Tx5CBMpjWd3a0RIIG9_Q.text: Food was great. Service was great. Brittany did an awesome job... Definitely coming back.

EiwAfCg5uXDb05wmTequ_g.text: Jason was a great server and did awesome. Had the mahi mahi. For the price, there should have been twice the fish IMHO. Nice place.

zlpoaU-Cviza9URIwwbdAg.text: Had a great experience here last night. The cedar plank salmon was wonderful. Had a chance to taste the halibut, one encrusted in hazel nut and one simply grilled, both were top notch. Add to all this fine food, a fantastic server, Ash and you have a great night out. As a visitor to Temper Arizona, I was pleasantly surprised to find such a good  seafood restaurant.

gpR5E9VjlcQXolDEXqgZ0Q.text: On this Friday night we found it to be busy with a 20 minute wait but it was well worth it. This place is the best seafood place around. Great huge menu, friendly staff. Delicous food!  Husband had the Fish and Chips which he said was exceptional and I had Linguini with Clams, which I have to say was the best meal I've had in ages. Just perfect. Can't wait to return!

T3XcRr1twzfd_v7EprpfpA.text: Valentine's dinner... we were hopeful that the food and experience would be memorable and we were not dissapointed! From the warm sour dough bread, great cocktails, Merlin our waiter was delightful, clams and trout almondine...yummy!  Atmosphere is great, and we'll be back!!!

OCJsO1lIqmCQL4AtCvBpJQ.text: If you live near fresh water (San Francisco, Seattle) don't eat fish here. Everything - EVERYTHING is frozen. Sand dab, no, - scallops - no, prawns eh, no- even frying it didn't help. just don't eat fish in AZ.  Veggies are good  Wait staff is good Mojito was GREAT - not a mix

IMqmWgfxQOkjN9ASLmFkFw.text: King's Fish House is the incarnation of "average" in my book.  I ended up here for lunch with a handful of co-workers last week because we put the lunch option up to a vote, and this was the compromise spot.  This place isn't great, but it isn't horrible.  I'd never come here again of my own volition, but if I ended up here for some reason beyond my control, I'd find something on the menu that wouldn't suck.  As far as chain fish joints in Phoenix go, this is not nearly as good as say ... Kincaid's ... but it's far better than Joe's Crab Shack.  And that, in a nutshell, is why I give this place three stars.

1ZV8K7_QYn_NPZ47HYo9JA.text: My mom came to my side of town for us to have lunch and proclaimed she wanted lobster bisque. We both searched via our tech routes, her on her GPS, me on my phone via Yelp and I found this place first.   The reviews seemed to be mixed but Mom was paying so if she wanted lobster bisque, I was going to appease her.   The place looked dead from the outside and hardly any cars in the lot behind the restaurant didn't bode well. But they were open and just in the lull between lunch and dinner.   Mom got her lobster bisque and I decided to give it a whirl too. It was quite tasty and I didn't find it bland at all, unlike what one of the Yelpers said. I found it to have a nice little kick and loved the large chunks of lobster that are usually lacking at other places I've tried it.   Sourdough bread was served with our bisque and it was a very good sourdough.   Our server, Ismael, was very helpful with the large menu. About the only fault I could find with the service is that he seemed to be in a rush to leave the table while my mom was still talking to him. Granted, she was rambling a little about things not related to the menu but it was still a bit rude. The place wasn't busy so I don't think he had to rush off to help another table. I'm going to chalk this up to possible inexperience since Ismael's name tag was handwritten so maybe he was new?   We both decided to try a po' boy sandwich. The menu lists a shrimp po' boy but says to ask your server about other po' boys. We did ask and decided to try the oysters. The oysters in the sandwich were so tender and delicious. The sandwich came with fries and coleslaw. The fries were hot, thin and yummy. Coleslaw isn't my favorite but I didn't think to ask for something else. The sandwich had coleslaw inside too and that was okay but on its own I wasn't a fan.   Dessert was creme brulee, as usual. It was great with a large, sweet strawberry on top.   Going to take my fiance to try the oyster bar. Can't wait!

2QkqtYs9ZmW6Tk8unoBcwQ.text: Out of my desperation for needing a seafood fix in Tempe one night, the boyfriend and I went to King's. It was a brand I was familiar with so I thought it would be good...the result? Very over-priced, over-cooked, bland seafood. Fish and chips were not nearly as good as George and Dragon, the shrimp was rubbery, and the clam chowder tasted like it was from a can. The only good thing about the meal was the complimentary sourdough bread and the servers were very nice and friendly. Not impressed.

pPdHhLJ_8TTgVFR9gJ_HYA.text: Went here for a friend's b-day. The food was ok, service was mediocre, had to ask the waiter for water about 4 times, before actually getting it. They serve a variety of seafood, which really isnt that memorable, when I say memorable, I mean you can find better seafood at another place.   Prices are ridiculously expensive, I understand its seafood, but come on! I wont be returning unless I get a gift card from someone, even then I'll consider re-gifting it!

CG2bXTQlW7RoJLolrEitYw.text: Horrible service and my food was cold. If they had been busy, I MIGHT understand, seeing as I used to be a server myself. But we were the only people in the place. And considering that I've had such great experiences at other King's locations, I was very disappointed.

KK64ZD-0g1XbbaSEnf2PCQ.text: Went in for lunch and sat at the bar, Ashley helped me right away. Had the Mediterranean swordfish which was fantastic. Definitely will be back.

w5WAWDylo_-pXJOWBzXTEQ.text: My boyfriend and I have been here a couple of times and we loved it.  I continually ordered the shrimp po'boy and it was great.  There mac and cheese is definiately good!!  We enjoyed this place so much that we decided to bring some friends for dinner because they had never been to this resturant.  Our dinner was expensive and was not worth the money.  I do not mind spending money if the meal is worth it.  I ordered a rare filet with lobster.  The filet was extremely rare, it was as if they left it on the grill just to brown the outsides.  The inside was cold it was so rare.  The lobster was chewy and difficult to eat.  It was later at night so idk if they stopped putting effort in cooking and wanted to get out of work or what.  Our wait staff was very friendly though.  On a good note, there sourdough bread is very good.

5UANOpQ3oeGzgXlpC-AWXQ.text: Outstanding service at lunch time, and fresh seafood. Being from the East, it is hard to find fresh seafood in the desert, but that is found here. Oyster bar is highly recommended ,and the fried catfish is spot on. This place is NOT for people who dont like seafood, nor should it be. A seafood lover's haven.

lriN7SHq6VjYRgG9_ILtrg.text: My girlfriend and I were there on Sunday the 22, we were the only people sitting at the bar, got a dozen oyesters, a poboy some tacos.  The food was good, the oyesters were fresh and the bartender was awesome.  We did some Peppar vodka and oyester shots, had some nice cold brews and enjoyed the day.  I wanted to thank the bartender also for getting my girlfriend addicted to 3 Olives Dude vodka.  You were right about the sprite mixer hahaha

5mjeqiHgm-Xmp7zYWkDc0w.text: Very impressed with the attention they give to kids menu, ect.  The food is great - I have taken company there twice now and haven't been embarrassed at all by the choice.  Not too expensive but it's not cheap (ambiance, decor) or cheesy looking.  Very nice ( but not over the top) wine list and a good selection of beers and specialty cocktails.  Patio seating is very nice as well.

qHkEaj22XXDH2WAULfi68g.text: Sorry, after 4 days of horrid food poisoning I need to drop them to 1 star... or actually no stars.  I'm confident it was the improperly prepared Cobia that left me hunkered down in the bathroom for nearly a week.  I suggest they stick to fish that is easy to prepare and turns quickly... salmon, tuna, etc...

P1COv9P4TnBftZHsCzqSmA.text: Cassandra was our server today, 11/28, and she was amazing!!!  The food was great, service was even better.  Highly recommend this place.

9o826JWTJAlmEfFzJHcqUg.text: The fish and chips were pretty good- the fries weren't great, but the salad and the tuna melt looked and tasted fantastic. KK was our server and we all agree that he was one of the best servers we've ever had. Truly great at his job. The restaurant is clean and the service was awesome. Highly recommend.

ly3cFiKsgEFwRmROB8s5hg.text: We have been here numerous times and it never disappoints.  My son has severe food allergies( eggs, all tree nuts and peanuts, sesame seed and sunflower seed) and all the managers especially Michael Rossi ALWAYS goes above and beyond to ensure his safety.  Michael has always been outstanding, but our last visit he was top notch .  He interacted with my boys showing them the lobster tank and taking the time to explain the lobsters and even took one out for them to touch.  He truly is amazing!

xIz7Czm8gXxwEC_97YqQsg.text: Love the meals that truly #inspire me! #parmesancrustedAlaskanSandDads, mashed potatoes and fresh corn.... my palate is doing a happy dance. Thanks Michelle and @kingsfishhouse! #datewithhayes

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Parmesan Crusted Alaskan Sand Dads, flavorful, the mashed potatoes and corn are a must try side!

yBC0kta7tSonAeIcOHcezg.text: Dined here for the first time a couple of nights ago and can say that I was very impressed!   I like to come through places like this and tune into a sporting event over a drink and conversation with friends of mine, so the bar is generally our scene. We had an appetizer and a couple of drinks and I can honestly say that if you're thinking about swinging through here, you won't be disappointed. It's a great environment and Gilbert did a fantastic job, I never once felt like I wasn't being attended to in an exceptional manner. That being said, I can't speak for the rest of the restaurant, but I can say that in past experiences, a great bar means a great restaurant, as the bar is often times the busiest and hardest to manage. I attribute this solely to a great bartender with a good personality who has an understanding for his / her job, and isn't there merely for looks.   In the end, I'm sure the entrees are great, but all we had were some appetizers and a few drinks, of which I was very pleased with the quality of and beyond pleased with the quality of the staff. In my opinion, hire more people like the bartender Gilbert, as the staff can set the tone right from the start.   King's Fish House, "I'll be back" *Arnold voice*

1O29MHXh50WtiEdpWajzpw.text: I've been driving by this place for a long time every time I go into Tempe Marketplace and was always curious about this place. So today I decided at the last minute to give this place a try.   The place is very modern looking and my son commented that it was something like a boat house. I could somewhat see that with lots of wood and pictures of fish.   Anyways, they started us off with  sour dough bread and butter. I always love sour dough bread and it was very good. For appetizers we had fried calamari and a few cups of clam chowder. The calamari were huge pieces with a very flakey batter on it. Excellent. Really enjoyed it. The clam chowder was gobbled up by my wife without no complaints. I tried it and was pretty good.   For our main course, I had the Ono fish with rosemary potatoes and mac and cheese. Ono fish is somewhat like the swordfish which is a little dry so overall I thought my meal was good. Loved the Mac and cheese with the rosemary potatoes. My wife had the Mahi-Mahi with spinach and carrots. Her meal was really good. This fish was very tender and juicy. Cooked perfect. She enjoyed it. My son had the linguini with clams and he gobbled it up so he really enjoyed it. My mom ordered the full fried catfish and when they say full. They mean full. Head and tail included. Huge catfish which was bigger than the plate but she ate it all and thought it was really good.   So overall, we had a good meal. Service was good. Our server kept filling our water cups up all the time and the food came out in a timely manner. All I can say is huge portions, good food, good service and we will be back again. Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salmon
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mahi-mahi with spinach and carrots
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Ono with Rosemary Potatoes &amp; Mac and Cheese

OTZ9cWtxw8XlhHE6KYzEAQ.text: Aidan, our server, did a great job with our order. He made suggestions for the oysters that were delicious!  The cioppino is consistently yummy. The restaurant staff were extremely courteous. They all worked together to make our experience enjoyable.

YM16U5k9ZN5IrzCIj-K_XA.text: Very helpful staff!  At lunchtime it is pretty much all business meetings going on in there.  The staff was very willing to help people find their party should that need to be done.  Service at the table was good, and the food was great!  I'd definitely go back.

xyqpMPq2OifQ9ChqGCd_HQ.text: Expensive $$$$ but good quality and service. Would visit again for a special occasion

MDfxQyO9EBkjdognpkLuUw.text: I have eaten here many times and have always been more than satisfied. GREAT Swordfish, Great service and moderately priced. Always my go to fish restaurant in Arizona.

BIDrjCYbf-AZew0W_VCgPQ.text: My husband and I have driven by this restaurant so many times and never went in until last week. We wanted to give it a try since it is near a lot of our other favorite restaurants in Tempe Marketplace.  When we walked in on a Saturday night it was not too busy which surprised us a little. We did notice they have a private dining room. And that was not in use. I would say it was about 60% at occupancy.  The patios were totally empty but it is still 100 degrees or warmer still.  We were given a large booth that was way too big for just two of us so we asked for something smaller. We were approached fairly quickly. Our drink orders were taken and for me drinking water it was not easy to get refills as much as I wanted. That was the only bad thing about the meal.  We got lots of bread and butter. That was nice. I ordered the Fish and Chips and they good. Not great, not terrible. Nothing new and exciting. The fish was great underneath the breading. It was a bit mushy and next time I would order it crispy. My husband had the cajun dish which he liked and had lots of flavor.  The ambiance was nice. Service was goof. Some food things could have been better. If you like fish try this place.

o3cC27cF6G2WTJV336zypg.text: The food here was amazing!!! We had the Sashimi plate. All the fish were fresh and tasty. We also had ordered a dozen and a half order of the oysters. The oysters were very tasty. It did take us sometime to get the oysters though. Which in a very appologetic gesture they comped us the cost of our oysters. Which is great in itself, but the waitress, chef, and manager all came out and apologized. This is a place that has great food and stands by its standards of service.

NkBmrP96ESp8-GhymLGT-A.text: Took some customers to this restaurant for lunch.  Liked the decor and layout of the restaurant.  The staff were friendly and the waitress was attentive.  I had the red rockfish with house salad and sweet corn.  It was delicious and the fish was not over cooked or over seasoned.  Two of my lunch companions had the fish and chips that looked amazing.  Would recommend for any occasion.

QV_BptIY1VOts1DA3fDpBQ.text: Went for my husband's birthday! There were 14 of us and Casandra offered the best service!! They brought the kids food out first and made sure we had everything we needed. Restaurant has great food and is family friendly! Thanks for a great birthday dinner!

pIgMDvjGt_nNMx0MLtod7w.text: My favorite seafood restaurant.  Always fresh and perfectly cooked. Our server, Nikki, was amazing. Never had a bad experience here.

sKYJvbRAkwt3tVN4J5ZG5w.text: Love seafood, Kings is delicious with lots to choose from.  Went here for dinner just before a show we were going to attend.  My regular fish fry was delicious, batter crunchy and crispy.  Like they say "I can't believe I ate the WHOLE thing!".  I have been here a few times and my only caveat is it still is no match for a Buffalo NY fish fry with haddock.  Can't get that here.  But whenever I want/need seafood this is the place to go.

jXbxKU88WWMnpSaRDp4O6w.text: I was visiting from out of town and this restaurant was near my hotel. I wasn't very hungry so I only had appetizers and champagne. My server Gilbert was very helpful in directing me to the best menu selections for me. I had the blackened shrimp taquitos and seafood chowder. Both were very tasty and something I haven't had before. Gilbert made the experience even better as he was very attentive, friendly, and personable! He even directed me to some good shopping places and other AZ nightlife. Definitely visit Gilbert on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday nights! I will definitely visit again when I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States

rYNh17iap9LoJTZLqEda6Q.text: Came here for the first time and firstly were amazed at the choices of different seafood.  Our waitress Nikki was very helpful in her recommendations and I actually decided to order the swordfish per her suggestion.  It was amazing!!! The last time I had swordfish was over 10 years ago and it was horrible so this time was definitely putting myself out there and I was so surprised and amazed.  Delicious!! Wonderful service experience and food experience.  We will be back!

bR5_cY2R66Fy3Hi2LXTN8w.text: We came here for my birthday. Sat on the beautiful patio. Gilbert was our server and he was AMAZING! I seriously wanted to take him home. So nice. So informative of  he menu. We had the best time and will come back again soon and ask for Gilbert. You know when you meet a good person. This place is lucky to have him. Thank you Gilbert for a great birthday dinner for myself and my family!!!

90Bs4OXJpXHrYsWJQFHIkw.text: The food was excellent!!! Gilbert behind the bar was the best server we have ever had from any restaurant. He is fun, gave us excellent service and is all around a great person. I was not feeling good when we went out. I ended up having the best night because of Gilbert. Props and 5 stars to him. My husband and I had a fantastic night thanks to Gilbert. To top it off our halibut was amazing!!  We also had help by Kaylin. She was amazing and gave us first class service. We will be back for sure!!  Both will make you night amazing!! Along with the best food ever!!

Y1k8BGCFESfDp-shIk4EWg.text: I came here for lunch with my girlfriends on a weekday. Our food took 45 minutes to come out which seems a little long, especially when you're there for your short work lunch break. I think our waitress was new as she just seemed confused and took forever to get us our checks. Nonetheless, the food was decent but not amazing - maybe mediocre? It's not any kind of stand out of a restaurant in which I'd look forward to it or return to it. Just...blah.

Ss0T5XqYoD1ffm-_SZef7Q.text: Really!  Overpriced! My fish (halibut)dry and overcooked. Hubby's swordfish he said "very good"  Terrible rosemary potatoes dry and floury...nasty carrots. Grilled zucchini ok. Less than impressed with a meal that was $100 plus. Service ok, but we were not asked if everything was good. Won't be back! SAD

2xjHhT8nwLQlhMYGu0McsQ.text: I dined here tonight and left very happy. The Dungeness crab was amazing and Kim was very friendly! Great food and great service!  I'll be back!

aRXIZnZ735aVsWWVRkhv9w.text: I'm new in town and just found this place!  Love it!  Perfect spot for happy hour, lunch, drinks or dinner.  I sat at the bar.  Great experience.  TV, good music, great food & drinks, but mostly, phenominally wonderful service from Gilbert my barkeep!  I can love everything about a place, but if service isn't good, I won't return.  Thanks to Gilbert, I will definitely be back here!  Thank you!

WWQXCihu-nDU9qR8bBPMfA.text: Wish it was closer!    Fresh, varied menu.  Never boring for variety if you love seafood.  Have never tried "non seafood" here, but companions have given decent reviews.  Prices reasonable given the distance this fresh fish comes from.  Better than expected.

srhshLXrQpJyugp7kjtPVw.text: A great find in the Phoenix area.  Fish House in N. Arizona means frozen battered fried fish.  It was with trepidation that I asked to see the menu.  When I saw the selection of fresh oysters at the top of the menu, I smiled big and asked where was the oyster bar.  Needless to say my selection of a dozen oysters were fresh and tasty.  I have been back since with the same results.

VwEo1yZC5phJam1K0gjGQQ.text: My husband, parents and I went to Kings Fish House at the beginning of March for my husbands birthday.  He is from Oregon, and a little bit of a seafood snob.  He really wanted seafood for his birthday meal.  We checked out places on Yelp but couldn't find any place that had great reviews and was in our price range.  We decided to take a chance on King's Fish House, and to be honest we were a little skeptical of a chain restaurant.   Not to mention my husband and his family goes clamming off of the Oregon coast several times a year, so he has high expectations for fresh clams. We were absolutely blown away by everything about this restaurant.   Our server for the night was Chris G, and he gave us some amazing recommendations.  He really listened to what flavors each of like individually and made individualized his recommendations for each of us.  Even pairing it with some wine and side dish recommendations.  Not to mention his recommendations for clams were spot on!!  Each of us had a different dish, and each of us swore we had the best dish at the restaurant.    In April we celebrated my fathers birthday, and he requested we go back to King's Fish House.  As soon as we walked in, we saw Chris. We requested him to be our server again.  Not only did he remember us, but he remembered what we had ordered a month earlier.  AMAZING!!  He gave us some new recommendations, and again his service was incredible!!  My personal recommendation... go to the Kings Fish House and sit in Chris' section.  Get some of the Skookum clams if they are in, and definitely try the Macadamia Nut Crusted Halibut.  Delicious!!  We will be back again very soon!!

gRlCwULxKmP5y-nvDLsNvQ.text: Terrible two years in a row. Never going back to this location. Served uncleaned squid and tried to say that's how fresh calamari from CA is served.  Seriously?   We are Californians and eat fresh calamari all year long including just a couple of weeks ago at King's in Anaheim.  This comes down to over frying in a thick horrid batter to disguise the fact the chef did NOT properly clean the squid. It's not ticket science. Thanks to last night, it will be sometime before I can eat calamari again and I was sick to my stomach all night. Upside is they comped our wine and gave us a gift card.  Won't be using it at this location of King's Fish House.

qh9eTbmRAm8k340HCXz8ug.text: Anytime I'm in Tempe Marketplace, I make it a point to stop in here. Fantastic beer selection and great food!The main reason I keep coming back though is the impeccable service. The bartender Shane is amazing at his craft and always remembers us and our drink choices. I highly recommend trying out King's if you haven't already!!

7YcwWli_xeQbDo9Mo75Jzw.text: We decided to try this out after seeing other Yelp reviews. When we entered, the place was basically empty. (Probably a warning sign) After being seated, our waiter was prompt and super friendly. He answered lots of questions and gave recommendations since we are from out of town. So we thought this was going to be a fabulous experience! However, after apx 10 minutes of his help, he left to help another table. When he came back, he basically lost his friendly attitude. We had to ask for drink refills (Always a huge no-no in our book!!!) He seemed preoccupied the rest of the night (but the place was basically empty). The food was pretty good. Kids ordered sushi, I had the trout almandine, and my husband had the blackened rainbow trout. No complaints there. But the prices were steep for the meals.

Xdt2jEl1E2p2IlTH_urarA.text: Came into King's with nothing good to expect considering I am not a big fan of seafood. My family convinced me anyway. When we got there I asked my server if there would be anything I would like at all. She recommended the chicken and steak, and also mentioned the burger and sandwiches. I got the chicken with mashed potatoes and zucchini and really enjoyed it. My parents got the crab legs and salmon and they loved it as well. Denise was overall really helpful and gave us great service, so much so that I would definitely come back again!

EzAlMB3c68eDKiBRlxVdYA.text: Man... It took me forever to actually decide on how many stars to give King's Fish House. I finally decided that this place is the best of a bad situation. AZ has zero good seafood, zero! Outside of the Salt Cellar, but I never even think to go to that place. For God's sake the entire thing is a basement with what looks to be an outhouse on top of it. Land Ho.   Anyhow, this, IMO, is some of the most decent fish you can find in the valley. It's incredibly overpriced, and unless you're sitting at the bar, the service just isn't great. If you are lucky enough to time your visit right around when the sourdough loaves come screaming out of the ovens, you're in luck. Fresh bread here is amazing... But wait fifteen minutes, and you are screwed. Stale bread city. The entrees are overpriced and over portioned, but what can you do. Be careful about ordering anything with sauce - your poor little dinner will be drowning in it. That was not an ocean joke. I am being very serious. Ease up on the sauce, King.   NOW!!! The good part. We thoroughly enjoy coming here on Sunday mornings during football season and sitting in the empty bar enjoying oysters on the half shell and beers. This place has a honey beer that is out of this world! You can't get it anywhere else, and that alone is worth the three stars.   So let's recap - bar, oysters, beer = good!! Dining room, stale bread, drowning entrees = meh!!

Uyhe4ZtzYsmBALhU2yidbg.text: Let's say you're driving down the road with an extra twenty bucks you don't know what to do with.  You're hungry, it's lunchtime, and you come here.   King's Fish House  Where you can get an entire glob of tuna fish smeared between two slices of whole wheat bread. An artful creation resembling something your eight year-old niece would throw together, this along with a fistful of french fries and some bitter-as-gall deli slaw, and all for surrendering that dirty twenty! Actually it's 10.95 but with the diet coke and the tip, you're now up around twenty.   Other delights our party sampled were from the "Fried" section.  The menu description only reading Farm Raised Mexican Shrimp. It didn't say how these little Mexican Shrimp numbered only four.  Or how they must've been raised in one of the Kennedy's swimming holes in the Hampton's where they were fed fois gras and cavear, sipped champagne from gold-rimmed flutes, and had their own nanny, wistfully lulling them to sleep each night with old Raffi tunes.  Because at 13.95 for four of these little bastards, they must've led one pampered life on that farm!  Three of us. Two tuna fish sandwiches. And one small school of Mexican Shrimp, a water, a diet coke and an iced tea....48.95, with ten bucks for the tip, almost sixty bucks.  Unless you're dining on the company expense account, or someone else is picking up the tab, theres no reason on earth to pay twenty bucks for a tuna fish sandwich and a diet coke.  Or for that matter,  watch your friend eat  four of the Kennedy's prized pets.

dNeE1RsrndnksMrMTYlNLQ.text: We came here a few months ago and I left a review about Kelsi because she was so great. We recently went back to King's and I requested to be sat in Kelsi's section. Obviously, she was amazing as usual. Love her! We'll be back.

s-Aj74XuZ2VQybPkT4qNgg.text: I had dinner and drinks there tonight with friends. I had the ahi tuna which was very good and everyone seemed to enjoy their meals as well. The cosmopolitans were fabulous. The only downside was that they had the bar window wide open and it was freezing in the restaurant tonight.  $100 for the 3 off us.

IGg8_vaofv_EAzdTQQ3xWg.text: Had the Mahi Mahi with spinach and carrots.  Their southwest salad is incredible. Corn, tortilla chips, beans with a chipotle based dressing was a meal by itself.

FTHr-e8xzBjN8DfusMYfiA.text: Our server was Jeremy. He was just terrific! He made sure our meal flowed in a way that everything was the right temperature and was so enjoyable because of it. Great food with amazing service.. You have to try it!!!

looiyMLMJ0Z75cUcXPYYcg.text: Denise is awesome and was very attentive to our party. She was very friendly and knows the menu well to make suggestions. Being from California and going to King's Fish House out here it was nice to know that the Tempe AZ staff, Denise in particular, was just as friendly!! Thank you Denise! Next time I'm in AZ I hope she's there working because I'd definitely go back!!

N4d184Yu8LQwoFa2Hao56Q.text: I was there 2 days ago for 630 dinner on a Friday. Tempe Market very busy because of Xmas shopping. I had a crab Louie salad and a local beer on tap. Others ordered the Ono and crab cakes and rock fish. Dishes were nicely made. Fish tasted fresh. Could actually carry on a conversation, which I always greatly value.

1ecVp9uEkgFs8QfOYeKYgQ.text: WOW... being from New England area "Mass-hole" , i usually am pretty lenient to places since we are "land locked"..  Sourdough bread to start.. hard exterior, did not taste anything close to fresh,, anyways,, looking over the menu, and was a little shocked.. prices higher than "pappadeaux" n thinking the food quality better match..  Appetizer PEI mussels - decent flavor , but 1/3 look over dehydrated, almost as if they were dead way before cooking time. or recooked or something,, those we un-edible.  Wife got the clam chowder which was actually really good..  hence 2 stars  I thought, 22 bucks for some scallops,, hmm, let me try that out.. huge plate came out with these little marble sized scallops, 12 of them.. thats almost 2 dollars a piece for each lil scallop, Side zuchini was ok, but the cole slaw definitely not great,, some bites had that sour weird rubberband taste,,  Waitress, awesome, always smiling, refilling our drinks,,   Finished with a $60 bill,, not even close to satisfied and never going back..  If you want seafood on the east valley, go ahead n hit up red lobster, if you want some great seafood, hit up n. phoenix to pappadeaux(worth the drive and time, will never be dissatisfied)  Lesson Learned. :-(

fpvvkl9kfo91oy307xOpxQ.text: I was meeting two of my employees to have a lunch meeting, and this place was recommended by a colleague.  Anyways as soon as I walk in I got ignore, I have to ask if I needed to seat my self then she said "oh you are waiting" (with bad attitude) I almost say no I just here for decoration, duh of course I was waiting. So she took my name down, less than one minute after few people walk in and she greet them with a smile and ask of two or more, so they got a table.  We got our table, thing change here our server was nice, attentive and give us recommendations.  The 3 starts is for the first people when you walk in, customer service needs to improve or I do I need to change the color on my skin.  God we are in 2014!!  Our server was nice, food was good.

g2vhXaCSYkK2P9K0szOXrw.text: I was rather disappointed with the prices and services given the reviews. The food was good but nothing to write home about. The fish was dry and our Mac n cheese was cold.  When we ordered our final rounds, the wait time was excessive. To compensate, they offered a free desert. We were informed after the fact about price changes for our cocktails which were outrageous. We had double shot beverages and were informed after our bills came that we would be charged for separate shots which cost more than the drink itself. Considering you couldn't taste the liquor this was rather upsetting. The manager put blame on the waitress for not telling us ahead of time. Poor thing didn't see that bus coming.

vJluK4L-O9Ss9y6JOc7qAA.text: Cassie was awesome! She has a great personality and we enjoyed having her serve us. On top of great service the food was just as awesome as usual!!

dB2qExuSCNNxxGyCVP7x4A.text: Large group - been here since about 7. Food finally coming out after 9:00. Amazingly, there was only 1 server for about 25 people. Maybe it will get better now that they've closed!  Let's see if any of the staff stick around for this group.  From what I've seen, I doubt it. I won't be back.

AFZMcwId-Bp3gV8wfYG01Q.text: I went on a local seafood restaurant kick over the holidays, including serving King Crab for Christmas Dinner. Check out all my current reviews.   Everyone knows it's thin picking when it comes to "fresh seafood" in Phoenix, but Kings Fish House at Tempe Marketplace is the standout IMO. Kings is actually a wholesale fish distributer out of Santa Ana, CA. This allows their Fish House's to have one of the largest seafood selections in Southern Cal.   Been coming to the Tempe location since it opened, a solid 4 star seafood "eating" experience. Their selections are extensive, I suggest you check out the online menu to prepare yourself before you visit. While the decor is modern and clean, to be honest, its just a tad boring for me. The oyster bar should be just jumping ... but they have a totally clueless happy hour, the place just lacks excitement!  The quality of the seafood and large selection of fresh oysters at Kings Fish House puts Pappadeaux to shame, but the low energy keeps Kings from being more popular IMO. Rarely is the bar or restaurant over half full, I guess that good or bad depending on your viewpoint or philosophy.  A much more creative happy hour experience and late night "live local Jazz" would really put this place on the map ... yet still fit their theme.   The potential of Kings Fish House is off the chart ... if only they could light a fire under the local management.

wwDQbZ9gKPCKTjbulugxDQ.text: If your looking for fresh Carb cakes this is the place. They are so good ! I would also say look at eating desert and enjoying every bite. Service with a smile is always a plus

la-0EozDFZVKi09jTPc6mw.text: King's Fish House provided a nice fish option in Tempe.  I used to go to Rockfish in Chandler, but I believe that closed.  I am not that big of a fan of fish, but my cardiologist is, so here I am looking for fish.  I liked the atmosphere of the place - dead fish on the wall, jazz lightly in the background and napkins with fish caricature napkins. The menu was very big and apparently printed every day as it had the date printed on the menu.  That might be a little costly from an operations standpoint, but it was a cool touch.   I started with a bowl of New England Clam Chowder ($3.95) and my friend the lobster bisque cup ($5.45). The lobster was a little high for a cup, but both soups were excellent. My friend ordered an Arnold Palmer ($3.95) to drink and it was commented to me that it wasn't very good in comparison to other places. I had the diet coke ($2.95).  I ordered the wild salmon for $12.75 and my friend had the rockfish for $11.95. Both of us chose the sauteed spinach. I had the rosemary potatoes and my friend the garlic mashed potatoes. The food was fine - it was fish and there's only so much you can do with a piece of grilled fish.  I did order dessert - the fruit crisp ($6.95). I was a little disappointed that the option of the day was peach. Peaches , oatmeal and vanilla ice cream...surprisingly it was excellent! Really the best part of the meal. I would have liked to see the peaches maybe cut because it was challenging to dig in and reel in a big peach.   The service was excellent. My server Katie was cool, very nice and prompt.  It was a good meal if you want fish - but  maybe $ 51 for lunch is a bit too high.

Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. salmon, spinach &amp; rosemary potatoes
Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cup of New England clam chowder

-V-mtN6ujrYwvQrZIXwiGw.text: Wasn't very impressed with the food. Service mediocre. My sister had the tuna very bland they didn't give me the right side dish. For the price I think we will find a different place for fish.

8tSp3aeO0KjgSKs5JPV73Q.text: I just had dinner and here tonight and I have to say it was quite unexpected! The food was delicious and our server Kim was just awesome! I had the wild salmon with zucchini and wild grains, sooo yummy! Kim suggested the butter cake and I don't know if I'll be returning strictly for the butter cake or  to have Kim as a server again!

Q0kxGEqyVYzqGz_DLi6AnA.text: We had not been to the Fish House in a while, preferring other "Steak & Seafood" restaurants (or, dare I say, Red Lobster) instead. But we went back on a whim and were absolutely delighted. There were great changes in the menu. We had trouble deciding, everything looked so good. We finally settled on the Parmesan-crusted sand dabs, which you don't find on many menus. They were great! And our server Claire was amazing. We will definitely be back.

flJt-QDTHTiUkiXKhL69UQ.text: Sourdough bread is awesome. Entree delivered before the salad was halfway finished. Waiter calls me "bud"... I am almost 50 "dude" "Dude" removes our unfinished plates without asking, the place was empty, I have a feeling why now. I wanted those fries dang it.    Old "Betty" sitting next to us warns us to avoid the sea bass but give a thumbs on the zucchini   Bud won't be back

iRoEDtkZ0HlcCgVYF-ZbuQ.text: Mediocre.  This is the 2nd time I've been here this year, and mediocre at best.  Grilled fresh (not farmed) salmon at $30+ and a boiled lobster.  Both were overcooked.  I'm used to salmon having a hot, crisp, seared type of exterior.  This was not that.  No exterior crust, and overcooked almost to the point of being dry.  The lobster was rubbery and tough.  $100+ for two people for a less-than mediocre meal.  I won't be back.

vcPQqct7RdBJi0Gv2_gxcA.text: Food was great and the service was awesome! The buttercake was delicious! Thank you Shannon S. for your service.

ZZW2fP8Kj8bDGq5hUeNbcA.text: Had the shrimp and scallops encrusted in macadamia nuts. Delicious!!! Northwest veggies were carrots and snow peas were nice and crunchy. Our waiter Shannon was very knowledgeable and helpful.

F9Es10g8iKlXrcnR5pyisQ.text: My dad was in town and he is an east coaster so he is very obsessed and picky about his seafood. Our server, Cassie, was amazing and answered my dads million and one questions. Our food was delicious and my dad didn't have one complaint (which is rare)

d-gMq0TG_svYhxARADeVog.text: Dined here on Wednesday (1/22/2014) with my daughter for dinner.  Service was very good but our waiter was not up to speed on their menu or seafood.  Daughter had the sea bass that was not fresh but should have been for the price. My sea scallops were not sea scallops but appeared to be small bay scallops and were definitely frozen and chewy.  Will write this place off the list as a good place to eat.

EQAZqEKbMS1kSv3xSrKkOg.text: We have dined at King's Fish House in Southern California, have had  good experiences there, so, thought we would try it in Tempe with some friends.  Boy we were disappointed with the entire dining experience! ...  with the exception of the sourdough bread. The Server that asked for our drinks was dull, & when asked how late they were open, was happy her shift would be over soon  --  the Server who brought our food - seemed bothered that she had to wait on her customers, no smiles anywhere & when we asked questions about the menu the answers were short & curt. The wild shrimp was not fresh,  sauteed spinach too much garlic.  When asked our friends how their meals were one said he enjoyed the trout almondine, others were so, so - disappointed the scallops were small - which our Server told us was because they were not in season.  We had to flag a server down to ask for something  - seems all held their heads up in the sky instead of looking around for their customers inquiries or needs.  When we inquired about  the salted caramel ice cream for dessert, we were informed that it is only available in the summer and had to coax our Server to tell us what else was available, again she seemed very bothered. We will not be back - not any of us, will visit this place only on our trips to Southern California. Perhaps they should have the Employees in Calif. train the Servers & Chefs in Tempe.

mQM6Hi7DL6CY67VGf3WFYw.text: Another great experience at King's Fish House!! Consistently great service, the highest quality seafood and the prices are reasonable!! You get what you pay for!!!   We had the pleasure of meeting Michelle, the manager, and she was genuinely concerned about our opinion of how things were going.  If you are thinking about going to KFH, stop thinking and just do it. Hands down the best in the valley!!   Thanks guys for helping us have a nice Sunday lunch!!   We'll be back!!

PFChqvfxCgNiL41QZQRqVw.text: I've tried several times to eat oysters and it has ended poorly each time. My dad is a huge fan and he prefers to fry them. Still, I'd heard that some people eat them raw and have wanted to try them that way for a while. It was an adventure for both of us, but my dad and I shared an order of raw oysters. That is some of the best food the sea has to offer.  In addition to the oysters of which we ordered another plate, I also tried the clam chowder and loved that as well. This place is pretty pricey, but good seafood in Arizona is hard to come by. I will return for another plate of raw oysters as soon as I can.

U9dxaHV_sfW5CqbGNV12bA.text: Freshest fish around and friendly staff too.  I worked for these guys many moons ago and can tell you they defintely go out of their way to serve the freshest seafood you'll find.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States

8E5lthiafL2AqlaKPllMdA.text: Just plain awful. We heard this from several people, but how badly can one mess up a Louie salad and some basic grilled scallops. Plenty, as it turns out. Chewy tiny expensive sparse overcooked scallops, and a Louie salad that bore no resemblance to the Louie salads of reputable seafood restaurants, Tempe Marketplace Fish House chefs managed singlehandedly to destroy the reputation of all other Kings Fish Houses. This one is worthy of being closed immediately. Disaster.

XGKKAwk7XUoUlYQRDlDQcQ.text: Came in for lunch - ordered the scallop & shrimp combo with asparagus and salad. Everything was cooked to perfection. The prices were basically what I expected, especially here in Arizona. Great service and pretty quick to receive food, which is appreciated during a lunch hour. Will definitely come back

YhRRimybtp7eAvhbNPUraQ.text: I ate here with my daughter and a couple friends this past week. I'm a pescatarian, so I eat a lot of seafood, but typically avoid big chains, so my expectations weren't super high. I was actually pleasantly surprised by the food quality. Our table ordered an oyster sampler and I got the BBQ shrimp. Gilbert was our server, and though the food was tasty, he was the highlight of our visit. He was fast, entertaining, and made great drink recommendations! Probably one of the top 5 servers I've had in the Phoenix area. I'm not sure I'd be back as a regular, but I was more impressed with Kings than I originally anticipated

h-kNqU6yBoTLrZdqJj-_hA.text: Rudy was an amazing bartender! He was not only knowledgeable about the drink list, but also the food menu... which is rare in bartenders! He recommended amazing food and drinks and was so personable that we even stayed for dessert. Will be back just for Rudy!

b030I9J2-1jG6J9695UY_Q.text: Really just lackluster. The service was friendly, but the food left much to be desired. Very pricey for what it is. Everything seemed very dry. Edible, but not memorable in the least. I can't imagine why anyone would eat here twice. We won't be back.

fK1ZuFyv_km0LnrgCKiEyw.text: My girlfriend brought me here to satisfy a seafood craving. It has a good atmosphere, and a decor that reminds me of a dignified New England bah (bar).  The server Aiden was awesome. The kitchen made a small goof in timing and he offered us options to maximize the pace of our dinner experience. That was a subtle thing made a huge difference. I'll eat here again just to sit at his table.  The food wasn't miraculous, but I'm certain I'll have a hard time finding better shrimp or scallops.

K33OBXx75WREY_KrBmU4Rw.text: This place is awesome. I wish they had rice as one of the sides but other then that this place is so good. All the fish is amazing and good customer service

TZI0wjfOBd3RRWoRA2HF0A.text: Love the Kings fish house.  If you go pls do yourself a favor ask for kaylin. She is a fabulous server.  So the plus you have kaylin AND fabulous food

zr-GgwzNGR8O1oi31I9LUA.text: Great food. Convenient location. Our server Sarah was amazing!   I will definitely be coming back again.

BJUCO4x3oXzRVSxc9IV2eg.text: We visited this location for my birthday lunch yesterday. We got to meet michelle the manager. We honestly could not have asked for better service and more delicious food. My daughter surprised so we enjoyed a lunch for 4. We had fish and chips, crab cakes, a tuna melt and crispy Brussel sprouts. For dessert we had creme brulee. First of all we are san diegans and know our seafood. The fish and chips were PERFECTLY battered and HUGE. I hate getting all batter and almost no fish or some gross, mealy fish. This was a huge, perfectly crispy fillet, it was accompanied by garlic fries and cole slaw. My daughter had the crab cakes, super good and firm, good crab to breading ratio. Her boyfriend had the tuna melt and ate every crumb. He said it was the best he's had. And I am a brussel sprout addict. These were delicious. My picts say it all. The creme brulee was perfect. It didn't taste like butane like many of them do. They also use real vanilla. These guys know what they are doing and I can't wait to go back!

ahgXHaFvIkUTRGUskiodbg.text: Nikki was AWESOME!!  Had a blast!  The food was good but the service took it the rest of the way to GREAT!!!  Will be back.

epVPNcwBx5_jqWvcFWEPFg.text: I had the pleasure of eating here while I was in town visiting family. The food was great! I had the traditional lobster roll with fries, which was delicious and one of the best I've ever had. I sat at the bar and the bar tender Amanda was so friendly it was like visiting an old friend.
