3GgL6bDoViUGi_L2yFIqPQ.text: This was my first trip back to Phoenix in too many years and most of the places that I had liked when I was going to Phoenix more regularly had disappeared. My brother who now lives in Phoenix suggested that we try Kings saying that it used to be my fad's favorite when he lived here. Wow... we got to the restaurant a little early and found a lovely table outside on the patio. Rudy was exceptionally attentive...guiding us through the menu and making little recommendations here in there. There was nothing that we ordered that wasn't extraordinary. Our personal favorite was the shrimp. The N'awlins Barbecue Shrimp was to die for and the servings were very generous. My only regret is that I had no room for dessert. I guess that means I have to hurry back soon!!

mHx2ByO8FP5UPhxtdl5zsA.text: My son treated me to dinner and I really enjoyed it! Really good food, Nice ambience, a little pricey but excellent service. I will definitely go back.

QFG5qUbbfCqOtPD3rbTLGQ.text: First off, I must say there seafood dishes are amazingly fresh tasting and I love their friendly staff here. I come here frequently and it's always been a fun experience. They check in on ya and make sure you're taken care of. My favorite is Kaylin.

tmwi8r-XvsVED-lC3rtfDA.text: First time at kings Fish House took my 25-year-old daughter there for her birthday Richard the server was fantastic a little disappointed there was no creme brulee or butter cake available. Ordered halibut it was a little bit dry but good everyone enjoyed their meal and Richard was great!

bebSf7ctRm-MpMHk92Sfmw.text: This place reminds me of the old seafood restaurants I use to eat at back door east. Menu is extensive and they indicate if the fish is wild caught or farm raised. They do have a few things for the meat lovers. I had the grilled shrimp and scallops which came with two sides. Everything was perfectly cooked. Service was excellent. Attentive without being annoying. Definitely will return.

LXHU7lZgx4C4wbEYh24lMA.text: Good seafood for a reasonable price.  Atmosphere feels a bit like your average chain restaurant.  Pretty noisy and hard to hold a conversation.

8RZ2e-ZiSz6I2lJLVAH1XA.text: This place is a disgrace. I ordered a dozen of oysters and it was a joke. I came here with my girlfriend and didn't like the size of the oysters. The size of the oysters was as small as my pinky. Never write reviews on Yelp but this one is a must.

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Small oysters thank you :(

uasn98Iwe49p_RRxP50Cww.text: There's always a place where we go on vacation that we feel like a friend is behind the bar(insert Billy Joel's "The Piano Man")! Gilbert is amazing and has a way of making you feel like the fanciest person at the bar.  This place is a gem and so is he! He really made our visit fun and gave us insight into the city we were staying. Give this gem a go, it will not disappoint.

s1FXyN0V2a6fQZuEM4kSVg.text: I had the macadamias crusted halibut and it was delish!  Expect to pay for what u get!!!! But well worth it in my book!

wMh2BbJ4fEz2A9uBdnIqFg.text: We wanted fish, so we drove over. One of us had perfectly fried fish scallops and shrimp. I had grilled yellowtail with zucchini spinach and and additional side of crispy Brussel Sprouts   Everything was great and Lorenzo was very attentive as personable. Pricy, but worth it!

pP-BHfR-j0bd3YyDCVnxYg.text: Cassandra the manager went above and beyond to help me to make my mom and dad's anniversary there so special.  Unfortunately I was in California and couldn't join them, but I can't wait to come visit and personally thank Cassandra for the amazing and exceptional guest service she provided to me and my parents special dinner.   Thank you!

MHHYjcNbHeuck-TvOog2rg.text: We came in to celebrate my moms birthday & Lorenzo was wonderful & made special!  That man deserves a raise!!!

o7y517yG1-FpRULoZrJ2_g.text: They have spiny lobsters!! If you haven't had one before get it! Our bartender Cassandra recommended it, while we were a skeptical of a lobster in the middle of the dessert she assured us they keep them fresh in the tank and are steamed right before you get them! Who knew! In the middle of Arizona! If you're in town, do yourself a favor and stop by King's!!

OFUJB1cG3Mi-WNQFfLzQYg.text: Just had lunch and Laine was our server. Clearly one if the best servers we have ever had. Got all orders  perfect and couldn't have been nicer. Great asset to your restaurant!

_wUdqhVsxapa90gQuyaBeQ.text: I had the Alaskan King Crab for the second time here. I usually don't get crab legs at restaurants because they are so much work but King's cracks the shells for you making it is so much easier and faster to eat  Our server was Kelsi. She was very attentive and sweet; she was constantly on top of everything!

jMpTl4dRNt6qW9vddX8ZqA.text: Robotic staff. Rude General Manager. Over priced and pretentious. Obviously corporation driven. Many choices within sight distance. Walk away from this one!

IjvE3HEXLHauBxOQag2A8g.text: I'm going to come out and say I rarely give a chain restaurant five stars. You know why? Because I am slightly pretentious and believe high quality food and creativity is lost the more commercial you get. Ok, so now that I am have gotten off my high horse here is the deal.   Apps. We ordered the cocktail shrimp half pound. They had been flown in that day and we're fresh as fresh can be and they were fantastic. They are presented on a bucket of ice which is just freaking awesome. We asked for extra horseradish and guess what came.... Actual freaking root. The good stuff. The shake your moneymaker real deal holyfield root.   I ordered the Nawlins Shrimp. My server described it as sweet and spicey. Rarely do I pick up both sides but seriously. This time was a hit. The Nawlins BBQ shrimp was fantastic. Sweet and spicey and full of flavor. Very similar to a gumbo.   For desert we had the buttercake. Seriously, it, was, awesome. Sweet and salty. This is an awesome place that although has a chain feel, brings the heat, and the sweet.

gajgU5VZzv62zh91NRr8MQ.text: I have been eating here for 6 years the service has gone horribly bad. the scallops were firm like beef jerky and overcooked I ordered a 1/2 dozen oysters that were warm they rinsed them under tap water in front of me I told the supervisor and she didn't even attempt to comp anything I will never eat here again nor will anyone that I know. it was horrible.as a business manager for 20 years I would not be surprised if they are still here a year from now

Ya8ZFrsGi4l-KMzc0Hx49Q.text: It was ok....we sent back some food. However the service is great. And drinks were good but the food was just ok.  It wasn't really worth The quality of food that you paid for.  on a good note one of the managers out reach to me and offered me a gift certificate. But I just wasn't too intrigued to come back again.

FfoFK3C-z1eUOGImeYVWwA.text: I hate to give a business one star, but unfortunately this is deserved. We stopped in for dinner on a Thursday evening after doing some shopping in Tempe marketplace and were excited to try it out since we love seafood. The one star is for the super friendly hostess who greeted and nicely chatted with us on our way to our table. We ordered a half dozen oysters as an appetizer and then shared a salmon dinner plate. The oysters were not properly shucked so I ended up with small pieces of shell in my mouth which quickly made us decide not to finish the half dozen. When the salmon dish came the fish was completely raw inside. After waiting for our waitress to come back to check on us (which she never did), we finally flagged down another employee to ask if they could cook the salmon more. This employee quickly told us that they were instructed to always cook salmon to medium rare (ours was not even rare) and that this happened a lot. After getting our re-heated salmon dish back, we took a few bites to find it was still pretty raw inside so we just finished our side dishes and went on our way. Sad to say- both my husband and I were up most of the night with food poisoning. I would not recommend this restaurant.

hcwR_ZJGKe1kPZnHDDINQw.text: It is definitely time to update my review.  The hubs and I decided to give Kings Fish House another try after having a mediocre previous experience and I'm so glad we did! Not only was this visit better than the last, but it exceeded our expectations.  It started off with Timber, our server, who was exceptional.  She was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and was willing to explain anything we needed to know, always with a smile on her face.  When she asked if we would like a salad before our meal, she could see us contemplating and suggested that we share a salad...perfect! She also brought it out on two separate plates so that we didn't have to do it ourselves.  Timber kept our glasses filled during the entire meal and was attentive but not overbearing.  She was great!  The manager, Patrick, also visited our table to make sure that we were enjoying ourselves and had everything we needed.  The staff at this location was excellent and it is obvious that they care about their guests.  On to the food...we started off with the sourdough bread.  It came out warm and was fresh and delicious.  We then split a caesar salad.  Again, fresh and yummy.  Then, the entrees came.  We both ordered the blackened salmon.  I opted for grilled zucchini and glazed carrots for my sides while the hubs asked for the buttered corn.  OMG...we love to smoke our salmon at home but we both agreed that this was by far the best salmon we've ever had at a restaurant.  It was that good! In addition, the sides were just as enjoyable.  Super flavorful and cooked just right.    I'm so glad we didn't give up on Kings Fish House.  This visit was amazing and we will definitely be returning for some more of that salmon!

photos.caption: Photo of King's Fish House - Tempe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Blackened salmon with grilled zucchini and glazed carrots...so so good!!

kiiq0PU3qyDTtNZjoosZDw.text: Being the traveling man that I am, I have come to recognize superior service when I experience it. I was lucky enough to have Aidan today as my waiter, and he certainly exemplifies this kind of outstanding attentiveness. Kudos!

JGT-GKEBhuH31hk6sWQOwQ.text: You should order the steamed king crab!! Very delicious!! Especially with the special butter, it tastes juicy, sweet and special.

vLyWP4w7wnMdEdTwrNUb9w.text: The food was great but the clam chowder and butter cake were spectacular. The menu had a lot of different options although the layout was a tad difficult to follow. The only hiccup in our experience was the underwhelming level of service provided by our server but the restaurant manager personally took care of the situation , without us bringing it to her attention which made the overall experience outstanding. I wish I could have given it 5 stars but the lack of attention by our original server prevented it. Overall a great place though.

VNeTd0jGTs1AQorLsmfFUw.text: Excellent food and excellent service! Our server, Rich went above and beyond. He was great with my dad, on his birthday, who is older and hard of hearing. Thanks for another great meal King's Fish House!

cPoSvnf3TyFp69zORzrIig.text: First time in and wow it was worth the trip! Great halibut crusted with a butter sauce yummy asparagus and to die for mac and cheese. They also have a great drink menu, got a spicy margarita that was awesome! Will be back for sure when I'm in the area.

RHfcOjQdKE0tBSAyZqjgsg.text: Great food we come here every time my parents are in town as it's they're favourite. Good healthy options too as I'm doing Keto. And great service! Thanks Rudy!!!

xkSNTbzMZX5AuHYVIU3CLw.text: Stopped in today at 3:00pm, bar was trashed, no employees, no hostess (wait to be seated? Yeah right!) to be seen nor heard.  Sat for 5 minutes.  Pretty sad, nix this DUMP from places to go!!  Needs management and employees

PzatdVLbyEwj3FpOCa2r8g.text: Found this restaurant driving through Tempe. Our server was Chantelle. She was very friendly and informative about the menu and beverages. I ordered everything she recommended and it was delicious. The halibut was perfect. The wine she recommended was a perfect pairing. Best service in years of dining out. Impressed, Chantelle made our night very special. We'll be coming back on her shifts specifically.

U7nfhGV6lqCzjEornqg-2w.text: Went in for dinner last night for an early dinner. My daughter had the swordfish that was recommended by the manager and I had blackened shrimp and scallops. Cassandra was very helpful in accommodating with our food allergies and making sure everything came out just right. Will be returning! No need to worry about gluten or dairy allergies here! Cassandra was so extremely helpful in the whole dining experience. Not all restaurants are this great!

2h8Xzz7GRRVt9_sEDt0c3A.text: To be honest, I had relatively low expectations.  However, it was actually pretty good.  Started with the lobster bisque (which they said is seasonal) it was quite good.  Ordered the macadamia nut crusted halibut and the seafood cob salad.  Both were good.    Oddly the place wasn't crowded.  I don't know if that is they way it is or what.  Although if Sunday night was a routine crowd, I'm not sure how they stay in business.  Nevertheless I think we'll be back again.

PWRQBrlAYa-Ge0n4wBDXhg.text: Kelsi did such a great job. She was smiling the whole time and gave us the BEST recommendations. I will go back to the business just cause of Kelsi.

QwL85-sFQcVwlTPc8UM2SQ.text: I am on the fence as to whether I go with a 2star on this review or a 3. THIS is when I wish there were half stars! It's not quite a 3 and yet not as low as a 2. Oh well, I digress. You get my point, I am sure. If not, you likely may after you read my review. I had this place bookmarked in my handy dandy Yelp bookmarks for months as places I needed to try. Being from the coast of Nor Californ I A , I crave , YEARN for seafood. Last weekend my hubby and I opted for King's Fish House over another seafood place that is also on our bookmarks and more towards his office because it looked fun and lively and the menu looked good. We were also in the neighborhood. I was on the fence with what to order once I saw the Filet and South African Lobster. Again, being picky, as I notably am, I asked the waitress about the lobster and the size of the filet. She could not give me sizes on either, rather, 'It's good size and the lobster is, BIG'. Okay. That's relative. I just did a hike with my husband and I were hungry! I also asked about the Shrimp and Crab Louie, again, one of those things I LOVE from home. Same answer, "It's BIG!" Clearly our waitress was excited about the menu and thats a good thing! She can't make my mind up, so I went with the Filet and Lobster. My husband ordered the Oysters Rockefeller. They seem to be prepared differently everywhere that we travel or dine, which is a lot and all over. Did I love these? No. It wasn't the oyster. It was the sauce. It was lemony and just had a strange consistency and looked odd to me. I could not get past that. I let my husband have at it. The next course that I had was the Clam Chowder. Loved it! It was lukewarm but was still so good. Again, being from just north of SF, the bar is set pretty high for clam chowder and this was very good. We asked for bread, a) because I feel clam chowder HAS to have good bread with it!, and b) we saw it on other guests table..Envy! Oh! Did I mention and can one tell from this review that my husband and I were HANGRY !! this particular night?! We finally flagged our waitress down for the bread and she explained that she didn't understand what was up with the kitchen and , 'they seemed to be out of it and it appeared that they were baking more'. I also asked about that  glass of Pinot Noir that I had ordered. She looked a little confused but got it. Now our dinner arrives. When I have any steak anywhere, I always check the done-ness of it first, because at times, its over done. This would be one of those times. This was more like medium to done in the center and no pink on the edges. The filet was also not juicy. Was it 'good sized' , as she claimed when I initially asked? No. This is where I always have an issue as a customer: DO I say anything? I mean, she seems busy! Am I being high maintenance? I've already asked for the bread; requested the late Pinot! NOW the filet is off! THEN as a Yelper, I leave a review and someone then messages me, or has and says , "Hey! Did you let the waitress know?" In this case, my husband says, " That is a $45. meal. We are telling her." The lobster was good. Not great. It was good. Maybe the food had sat for a few before she could get it to us? It happens on busy nights! I waitressed back in the day in college! I know how it goes! So she comes and we explain. She states that she will see if she can re-do it and a few minutes later she comes back to say they are re-doing a steak for me. Several minutes later, as my husband is pretty much done with his meal and I have finished most of my lobster and now down to the part of what is a baked potato that isn't fully done... (not raw, but not cooked enough to eat), out comes another filet with a different person who asks me to cut into it while she watches. I cut into the middle and it doesn't look medium rare either , but it did look juicer and hot. I do not want to deal with this all evening and I am pretty much over it at this point. She walks away and the same thing. This time the edges of the steak were even more done than the first! I would not think this is that difficult! I've cooked filets at home; its simple to get a medium rare steak! As I said, I was over trying to get it correct at that point. I did like what was cooked of the baked potato! I probably didn't need the entire thing anyway, as it was pretty big! The Sauteed Spinach side was cooked perfectly and I took that home after being full and added it to my eggs the next day. The Pinot was good, as well and the waitress, she totally tried! She was cheerful to the end with us! We thought she was great! Now the bus girl cleaning the table behind us who spilled water and then said, "OH SH*&! " in a whispering voice; Well. We heard that and that's probably not okay! The decor was nice and the patio seemed fun. We also liked being able to call ahead and get a reservation with no issues. See, it's not all bad. Would I come back? Probably not. Back to my bookmarks!

YPkw9rgVr5jDTNb5o_M0wA.text: They have fish, a good selection of it and decent quality.  I have been to other locations of this chain, was was not expecting too much for my lunch.  We starked with the ahi poke which was decent, could have used a little wasbi to enhance the flavors.  I shared a bit of the grilled artichoke appetizer, which for being healthy was great.  For my main I had the Seared Ahi Tuna $16.95 with 2 sides. The tuna was surprisingly great, thick, no sinuousness at all great color and flavor. The sides selection is also quite impressive and one can even have a small salad as one of the sides.  You can't avoid some of the chain quirks, like why am i given tartar sauce with seared ahi, and not soy and wasabi / ginger  Service was decent given our large group, and the ambiance is a notch above family casual, I would call it business casual.   Overall it is not a cheap meal, but good fish rarely is.

tTGSDHiTeDFTXGlNPB7LNA.text: My family and I went to King's Fish House for the first time last week and everyone was happy.  I love seafood but my wife does not.  I started off with a half dozen oyster sampler which I was told their selection changes everyday because everything is fresh.  We then had a candied walnut and blue cheese salad which I couldn't let me server take because I truly had to finish every last bite.  For my entree I had the Macadamia Nut Crusted Halibut which was cooked perfectly.  My wife, as I mentioned doesn't like seafood, had a filet.  It was ordered medium and cooked perfectly.  Along with the other dinner items we ordered, she couldn't have been more happy.    The service in the restaurant was on spot.  Our server was Ashley and she was amazing. However, when she was taking care of other tables, other servers came to make sure we were enjoying our experience there!  We will be back!  The only person that left unhappy was our son who had baby food for dinner.    P.S.  Have the Key Lime Pie!

9A2hsRnVIeXQBkfaJNR8nw.text: My first few trips to kings were average at best between the service and food. Most recently I went and had the best service I've ever had from Kelsi. She was energetic and professional. Kings kept me coming back for the food but after my encounter with Kelsi I will be making my way back more often! Thanks Kelsi!

-uN2cHVZpqsYBt50ZHtNfw.text: I went into Kings again and requested Kelsi as my server (since I had a good experience with her last time). Again, she was prompt and very friendly. She recommended the butter cake and it was delicious! Thanks Kelsi for the great food and service!!!! I'll be back!

vD1UjZwEkrldrVjJU6tYRg.text: Ashley, the manager on duty 10/21 was amazing! It was my son's girlfriends birthday and she made the night exceptional! Really great service, great food and a fantastic night! Everything was tasty but the oysters were the bomb! Thanks Ashley!

HLkr_lWLHa26IAFPk1hDeQ.text: $21.00 for 3 shrimps and 2 scalops. Very disappointed in the serving size. See photos!

Dx2t_pGO0ZKh-VqKvfygpA.text: ANOTHER terrific experience....  Michelle and her staff continue to impress us with terrific service and an exceptional menu. Our most recent dinner was superb; and despite the busy pace of the restaurant, our server kept up nicely, and everything was spot on.  We look forward to our next visit!

ciK6e3j8Fr0to-FehNy7qA.text: The food was mediocre and the service was just as mediocre as the food. Nothing to brag about but not horrible. Definitely not worth the price because of the lack of service. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

sJ30m4S8UnNwwkLLZxSyiQ.text: Great Halibut dinner. Really good, for a chain. Surprised (pleasantly) to see Hama Hama oysters and other fresh seafood in Tempe. Jessica took very good care of us, especially the little ones. We had a big group and quality was really good.  If you love bourbon, try the Old Fashioned from the well stocked bar.

1-vcUxbA518OnuH-kExRGQ.text: Very good experience, I don't really like sea food but the halibut(spell check) is really really good! I'll be back here for sure. Good job Michelle on this place.

o0GB7kFU7scki3oNPQ85nQ.text: Had a great time with friends, seafood was amazing!  Had a combo of oysters and clams, very fresh seafood. One of the highlights of the nite was our waiter Gilbert, by the end of the nite we were calling him Gilby!  He was friendly and very outgoing, great service!!

8LSkZf0E2JkyDYB_x1fucA.text: Four of us went to dinner here and two of us had to send our cold dinner back. The menu has changed from what it was before. They used to have a better selection and now the food had much to be desired . Too bad...the coconut shrimp they used to have was great.  We won't be going back soon at those prices.  J and K

zoUjEYMZ3gb5vpr8OgV2lw.text: Always wanted to eat here and we finally made it happen. Why didn't we do so earlier?  Michael treated us like family and we left full!  Great selection of seafood for everyone's taste, and save room for dessert!

z8k05YzJFsvGfJoSu_mNXQ.text: I go to Tempe about once every five years. It's just not convenient for me and, other than ASU, there's nothing there that I can't find closer to home.  On the way home from an awesome car show at Falcon Field in Mesa my wife wanted to pop into Tempe Marketplace. It was lunchtime so we stopped in at King's.  The service was terrific. The ambiance is great and the New Orleans jazz is easy on the ear. But, I came here to eat and I wasn't disappointed.  I had rainbow trout with a side of rice and corn on the cob (which they cut off the cob). My wife had Mexican shrimp on a skewer with a mixed veggie side and rosemary potatoes. Both dishes were excellent.   I may have to come to Tempe more often.

WIJZsuMN4u9XUt5McP58YQ.text: Went there on a client lunch and was pleasantly surprised at how good it was. I had the Parmesan Crusted Sand Dabs which also came with two sides so I had the sauteed spinach and house salad. Everything was so fresh and so good.   We had a group of 7 and service was great. I will definitely be going back!

Vzj8m0trCgl8qzrqIFUbbg.text: Had lunch with a friend.  The server was just outstanding.  Cassandra spent just the right amount of time with us and was very attentive to our needs. Just a perfect personality.  Kudos to her.  The spinach was great, but I would be remiss if I did not say my sea bass was overcooked. Not enough to complain about, but I expect better from a seafood kitchen.  I certainly finished it all..

wAoWjc5j5XCI1NikXGlOPQ.text: Wow.  I had a remarkable dinner from start to finish.  There was a generous portion of salad with fresh greens and and home made blue cheese.  The flatware to the stemware were top of the line and the fish was amazing.  Don't forget the butter cake.  The dessert the main courses and staff are incredible.

6IqGAsLadP-NLCMm_SdOkg.text: I took my girlfriend on a date the other night and had absolutely fabulous service. My server was kaylin and she did an amazing job! Definitely coming back for those kumamoto oysters and the bottle service

m0H0CM7G9R4sWLxeB-zDcg.text: The food was good and service was excellent. I was only confused when we came in. Didn't know whether to wait or seat ourselves.

Qgi0Hu_GZXW8grs7O1rBTA.text: Came in with my friend around 3 and had no one greeting us to get a table. I had to beg someone to get my disabled friend a seat.  Waitress was slow getting to our table and forgot to get my friend a second glass of wine. She finally had to go to the bar to ask for another glass and there was probably only five people in the whole place.  The salad that was $8 was a handful of salad which wasn't worth the money.

kErnPYeVktnOzIiAB_ZI7A.text: Ordered a large sushi platter. Worst sushi my Fiance and I have ever had. Tasted old and was not fresh at all. Almost as if they thawed frozen fish to make the rolls. Also ridiculously over priced menu for farmed fish. Can't speak for other items on the menu as this was our first time here. Service was good.

fbZZkW3l7g-SSEhK1KqwMw.text: This place is OK. I ordered broiled Oregon Red Rock fish, which, the first time it was brought to me, was WAY over cooked.. The nice thing about this place is their service. They were very accomodating, they had no problem redoing my fish. In fact, they brought me a whole new plate! and offered free dessert! (thank you Chris, our server) The second fish, was ok, probably more my mistake for ordering a bland fish (I wanted to try something different) then their cooking methods. But,at least it was not over cooked the second time, but definitly needed salt (and maybe a sauce on the side??)  My husband, however, loved his meal. He had swordfish picatta, which he throughly enjoyed. For the prices on the menu, I did expect more...presentation wasn't exactly bon appetit worthy....If I'm paying so much for a fish, it would be nice to see a little creativity...  I did think it was nice that they print a new menu everyday (check the top right hand corner for the day's date), kind of a nice touch.   To sum up, I give 2 stars for food, 4 stars for service (so I put it in the middle for the rating of this review).

2oc4GCsuWMYRk5tjaH2eIA.text: We try to come here on every vist to AZ. I like this location way better than the one in Long Beach. And I live in Long Beach and used to work at that location. LOL. The service was prompt and friendly. The server asked if we would like the kid's food with the appetizers which is always nice. He answered all of our questions and gave suggestions. The food was hot and tasty. Everyone enjoyed their meals. We had a good time.

LZ3MRZ1OZsZxWAHfbDDBsw.text: It is my pleasure to write my second review. The artichoke was yummy.  The King's combo platter was delicious. The meal seemed to take a little longer than usual however, Jessica made up for it by offering great service. It was wonderful for her to mention her boss, Michelle, in a positive light. Having met Michelle in the past my heart was warmed.  My husband and I enjoyed our date night very much!

lJc4YGHxeF_QtB2icDZCKg.text: Stopped by for a couple drinks and dinner with a work friend of mine recently on a Wednesday night.  The place wasn't packed, and we sat inside at the bar.  The mussels were ok, and the salmon sushi roll was better than I expected - considering it's in the desert and a regional chain.  It's in a unique spot in Tempe marketplace, and I knew parking would not be easy, but I didn't care.  I found the service to be very good and helpful.  I would go back.

7AENU6VAcalWmg9Qwi5qtg.text: Korey was an awesome bartender. He was so friendly, fun and knowledgeable. Food was great, try the shrimp taquitos. Can't wait to go back for the fresh lobsters and oyster bar. They also have a great assortment of cocktails!

Myz1Ygf5OS-BuXcimn647A.text: Much better this time around.  The GM, Kari, sent us gift certificates after my negative review, with an apology. We gave King's a second chance on Saturday night.  This time, we were seated in the bar area, which had a lot more pleasant atmosphere (less diner-y and loud, with a view through the bar window of the Tempe Marketplace fountain). Our server, Nicole, was much more attentive and pleasant than our last server. She even brought bread out before we even ordered - yay!  The food was greatly improved as well - we didn't order the same things, but usually if a place sucks, it sucks all the way around. Boyfriend did the Captain's Platter (fried scallops and fish) and really liked it; fried without the meat being overcooked, still juicy. I did the Seafood Cobb Salad, and it was really excellent - the shrimp were so flavorful and the salad was HUGE. They did not skimp on any of the ingredients. I'd definitely get it again.  The bread pudding was... different. My other half really liked it (it's drowning in Jack Daniels sauce, of course he did) but the texture was strange to me; reminded me of French toast, it was mostly bread in sauce, not really "pudding" to me. It was very good though.  I'm glad to be able to re-write my review positively :)

unLp2qeCjOPGQuxtXyt7zA.text: Awlful. Place is more than half empty and food still took 50 min to get out. Half the plates were cold from sitting around in the kitchen. Waiter tells us the food was held up because of so many sushi orders at other tables......what orders! This place is empty and the people that are dont have sushi in front of them either.

M5dYK4zhFRB6rq3Q95WRpA.text: Just had one of the best meals of the year! Everything was delicious; from the starter bread to the last bite. The side of coleslaw was absolutely perfect, and would've been a better meal than most places by itself. Lump crab - Amazing, Caesar salad - fresh and crisp. Main course was everything we were hoping for and some. Service was a delight and the atmosphere was alive and well, without being too loud. Can't wait til our next visit.

alrFH0zWvv6nLCO_LOksxA.text: Came in and had incredible service by Daniel. Food was amazing and drinks were perfect. I highly recommend kings and I highly encourage being waited on by Daniel. His attention to detail is superb.

9xaCUdHdhPU7BMihbApYqQ.text: Why is this Kings still open ? I have being going to kings for 4/5 years and the only reason I keep going back is because I always forget how bad it is .  the food sucks  the service sucks  the management sucks   Hey Mr King shut her down ! Your staff don't care and your hemorrhaging money . Cut your losses and call it a day .

ht7askuKzn5kPcYBEbOplA.text: Food was great, service was fast & the atmosphere was nice. We are surely enjoyed our first time here.  I recommend trying the HOT n' SPICY POKE TUNA !! so BOMB !!

2dMfmaJQ2ujFufhIsTRvlg.text: Great lunch, decent prices, great service, really fresh seafood, perfect ambiance! Definitely coming back!

0PdVMNfG3mqQgSghYx6qhg.text: It's that time of year.... time to figure out what overly priced restaurant to pick out for my office holiday party. Hey, the boss is buyin' not me. :-)  We settled on King's Fish House, and I am glad we did.   We had a reservation for 6pm for 8 people, figuring we would show up early and get our much needed drink on at the bar. They were very slow when we arrived so we has the bar to ourselves. ***Incoming - Reason for the 5 starts*** The bar chairs are the best! Big, cushy and have backs, AND they have hooks under the bar top for my bad. Honestly, this is such a small touch, but some places fail so miserably at these two key elements that I never go back. Seriously though, if you are in the market for a bar with awesome bar seats, you have to go here! It's genius! If your seats suck I wont stay as long, if they are nice I wont want to move, duh!  Back to the matter at hand, we had a drink then sat down for dinner, Chris was our server and we were very pleased with him. *high five to Chris* He went thought the menu very well and explained everything we were unsure about. We started off with a handful of appetizers, a few oyster shooters, the combo plate with calamari and shrimp and crab cakes, and some salads. The shooters were shooters, decent quality, can't really screw them up. The fried stuff was good, but nothing to gloat about. Their ramoulade sauce was awesome though! Even ordered an extra side to go with my dinner. The salads looked ehh underwhelming. The Danish Blue that I got was ok, the highlight was the huge slice of blue cheese it came with, the rest was an after thought.   Everyone got something different for the entrees and I am pretty sure everyone was happy because the chatter was to a minimum while we stuffer our faces. I got the Grilled Salmon with mac'n'cheese and grilled zucchini, excellent all around!  We topped off the nigh with some Creme Brulee..... not too bad. I prefer it thinner then they serve it but I was still in creme heaven.   We were all very happy, great place! Enjoy if you make it in!

DjCpOgtJbWCOOisPbeq76w.text: Came back again tonight with friends. We had the macadamia crusted salmon this time and it was delicious. Some of the best fish in the valley. $143 for 4 people including drinks, very good value for the money
